Reviews.Title: “Great things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: jaydeTT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in early April for 10 days. Enjoyed every minute of it! Decided on this hotel based on the very useful Trip Advisor reviews. Great service at the served breakfast from Tammy and the other Front Desk staff including Diana, Juan and the rest of the Front Desk crew. Staff members were very helpful and gave good advice on things to do and places to visit. Appreciated the free, wonderful amenities. Loved the chocolates! Thanks for making me feel at home, away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Conor D
Reviews.Content: St. Regis was a great find and one of the best parts of our stay in vancouver. They were extremely friendly and helpful. They provided every possible assistance from personally showing us to the parking spots when we arrived to loading our car for us in the rain when we were leaving. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The best thing about the regis for us was the amazing (and enormous, breakfast which is served personally to your table. Apparently, it is uncommon in Canada to have breakfast included but breakfast, internet and unlimited phone calls were all "complimentary" at the Regis. Only the parking was not free. All in all, it is one of the best hotels i ever stayed in and would certainly recommend it to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “All around terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: nbm5b
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before choosing the St. Regis for a conference. I debated having a view and more convenience to the Convention center where most sessions would be, vs the calm and boutique nature of the St. Regis. I am very happy I chose the St. Regis! I stayed in a Queen room which was just the right size on the 4th floor. The **free** wifi, water, chocolate on the bed everyday, breakfast, AND printing of a presentation were icing on the cake. I like to compare this hotel to a Kimpton although with more perks! The hotel staff were all very, very helpful--they made excellent suggestions for dinner, directions, transportation, etc. I only had beer at the adjacent pub and breakfast each morning. It is the same breakfast daily (which someone complained about in a post I read a few months ago) - but there's a Tom Horton's across the street for those who want more choices. Location-wise, the St. Regis is perfect if you like to walk in this walking-friendly town--I walked to Gastown, waterfront, & Stanley Park. There are a lot of big, swank hotels in the area, but if you want a boutique experience with extra TLC and the free perks. This is your place!

Reviews.Title: “First choice for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: CluainLimerick
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located. You can walkout places and easy access to sky train. Hotel is a refurbished old building so standard rooms are a little small but fantastic amenities - safe, bathrobe, tea/coffee, fee wifi and phone calls including international. Great breakfast included. Bar/grill attached to hotel is reasonably. Big plus is the staff. Everyone helpful and friendly. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Sue C
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 1 night stay. The location suited our needs and was very central to attractions and public transport.Some different varieties of tea would accommodate our Aussie palates and the addition of a mueseli option to breakfast would have been appreciated. The decor was very pleasant and the rooms were spotlessly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Comme cí, comme ça”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights in June 2011. Hotel is located in the downtown area of the city, some attractions are within walking distance. Our room had louvred shutters rather than curtains, thus light streamed through the windows at 6.30am, ruining the sleep occasioned by the admittedly comfortable bed. Breakfast was a la carte in an uninspiring room off the bar area; buffet is my personal preference but the portions were adequate, choice somewhat restricted however. Wifi access patchy. Hotel has a lively bar, good atmosphere when the local ice hockey team (Canucks) wete in action. Nothing particularly memorable about the place, but no major gripes to report either

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Danymed
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two night stay over Easter weekend. Very friendly welcome. Room was nicely decorated, and well designed for a smaller space. Good sized bathroom. Breakfast was very good and again the staff was very helpful. Location is perfect for walking to many attractions.. This hotel is a gem in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, scrumptious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Tunde2
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves the accolades bestowed by the other reviewers. The staff we dealt with were outstanding. We stayed at the beginning and end of a week long Vancouver holiday and needed an early check-in on both days we stayed. This was accommodated graciously. Although the lack of a pool may put off families with children, the great breakfast attempts to make up for it! I think this would be ideal for a couple or business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “True value for money... St. Regis has it all! Comfort, location, service...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMx
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the St. Regis for the last 6 nights... first time in Vancouver and chose it basically following trip advisor reviews and I just need to recognize the value the St. Regis provides... it is basically a boutique 3-star hotel, but you get the experience of a 4.5 or 5 star hotel... my room (501) is not small by any means, comfortable bedroom, good size working area, closet and huge bathroom... the decor is contemporary but warm and inviting at the same time... The location is absolutely great... pretty easy to get from the airport (7.50 CAD from the Airport) and in the area plenty of restaurans, coffee shops, 7-elevens, etc... I did not experience any disturbing noise at night and the service I received from all the staff was truly outstanding... Therefore, I would definitely recommend the St. Regis for those looking for an amazing service in a boutique cosy place...

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the heart of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: volcom146
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for 5 nights on a leisure trip to Vancouver this month. The hotel is super easy to access from the airport, as the Skytrain takes you about two blocks from the lobby. After that, there is an even closer Skytrain station called Granville which is steps from the front door. The hotel is older and our standard room was quite small, but really comfortable and one of the cleanest one's I've ever stayed in. High quality bedding and room finishes. Our only complaint would be the loud street below, as it kept us up the first night and we were on the top floor. Ask for a room away from the street if possible, because weekend partying can be incredibly loud. As for the staff, they were super helpful. The breakfast servers were very friendly and the breakfast itself is one of the best you can get for it being included! The front desk staff also had great customer service and accommodated all of our needs (calling taxi's, holding bags for us after check-out, borrowing umbrella's, etc). Overall, highly recommended if you want to be within walking distance to everything downtown, and want to stay in a clean and modern heritage hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One nighter”
Reviews.Author: Clark W
Reviews.Content: My kids and I wanted to visit for one night in the middle of seeing family in Northern Washington. Wonderful staff, nice location and access to the gym was wonderful. The kids really enjoyed the heated floor in the bathroom!! In addition, the breakfast in the morning got us off to a great start with our sightseeing. We will stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went out of their way...impressed by cooked breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Caroline B
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the St. Regis while in Vancouver on business. Meryl and the front desk staff went out of their way to troubleshoot my internet connection, trying new cables, offering me alternate computer and phoning tech support and the like. I was really thrilled to be able to use the Steve Nash sports facility at 5 in the morning (being from the East I often find myself awake at the hour....and a run around the seawall is not an option in the dark). I loved being served the three-choice full breakfast at my table rather than the usual buffet, which is often the norm when breakfast is included. Hotel rooms clean, cozy and modern. The St. Regis Bar and Grill offers a variety of gluten-free options which I really enjoyed. The manager and staff at the Bar and Grill were very helpful and friendly....five stars all round.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little nook in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: GalFromAway
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful and friendly staff, awesome breakfast included with room rate, great bar and grill attached, and right downtown close to Sky Train and Canada Place. This was the perfect place to stay, and definitely somewhere I'd stay again. I stayed here when in town for a work function, and enjoyed the St Regis immensely. Free wireless internet, free long distance phone calls, close to our event venue, within a half hour walk of Stanley Park (depending on how quickly you walk) and transportation to various tourist destinations.

Reviews.Title: “perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: pink0531
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the st regis for two nights in March 2012 and were stunned at how nicely kept the room was when we walked in. we knew we had made the best choice coming here. the room was spotlessly clean, the linens were incredible and my favourite was the bathroom - they even had the tiles heated! another top notch is their breakfast - it is not the standard hotel buffet style - it feels like you are at a proper eatery. you order what you want from a choice of 3 great options, plus coffee/tea and variety of juices. such a fantastic way to start your day! the hotel is also conveniently adjacent to the granville station, as well as the other train station that takes you straight to the airport in 20 minutes for $2.50! :D

Reviews.Title: “Lots to like if you know the town...”
Reviews.Author: Pen_Princess
Reviews.Content: Location is absolutely central to public transportation and great shopping. Rooms are terrifically appointed, the temperpedic beds rock, and the free phone calls anywhere in the world can't be beat. Three things keep this from a top review. First, try to avoid rooms that end in 2, 3, or 4. They are on the street, and the weekend party noise is pretty intense. Second, the breakfasts are adequate but not great: hard fruit, bland eggs, so-so pastries. The coffee is bad and I recommend going next door to Starbucks before heading down. And finally, the desk staff is not well informed regarding suggestions. I had to head over from the nearby business center to help a patron find the flea market and the restaurant ideas I got from them were banal. If you know Vancouver and you get a quiet room, this place would be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: miriamoly
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for two nights in early March 2012 in a queen room on the third floor above the corner of Dunsmuir and Seymour Streets, and were very happy with the accommodations. I chose the St. Regis because we arrived late at night via Amtrak, and I wanted a hotel close to a Skytrain station in case we arrived in bad weather. We were fortunate and had mild weather for our quick trip, but I still appreciated being right on top of Granville Station. We walked up Seymour Street to Harbour Centre and the Vancouver Lookout to enjoy the view, then stopped by the steam clock before heading to luch at Kita No Donburi (separate review). The hotel itself was wonderful, both in terms of comfort and service. I had noted on our reservation that we would be arriving late -- and when we walked in the door shortly before midnight, the desk staff had everything ready for us. The bed was very comfortable, not overly soft. Technophiles will be pleased with all the media cord outlets, plus speedy, easy to access wifi and an iPod/iPhone clock (beware -- we thought we had the iPod alarm set properly the first morning and overslept; thank goodness we requested a wake-up call the second morning, because we got it wrong again). The bathroom made up for the lack of tub (who uses a hotel tub?) with a wonderfully adjustable shower head (a luxury for my 10 year old daughter). The floor was heated (bliss at 5:00 a.m.). There was an illuminated make-up mirror (when did I get so many wrinkles?) as well as comfy robes. Breakfast in the very attractive, club-atmosphere basement dining room is made-to-order and offers choices including eggs, fruit, and pastry. We were very grateful to the staff for packing breakfast boxes for us (which were ready at the front desk) to take along for our early train departure (just make sure to ask for this the night before). Every staff person we encountered was gracious and cheerful. The physical accomodations were impeccable (with the tiny exception of our bathroom door, which didn't shut fully -- not a huge problem for mother and daughter), and the location was perfect for us. I would happily return to the St. Regis next time I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, lovely, & great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lybc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference at the Conference Center and it was lovely. Great location: grocery store a few blocks away; many restaurants; short walk to conference center and sea wall (perfect for running as it leads into Stanley Park); Starbucks downstairs; and convenient public transport to/from airport. I especially appreciated the breakfast: many fresh choices; open early; included in rate. The room was small but perfectly adequate since I was alone. The only drawback was noise from the street one night. Woke me up (but I'm a light sleeper) but it wasn't terrible.

Reviews.Title: “excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyle S
Reviews.Content: Last minute changes to our inerary left us in Vancouver without accomodation. The St. Regis was an amazing find for us. Great staff and an excellent facility with an amazing breakfast.Our entire experience was positive and supportive throughout. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel right in the centre”
Reviews.Author: fmcd-dublin
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is located in a rather plain-looking "heritage building" right in the centre of Vancouver. It has been completely modernised in recent years and has fine rooms with all the usual facilities. One word of caution: though double-glazed, noise from traffic on Dunsmuir Street at the front and a brace of air-handling units on a low roof at the rear still penetrates the rooms. Breakfast is included in the price and served by cheerful staff in the basement. Two eggs "any style" are on offer, but strangely for a boutique hotel there are no egg cups if you want them boiled! The St Regis Bar & Grill next door also serves good food, including an excellent chicken Caesar salad. Staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful, even printing off online bookings at no extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel at an Amazing Price”
Reviews.Author: Andrew G
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this place is beautiful! The service was exemplary, the atmosphere was both relaxed and professional, the amenities were perfect. Overall, I didn't want to leave this place. Also, if you are as much of a gym aficionado as I am, you'll love that they partner with the Steve Nash Sports Club down the block. It's a great gym!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've stayed at Ever!”
Reviews.Author: envirodog
Reviews.Content: I travel for work a lot and this in one of the best experiences I have had in a very long time. The staff really go above and beyond what I have come to expect. I arrived early and my room wasn’t ready but I left my luggage with the front desk. When I came back to check in my luggage was already placed in the walk in closet in my room. I knew this hotel included breakfast but I wasn’t expecting a nice dining room with a waitress and a menu with hot items and many choices…and all for FREE. I locked myself out of my room by accident and when I called the front desk someone was there to help me in less than a minute!! Even the staff in the adjoining pub where really fast and attentive. Oh – and the room was nice too. I would definitely stay here next time I am in downtown Vancouver as you can't beat the location either.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Forsche
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service, breakfast included, bacon, eggs, fruit. Close to everything, at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Krecke1
Reviews.Content: Located right by the train station, beautifully decorated, no expense spared by the hotel. Very very impressed. Would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: coachboon
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business in Feb. This is a very good location. Very easy to get to from the airport. The Canada Line train costs $8.50 from the airport and only $3.50 to the airport. There's an airport tax hence the difference but substantially cheaper than a taxi and every bit if not easier to travel to and from. It's only a block from the "train" station so unless you have loads of bags, this is the best way to travel - fast too. I also liked the free unlimited long distance as well as not charging for bottle water. Don't you just hate that nickel and dime stuff when hotels charge usury prices on water? The breakfasts were good with a choice of 3 meals and very fast. The bed was comfortable. The decor was nice. Had the nice marble flooring been heated (a product we make), this would have made the stay fantastic. The staff are knowledgeable about the area so don't be afraid to ask them. They sent me to a superb (high end) jeweler that is not a retail outlet. You won't get in without a reference from St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rgoligh
Reviews.Content: We spent some time reviewing hotels in Vancouver and decided on the St Regis for its location, reviews & apparent value in comparison to other options in the area. We booked the smart queen with breakfast included for a 3 night stay. The staff are friendly and very helpful and the room is superb. The decor is tasteful and the furniture, bed and bathroom fixtures are all high quality. The building is full of old character and charm but all the decor and furnishings are new. The room is also quiet and well sound proofed.The location is also good, only being a short walk to the waterfront,main shopping area and resturants.Honestly cannot praise the hotel more and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming room, friendly staff and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: BMigales
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks like brand new. Rooms and lobby are very well decorated and furnished. Location is excellent. Just a few steps from Pacific Centre and a few blocks to Robson St and the shore. We took a lovely scenery walk to Stanley Park (as suggested by a member of the always kind and helpful front staff). Complimentary delicious hot breakfast, bottled water in the room, wifi internet and local and long distance calls were certainly a plus. Only comments were yhe low pressure shower and having a single small elevator. Amazing experience. Wish could always find a hotel like this in every city I visit.

Reviews.Title: “So Welcoming and Helpful.”
Reviews.Author: roberciku
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have rounded off our roadtrip in a better way. Landing here at the end of an exhausting yet amazing journey was just so perfect. Despite us having four enormous snowboard bags and other luggage, they were incredibly helpful bringing them in with us and storing them for us, even making sure that we were ok parking while we unloaded. Full-service hot breakfast was included in the very reasonable price, most unusual, and free phone calls worldwide too included in the rate. The rooms themselves too were really smartly turned out, everything you could possibly want was provided. Service at reception too was really efficient and friendly, and to top it all it was smack bang in the middle of downtown Vancouver, a stone's throw from Gastown, and had a connecting bar next door. Really was the perfect end.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of December. Central city location not far from several train stations. Relatively small hotel with none of the pointless facilities of the big chains such as shops, spas, etc. Excellent comfortable rooms - extremely comfortable huge bed, large bathroom with a good shower over the bath, tea and coffee facilities in the room, large flat screen tv. Good quality breakfast - maybe some people would find the choices a bit limited - its not a buffet but ordered from a menu (you can mix and match the choices) and delivered to you at your table by very cheerful employees. Free internet and phone calls - yes even international calls! Easy walking distance to almost everywhere in central Vancouver. When we checked in we were offered passes for a nearby gym but we didn't use them. Sports bar / restaurant attached to the hotel - looked nice though we didn't eat there. Highly recommended and great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Molly D
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel is unlike any that we've experienced in a very long time - in a good way! Ryan at the front desk was fabulous! Our room was ready and we were allowed to check in 3 hours early, which is unheard of. He loaned us an umbrella, gave us a map and sent us to a restuarant that he personally recommended, which was also fabulous. You can't beat the location for this hotel, if you're looking for proximity to shopping, restuarants, Robson Street, etc... Not to mention the freebies - free wifi, international calls, Fiji water, breakfast, etc... We personally recommend Gotham for drinks and dessert, if you're looking for a fun place late night. It's literally right around the corner from the St. Regis. We'll definitely stay here again the next time that we're in Vancouver. You can't beat it for the value and location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: denhamania
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights as part of a Wetserna Canada tour in September 2011. St Regis has a bar next door serving "pub grub" style food if your room is not quite ready. Rooms were fitted with quality fxitures and fittings & front desk customer service was excellent very professional and friendly. Well located and within walking distance of most city sights. Try the Cactus Club Cafe just a 5 minutes walk for an excellent dinner in upbeat surroundings with good food and a nice vibe. Make sure you cycle the Stanley Park sea wall - great fun for all ages, all on level paved paths. I would have no hesitation in recommending the St Regis for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a tremendous value.”
Reviews.Author: Star_Child79
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is an absolutely ideal hotel for the business traveler. Ryan and Juan (if I recall their names correctly) at the front desk were very helpful and extremely courteous. The all-inclusive cooked to order breakfast is a huge vale and very tasty. Not to mention the free world wide long distance calling, awesome! The rooms are very well appointed and always kept very clean. I thoroughly enjoyed the passes to the Steve Nash health club, perfect for my morning workout routine. Should I find myself in Vancouver again, I know where I’ll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: mmccormi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St Regis for one night in a queen corner room. The hotel has worked hard to separate itself from the other large major players downtown and it shows. Excellent boutique experience and lots of "value add" that make the guest feel special and unique. With only 65 rooms, its personal and has a real European feel (translate to the elevator is tiny but efficient!). Besides being clean and well appointed, loved the extras including an awesome makeup mirror in the bathroom, heated bathroom floor, fitness pass, free wireless (are you reading that big box hotels!!) and free long distance calling!! Staff were really really well trained and it showed. Well done St Regis!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Lil_Bee2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St Regis for 2 nights in early May of 2011. Room is clean and the washroom is spotless with heated floor, we were impressed! Love the Fiji bottle of water. The location is excellent that we walked to most places (Gastown, Chinatown, Granville street..etc.) Took the bus to the Granville island market (do not miss this, lots of good eats). Lots small restaurants and shops around the hotel, there is a coffee shop and also a drugmart across the street from the hotel. We had a excellent stay, the staff is most helpful and the hot breakfast is very satifying. Wouldn't think off stay anywhere else when we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: MsKSP
Reviews.Content: Great location. Right near Gastown, downtown shopping, skytrain. Staff was awesome, room was comfortable and not noisy on the fifth floor. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Entirely civilized, close to YVR Skytrain.”
Reviews.Author: Dale G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the SR twice, flying out of and back into YVR on business. The proximity of the SR to the southbound Skytrain to YVR was a big consideration and that worked out beautifully. It's a 3 minute walk, mostly covered, to the Downtown Skytrain terminal and a tidy 25 minutes or so to YVR for less that 5 bucks. The SR itself is really a first rate hotel. Both rooms I stayed in were spotlessly cleaned, smelled nice, were modern with all new luxury materials and fittings, very classy staff who were prompt and thorough in every way. Parking is in a secure, heated garage in the building next door, but it's an easy 2 minute walk back to the hotel front door. There is really nice dining within easy walking distance. I ate at the Gotham steakhouse and the Shore Club, both within 25 meters of the SR front door, and both were excellent. SR breakfast lounge is a bit utilitarian, but the breakfasts were fast and more than adequate, particularly for a complimentary breakfast. Internet and all phone calls are included which is a really nice touch for business travel. Most hotels charge ridiculous, insulting fees for both these basic services. Nicely done, SR. On balance, this was one of the more pleasant hotel experiences I've encountered. The SR is a smaller organization than the giant, multinational hotel chains with a business model that seems to be based on a superior client experience, and that difference is apparent in every detail. It's my new downtown Vancouver hotel, no question.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2nd stay at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: Frankie K
Reviews.Content: 2nd time here. Jeremy (the General Manager) personally checked us in an hour before check-in and took our bags up. There is also Juan at the front desk who was very knowledgeable, articulate and patient. Our room was on the top floor (5th) facing the street. The amenities are quite in line with any other world class boutique hotel. Excellent size room, heated floors in the bathroom, complimentary Fiji bottled water, mints on turndown service. Road noise is apparent due to the location of the property but that disadvantage turns rosy during the daytime as there is a Tim Hortons (open till 2am) and an A&W restaurant (open 24hrs) right across the street. High end shopping like Holt Renfrew is available to your wallet a block away. Complimentary day passes to the Steve Nash Sports Gym. Right next to the Granville Skytrain station which is a much nicer way to get around the city than the car. Complimentary full breakfast available in the lower level of the hotel. Elevator only accessible by room keycard and cctv cameras everywhere which made us feel safe. Special mention to the housekeeping staff. Smooth sailing all the way. Except for the Moda hotel down the street, this is the only hotel I would stay at for any length of time in Van city. -Mr.Frankie &Ms.Jamil

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: lassiesmom
Reviews.Content: Perfect weekend getaway! We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and they were spot on. This hotel is a jewel -- a gorgeous, completely refurbished brick building in downtown Vancouver, beautifully appointed rooms, immaculate top to bottom, and absolutely the best service we've received - perhaps anywhere! Plus a huge, hot breakfast included. We will most certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Book it now!”
Reviews.Author: actoryogi
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas in Vancouver this year, and the St. Regis Vancouver couldn't have been a better place to spend it. In addition to affordable rates, a friendly staff and large clean modern rooms, the hotel boasted some free extras that really made the difference. While most places ding you for everything, St Regis offers Free internet access both in room and on the computers off the hotel lobby, Free unlimited INTERNATIONAL long distance calls (which was great for Christmas calls to the family), and Free breakfast with a variety of options.... all of which were delicious, with the exception of the cantaloupe! If you like to explore when you take vacation, the location really couldn't be better. It's literally steps to two underground Metro lines and close to a major shopping area, museum, restaurants and the must-see Stanley Park. Super easy access directly to/from the airport using the Metro. Stop researching hotel's now and just book this one. You won't get a better value for the money. Seriously!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, luxurious boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Marvay
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just came back from an overnight trip to Vancouver in search of the perfect graduation dress for her. I used to live in Vancouver, so am very familiar with the downtown area. I saw the excellent reviews for this hotel and decided we'd stay there. I knew it was in an excellent location for us: in the midst of the shopping area, close to a Skytrain (rapid transit) station, and close to restaurants and galleries. From the moment we checked in to our departure, we received superb, thoughtful service. We didn't need a suite, so we chose a Smart room, which was lovely. I was very impressed with the layout of the room, the attention to detail, like proper lighting for people who like to read and the bathroom, which was beautiful. Our beds were very comfortable, with very high quality linen. We were on the back side of the hotel, on the fourth floor, so it was very quiet and we slept well. Our room rate included breakfast, which was a "full breakfast" and that it truly was! It was delicious and filling. I recognize it's now off-season for Vancouver hotels, but the value for money was still incredible. My husband and I will stay in this hotel on our next trip to Vancouver. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectation.”
Reviews.Author: Kitty180
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the St. Regis and had no problem with the street noise except on Saturday night but it's bearable. A nicely refurbished hotel although the standard rooms ae not big but okay for two persons. An upgrade comes with a seperate sitting area and the bedrooms are more or less the same size. Bathroom is very nice. All the staff we met are so friendly and welcoming. Breakfast is good althought the breakfast room is dated comparing to the rest of the hotel. Something brighter and more cheerful will help to start the morning off nicely. We think it's a good experience and good value especially with the winter rate. The location is perfect with sky train and other amenities all within short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money in the heart of vancouver”
Reviews.Author: travelmusings
Reviews.Content: We visited vancouver in mid-december and stayed at st. regis. We booked their $99/night promotion for 3 nights. The location was ideal just a few blocks away from granville st and the waterfront. The service was attentive and polite from check in to check out. This hotel is located in a historic building. We could not locate the parking when we arrived since the approach is from an alley behind the hotel, very easy to miss. The rooms are small but are clean and have a boutique like feel. The tiny elevator can be a problem but we chose to use the stairway for the most part except when we had luggage. The breakfast was by far one of the best I've had while staying at hotels, worth every reason getting up for in the morning. Really great value for those looking to stay in the heart of Vancouver and who want to be in the middle of the action. Pros + Heated floors in the bathroom + Hearty complimentary breakfast + Service + Free wifi (although it's annoying to sign in each time) + Free bottled water + Free international calls Cons - Parking was a bit of a walk from the hotel and pricey - Cramped elevator, having just one elevator is a bottleneck and can cause long wait times at busy hours

Reviews.Title: “Great service, all departments”
Reviews.Author: Jerry E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our first visit to the St. Regis. Service was outstanding, from check-in to check-out and everything in between. Everyone, from management to chamber personnel, was friendly, professional and efficient. The hotel itself is wonderful -- we especially enjoyed the art -- and it's a great location. We would love to come back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, location, and service!”
Reviews.Author: CA22
Reviews.Content: Read the prior reviews on TA, and decided on St. Regis in part due to their anniversary special. This 5 story boutique hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms were average size, but very nicely decorated and had modern amenities and finishes, such as travertine shower/tile, quality fixtures, and quality linens. Loved the bathrobes also - provided a pampering touch. Single-serve coffeemaker worked well, with surprisingly good coffee. The included made-to-order breakfast was also better than expected. Limited menu, but very fresh and tasty. The staff were pleasant, attentive, and went over and above to help us with luggage, directions, and suggestions for dining and attractions. The location of this hotel is perfect - pretty much directly in the middle of the city with tons of walkable shopping, dining, & entertainment. I would most definitely choose this hotel on my next trip to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff. Not a Starwood resort.”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights on a long weekend away. We used points to stay these. I chose the hotel because of the good deal and because I thought it was connected to the St. Regis chain. Despite that, the hotel is a quality boutique hotel. There is a nice breakfast provided. The hotel is centrally located. The critiques I have are the size of the rooms - small; Windows are poorly insulated; Bathroom is not well heated - but has a cold window; The noise factor doesn't bother me but there is a low din if traffic occasionally. The other thing that was frustrating is that a number of staff were unable to answer what should be easy questions about where to catch a bus or the sky train. When we Asked a number of questions they had to jump on google to find an answer. If I needed google, I could search myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value right in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: 2night stay in a Queen room at $135CAD/night Pros - Location great, right outside SkyTrain from the airport (less than 30mins). Right in the middle of the city centre but not very noisy. - Nice semi boutique furnishing although room slightly small. - Complementary wifi and wired internet access. - Complementary cooked breakfast provided. There is a business lounge with 2 computers and printer available. - Complementary local and international calls! - Complementary bottled water. Cons - Only one elevator can be a little slow at times, but it was only a short walk down the stairs. - Master switch for all room/bathroom lights by the door (it also operates bedlights). It needs to be switched on to operate any lights including bathroom (woke my wife up when I needed to go to the bathroom). Overall a great hotel. 5 star location. Staff great. Numerous complementary additions make you feel welcome. The negatives are few and minor which should not deter guests from staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Treakleboy
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on TA we booked for a three night stay over new year. The Hotel is small but wonderful. Our room was on the forth floor and ideal for the two of us, not massive, but a lovely and clean, fantastic bed and great bathroom, we really don't wan't much more..... but there is. The staff are great, not pushy or overly intrusive, just polite and helpful. Free WIFI, Great breakfast provided by polite and 'smilly' people and a great sports bar attached to the side of the hotel that's easy going and welcoming. Location can't be faulted for exploring Vancouver and we managed to walk everywhere we wanted to go thanks to the central location to everything. If your arriving at Vancouver airport, just jump on the train, it's easy! You can stay as other 'posh' hotels if you really want, but if your after somewhere a little bit different and fantastic value for money then I'd suggest that this is the place for you.... we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Hotfootedkiwi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 1 night stop over in Vancouver. We selected St Regis and so glad we did. Fantastic value for money with nice clean modern rooms. Very helpful staff and the incl breakfast was ore than what we expected. Fantastic downtown location, easy walk to key shopping areas, Stanley park and gas town. Would also recommend the St Regis bar and grill, fantastic food with very generous servings.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond one expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jbeaudoin
Reviews.Content: Beautiful renovated boutique hôtel, ideally located. Skytrain within 20 feet, shops restaurants, very comfortable rooms and lovely décor. Day passes to one of the nicest gyms located within 3 min. walking distance. Great breakfast, included in hôtel price!!!!! Above and beyond, very friendly staff, go the extra mile to live up to all demands!!! Congratulations to all the team, you do an amazing job, looking forward to coming back!!! J. Beaudoin

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Joy B
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to make a very last minute trip to Vancouver BC. We looked at others reviews and decided this was the hotel we wanted to stay in. After checking prices on the hotels website with other websites we found a lower price contacted the hotel and they agreed to match it immediately (which is the hotels policy but I thought it might be more of a hassle as has happened to us at other places.) First I would like to list the cons because there really weren't that many but if you are taking a car you have to stop in the 3 minute spot beside the hotel, put your flashers in, and get a parking pass. Parking is $25 a day with unlimited in/out access, but we ended up walking and using the bus instead of taking the car out. We had read about the parking cost per day but didn't read about having to get the pass from the front desk and ended up having to drive around the block a few times in the dark so hopefully this will make it easier for the next guests. Also if you are looking for a hotel with a pool this is not the place for you as they do not have one, it wasn't an issue for us because we were there for the sights! On to the pros -- everything else! The hotel staff is amazing and go out of their way to make your stay fantastic! The carried our bags in and got us settled into our room. The rooms were an adequate size but not small as mentioned in other reviews (we had a room with two double beds, two nightstands, a tv stand, and a desk) but the decor is great and the bathroom was very spacious. Employees were great about giving us directions and recommendations for local sights and restaurants, offered to book events for our family and are able to switch our US money for Canadian money (but only $100). They offer umbrellas for daily use which you might need, free WiFi (worked wonderfully), and iPads that you can rent (but we didn't). Any request we had was meet with a smile and prompt results! Finally the food at the hotel. Breakfast was included in the cost of our room and was one of the best we have had. It included juice, coffee/tea, breads (pastries, toast, or bagel), eggs cooked to your preference OR waffles OR an omelet, potatoes, meat (bacon, sausage, ham), and fruit. The first day we let the kids order what they wanted but the breakfast portion was huge so the second day we scaled it down a bit. Also as a person with lots of food allergies I was still satisfied with the amount of food I could eat. I had ham, potatoes, and fruit with tea and OJ. We also ordered room service from the hotel by calling the front desk. Again even with food allergies and making requests for changes from the menu our food was delivered within 20 minutes and was great! Finally I wanted to address noise issues that I had read about in another review. We were on the second floor and found that we didn't hear our neighbors except for a couple of doors closing or road traffic except for an ambulance. We never heard the people above us or beside us, we were in at a decent time at night and then out during the day. This hotel is very family friendly but is also able to cater to any other type of traveler! The public transportation is very close (bus a couple of blocks away), train station underground in the next building. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will be returning there ourselves in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: bellfc1
Reviews.Content: Not only is the location perfect, the service we received was second to none! the issue we had was dealt with in an extremely professional manner and an incredible stay was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start a holiday”
Reviews.Author: SydFam40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis for 4 nights in December and thoroughly enjoyed our time here. As we were a family of 4 we stayed in one of the studio rooms, which whilst lovely and clean - was for 4 people, on the small side. There was little room for luggage - which we had a lot of as we were beginnng a 4 week trip. When the sofa bed was not in use - there was good space - but as soon as the bed was out - most of the space was gone. The staff were very helpful and attentive. The location of the hotel is also very handy. The free wifi and international calls were a great bonus. The included breakfast - whilst great for being free -was I think oversold in some of the reviews here - a couple of times we found service slow, but given we weren't paying then you really couldn't complain, We would stay here again - but with a family of 4 we might need to have an extra room on top of the studio.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hideaway in downtown vancouver”
Reviews.Author: moushka
Reviews.Content: We have had the pleasure of staying at the St. Regis Hotel in downtown Vancouver twice in the past 4 weeks (shortly prior to Christmas, 2011 and early in the new year, 2012). In each instance the service was excellent, the room and bed extremely comfortable and the breakfast was wonderful. They have had a special package available on the internet which gave the additional benefit of being possibly the best deal in Vancouver, and we did our research. We had such an excellent stay in December that we cancelled a booking at another "boutique" hotel and went back for a second visit after we returned from a cruise in January. We have never stayed at a hotel anywhere before where the hotel manager came up and (cheefully) helped us take our suitcases down to the car. If you are travelling with a vehicle be sure to let them know you will need a parking space in the adjoining secure underground parking that is available and accessed by a security card. There is a charge for parking. However, there was no charge for local or long distance calls, and free internet. There was also access to a health center but we had no opportunity to try it out on either trip. The St. Reggis is well situated for shopping and dining and we enjoyed our meals at the pub next door. If you are there in the Christmas season next year consider booking an evening to do the harbour tour on the Carol Ships which we did as it makes a wonderful evening and gives another perspective on the Vancouver skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, friendly staff and extra perks”
Reviews.Author: cstocker
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the St. Regis for 4 nights in room 212. The room wasn't large but offered two bathroom sinks, very comfortable beds, and an overall modern design. The hotel location was exactly what we were looking for. We were able to walk to the Granville train station, Robson Street, and the Waterfront. Ryan at the front desk was awesome and seemed to really love his job. He knows Vancouver. Frank was also very helpful. The hotel offers three breakfast options each day with the room rate. One morning I had waffles, fruit, juice, and tea. Another morning I had eggs, chicken sausage, wheat toast, juice and coffee. The houseroom staff provides Fuji bottled water in the rooms. The other extra perk that they provide is free local and international calls. I would recommend this hotel to any of my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: stayed over a weekend. hotel was great. expect room to be small - metropolitan or european style - but very nice linens and very clean. nice downtown location. two blocks to major mall. staff was very nice and accomodating. full hot breakfast served in downstairs dining room - very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: knievel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights over Christmas while visiting family in Vancouver. We were very impressed with everything about the hotel, the room, the service, and especially the included breakfast and would definitely stay here again. It’s a very good value for such a well-located, city-center property and the intelligence and convenient of both the design and the management really shine through. The hotel is located more or less right in the middle of downtown Vancouver and is easily accessible by mass transportation. The Granville stop on the SkyTrain is right next door and both the Waterfront and City Centre stops on the Canada Line are less than 5 mins walk (only 25 mins to/from the airport for $2.50/person one way). Across the street from the hotel are a Shoppers Drug Mart, a Tim Horton’s, a 7-11 and a number of other shops and restaurants. If you have a car, there is 24-hour, unlimited in-and-out parking in a secure garage in the building next door for $25/day plus 35% (!) tax. There are several less expensive public parking lots within short walking distance, some open 24 hours and others that close between about 10pm and 5am, but you need to pay for each stay which can be inconvenient if you come and go multiple times. It’s a minor complaint, but compared to other hotels in the area, $25/day did strike me as $5 or more too much. Our fourth-floor queen room was very clean, well decorated, nicely appointed, and very smartly designed. It was not large, but had ample room for the two of us with plenty of closet and dresser space for storing clothes and suitcases. It was well insulated from the outside, hallway, and adjacent rooms so noise was not noticeable. The excellent marble bathroom with large stand-up shower includes heated floors, which is a great touch during the cold months. Bedding, towels, and toiletries were top-notch. The flat-screen TV was larger than average for a hotel room and all of the power, audio, and video connections a business or personal traveler could need were positioned in one convenient panel over the desk. Wi-fi was free, as were all local and long distance telephone calls, another nice touch which I hadn’t seen before in any hotel. The in-closet combination safe was big enough to hold a laptop in addition to other valuables. The climate controlled worked well, as expected. The alarm clock included a radio and a docking/charging station which fit multiple sizes of iPhones/iPods. The real value of the stay though may have been the hot breakfasts (easily a $15/person value at a local restaurant) which were served in large dining room on the lower level. Over the holidays, serving hours were extended from 7am to 11am. There were three very good options, two hearty and one light with fruit, and all included coffee or tea, various juices, and choice of bread. All the staff throughout the hotel, especially in the restaurant, were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RPaderna
Reviews.Content: I recently completed a 4 day stay at the St. Regis Hotel in downtown Vancouver. Like most of the previous guests at this hotel, I was also very satisfied with the central location, amenities, decor, level of comfort and hospitality that this boutique hotel offered. My tastefully furnished standard room was sized appropriately for a solo traveller like myself. I particularly liked the heated bathroom floors and the unique concaved flooring in the glass-enclosed shower area. The inclusive breakfast was cooked to order, delicious, and portioned generously in my opinion. The service both in the breakfast lounge and at the St. Regis Bar & Grill was very efficient yet friendly as well. The best amenity offered by the hotel I think is the unlimited, complimentary telephone calls to any part of the world! This generous offer alone made the hotel excellent value for money. I would love to stay at this hotel again if fate brings me to the beautiful city of Vancouver in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Big city style”
Reviews.Author: EricH61
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May prior to a cruise. The experience was perfect in every way. We were seeking affordable luxury and a central location, and the St. Regis delivered. Staff is knowledgeable and professional; decor is sleek and urban (classic Manhattan). We had a junior suite and it was worth every penny. The breakfast is a real value -- the lower level of the Bar and Grill is reserved for hotel guests and only accessible by private elevator from the hotel. Didn't try the Bar and Grill itself, but the Gotham Steakhouse was outstanding, with a beautiful interior. Be sure to stop in for a drink in the bar, even if you don't want to splurge on dinner. Location is central for anything you would want to do downtown (including the Pacific Centre on the next block), with easy access to the Skytrain and bus lines for locations in other parts of the city. Depending on how much luggage you have, the cruise ship terminal is close enough to walk (we did) and it's downhill the whole way. I can imagine that it might be difficult to park around the hotel, but who drives a car into downtown Vancouver? In short, the St. Regis provides the perfect blend of the historic and the modern -- it was our springboard to a most memorable stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Royzoner
Reviews.Content: Free Internet, full breakfast, great location. The st. Regis has a boutique hotel vibe, and is half the price of similar hotels nearby. Totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: 53Latitude
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a one-night stay at the St. Regis, and can without reservation recommend it to any traveller. Service was top-notch right from the start, staff over the phone and at the front desk were courteous and friendly. Book through the hotel's website for the best rates! The room was very nice, with a comfortable queen bed, nice furniture and finishes, great shower, and a heated bathroom floor. One thing to note: you are right downtown, and rooms facing the street have some noise coming through. Bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper. The location otherwise can't be beat: right next door to Granville station and close to City Centre station for access to all the train lines and YVR. Plenty of shopping/attractions/dining in walking distance. The attached pub/grill is excellent, I met friends upon check-in for a meal & drinks and we were all impressed with the ambiance and menu. And finally, the complimentary full breakfast is one of the best I've had, with several options of hot/cold dishes all made to order and delicious. I'll definitely put the St. Regis at the top of the list for my next trip to the coast!

Reviews.Title: “We'd definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine L
Reviews.Content: This hotel had many positive aspects, not least of all the extremely friendly and helpful staff. The availability of free long distance phone calls anywhere in the world was great for us as we had a family emergency back home that required many calls. The decor was attractive and modern in the room, and we enjoyed the daily free bottled water. We found the room slightly small for our 4 suitcases, but managed to work out the space with a few adjustments. The location is great for the short walks to art gallery, Robson St, Gastown and other downtown sites and venues. We knew this hotel was located in the heart of downtown, so were prepared for some traffic noise (busses) during the night. We didn't find these intrusive. The choice and fresh preparation of items on the included-in-price breakfast menu were tasty and filling. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BigWhale
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in the Princess Diana Suite and it was just fantastic....even a fireplace in the sitting room....what a great little hotel. 5 star all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good but noisy location.”
Reviews.Author: geenes
Reviews.Content: On booking this property I specifically asked for a high level room, for quietness. On checking in, after being rushed through the information about the hotel whilst the gentleman behind the desk talked to other employees around me, I was given a room on the 1st floor. As I was only staying one night at the end of a long trip, I didn't bother questioning it and figured it might not be so bad. I was wrong - room overlooked noisy street and if it were not for the earplugs I had on me, I wouldn't have slept a wink. Very noisy. I understand the location is smack in the centre of everything and therefore noise is to be expected, also understand being an older boutique building the insulation isn't the greatest - so just keep in mind if you want a restful sleep here, bring earplugs and we prepared to hear everything going on outside as if it were happening in your room. The room itself is lovely. Very tastefully decorated in pale hues and dark wood. Very small and simple - queen bed (note queen bed sizes are definitely smaller in north american than we are used to in the southern hemisphere - I was traveling alone but if I were traveling with my partner this would be a double size to us and probably uncomfortably small, but totally fine on my own). The bed was comfortable so no problems there. Desk for work and chest of drawers. That was it for what was in the room, very basic. The bathroom was huge. Not sure if this is the standard type of bathroom or if I was in a disabled room, as space was very generous, huge tub, railings etc. The bathroom was beautiful and so clean. The whole room was incredibly clean. A few things to point out - no shower cap, but all other expected amenities in the bathroom were provided. No minibar fridge - don't care about the minibar, but do like to have a fridge in the room for my own drinks, etc. Am sure if I asked they may have been able to provide it. Room service was average - server not impressive just dumped tray and left without saying a word. Chocolates on pillow on arrival, free bottles of Fiji water to drink during stay that are replenished daily, free calls - all, local, international, cellphones, etc. Free wifi within room worked most of the time okay, business centre open 24hrs, Didn't try to breakfast so can't comment on that. Over all, this really is a lovely hotel that presents itself in a sophisticated manner, gorgeous generous bathrooms perhaps at the expense of a smaller room size, comfortable beds if only you could sleep through the noise, with average service.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Terry M
Reviews.Content: I think the St. Regis might be the nicest small hotel I have ever stayed in, and I have stayed in hundreds of hotels. First, the staff, from check in to check out and everywhere in between, above and beyond expectations. Staff in the excellent breakfast room, in the lounge/restaurant, housekeeping, extremely helpful, friendly, just interested in making your stay the best it can be. The breakfast is a great bonus, it is a very nice cooked to order served breakfast, great! The hotel is in great condition, recently renovated, the rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable, well kept, great beds, everything pretty much perfect. On top of great service in a nice facility, it is located in the heart of Vancouver, close to everything for tourists or sporting events, or business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service at the St.Regis!”
Reviews.Author: eviltidball
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with our stay at the St.Regis, before we even arrived, they called us while we were enroute to advise that the usual access to their parking had been blocked due to the Grey Cup parade. Ryan explained how we needed to go about accessing their parkade once we arrived. Ryan and Casey were extremely helpful once we arrived, and got our luggage up to our room. We were there at least 5 hours before the check-in time, and they already had our room ready for us. We were so impressed with the rooms, very beautifully decorated, and the bathroom was gorgeous. Complimentary breakfast was included with our stay, and it wasn't just a little partial snack, but a full breakfast. There wasn't a bad thing about this hotel, the service is top notch. I only have one constructive comment, and that is , I would ditch the one cup coffee maker for a regular hotel coffee brewer and I would ditch that coffee you have in the rooms, it's horrible, thank God you have a Starbucks downstairs. Loved the pub too, and had awesome service from Dora!! Our friends came in with us, and were so impressed with the St.Regis that they are booking rooms there for their next visit to Vancouver. Thanks for the wonderful stay! Ed and Virginia Iceton

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: sandgravity
Reviews.Content: St Regis Hotel After reading the favorable reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to give this hotel a try for our three day stay the week of 11/21. Our stay couldn't have been better! This hotel pays attention to every detail. The staff was always friendly and eager to help. The room was tastefully decorated with nice linens, a comfortable chair and a desk. Wi-Fi worked well. Our bathroom was good size with a soaking tub/shower combo. Our friends had a room with a walk-in shower and heated floor. The hotel/room was very clean. The complimentary breakfast was good with three different choices. Each choice provided more food than we could eat. The location was perfect for us as we could easily walk to shopping, restaurants and transit. The hotel is convenient to transit with the Granville Sky Train station next door. We caught the on/off trolley approx 4 ½ blocks from the hotel. There were good restaurants close by. The St. Regis Bar and Grill is attached to the hotel. The Shore Club is a block away and had delicious food and atmosphere. The parking for the hotel was a little awkward so take advantage of the detailed instructions you receive before arrival and be sure to let them take your bags when you stop to get your parking pass. We like to take care of our own bags so were a little skeptical of this process but quickly realized they know what they are doing and will take good care of your bags while you park your car. We definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “St.Regis in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Manuel W
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at St.Regis Hotel because my wife attended her cardiovascular congress.Hotel is central located in Downtown, so you can walk to almost everything you want to see. Rooms are very clean, bathroom we had was huge, realy nice renovated. Staff was absolutely helpful, courteous, exceptional. Bed was comfortable, free wi-fi, free international phone calls, breakfast was good, but if you stay longer than 3 days you are running out of choices. Pub is right next door to hotel, same thing, perfect atmosphere, easy friendly staff, awesome food, fair priced, varity of beers, wine and other nice drinks. Something we didn't like? Well if you want, you always will find it. For us it was perfect. Thank you hotel crew and special thanks to Jeremy, GM for your support. Great job.

Reviews.Title: “Left in the middle of the night due to noise.”
Reviews.Author: mhaefele
Reviews.Content: First off, my girlfriend also reviewed our same experience, so this will sound very familiar to her account. But I've never had an experience like this before and was determined to also put my two cents in. Also, all of these problems occurred during Grey Cup weekend (which we had never heard of before beginning our stay in Vancouver). Pros: Nice enough rooms (if on the small side). Pretty good room service. Very friendly staff. Cons: Terrible drop-off situation. Experienced actual road rage while attempting to drop off our bags. Highest noise levels I have ever experienced in a hotel/hostel ever, anywhere. Partiers/drunks congregate at the intersection and nearby businesses, which contributes to the noise levels. Does not seem to have any ability to quiet down neighboring businesses. Did not handle the Grey Cup situation very well. Not particularly cheaper than other downtown hotels that don't have the previous cons. First off, my girlfriend booked this thinking it was the St. Regis chain. Would not have been a problem if the stay had been better, but they need some serious disclaimers on the website explaining the situation. As far as the actual stay goes, the drop off area is borderline traumatic. Basically they have you double park in one lane of a VERY busy, very angry, two lane street. All the other drivers don't see the hotel signs and think you are being a jerk. This was a friday evening and drivers were PISSED OFF. We were dropping off luggage from our rental car before driving the car back to the agency and were probably in that spot for 5-7 minutes. I was honked at, shouted at ("in Canada, that no stopping sign means no stopping") and generally abused by the other cars... As my girlfriend was pulling away and turning off her blinkers, an SUV with BC plates honked, swerved around us, cut us off and then, after we honked, hit the brakes, trying to get us to rear-end him. He flipped us off before driving away. During busy times, the hotel absolutely should have someone outside protecting drivers and generally absorbing this abuse. Onto the room situation. As we were checking in, my girlfriend asked for a higher room, but were told second floor was the only one available (due to the grey cup). We got to the room and found that it was very noisy, with many drunks shouting on the street and a bus stop directly across from us where the busses made BEEP BEEP BEEP noises every five minutes. The windows did absolutely nothing to absorb this noise. I decided to suck and up and sleep with ear plugs and a pillow over my head. Then at about 10:30pm, a bar started blasting music, making sleep impossible. I called down and was again told no other rooms were available. The guy at the desk said things might calm down by midnight.. Midnight came and went with just as many drunks still lining the streets and the bars making ZERO effort to do any noise control or keep patrons from hanging out outside. In fact, the bar near us turned the music UP at around 1am. At this point I called down and told the front desk we would be moving to another hotel immediately. We ended up booking a significantly larger, completely quiet room at the Four Seasons for not a lot more money. Overall, we had a terrible, stressful experience. The only reason the St Regis did not get a 1 rating was that the next day the manager was very very nice and understanding and canceled charges for both the night we tried and failed to use and the next night we canceled. Besides these issues, the hotel has friendly staff and the rooms are nice enough (although a bit on the small side if you're staying as a couple). Based on my experience and other reviews, it seems like they have a few problem rooms where the noise levels are not adequately contained. Additionally, it seems to be a highly intoxicated location which contributes to the noise levels. They either need to put a lot of effort into sound proofing these rooms or give guests a serious disclaimer about the noise level when reserving them (don't just assign guests to the problem rooms and hope for the best). It is a downtown location, but other downtown hotels do not seems to have these problems (we are currently blissfully, quietly, happy at the Four Seasons). I have stayed in hundreds of hotels and hostels and this was the first time I've ever walked from a hotel I'd checked into. One other suggestion: Given the number of times the "Grey Cup" was mentioned in relation to these problems, it would have been nice if they had called and given a bit of warning. CFL is not covered at all in America and we had no idea the Grey Cup existed or would cause so many problems.

Reviews.Title: “Dried milk and dissapointing reception staff.”
Reviews.Author: aliqmul
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the St Regis hotel for a week in November. On arrival, the initial impression was that the hotel was smart, and with an excellent city centre location. On checking in, we quickly discovered that the staff on the front desk were not particularly friendly, and that they were often distracted by other things that were going on behind the desk (answering phones to other guests, talking to their colleagues about some issue, trying to change the volume of the music playing)........this, unfortunately led us to feel like we were not particularly valued guests and that we were a bother. The room (201) was of a good size with a walk in wardrobe and plenty of room to fit our luggage. The decor was tasteful and the cleanliness generally good. We were dissapointed that the view was out onto a flat roof of the adjacent restaurants and their air conditioning units, and as a result were unable to open the window due to the noise. With the window shut the units were also audible and so for the purposes of quietness, I would not recommend this room. The bathroom had all of the extras that you would expect and also was of a decent size. Unfortunately the please tests of the bathroom was marred by the shelf under the sink which had a missing support so repeatedly fell off. The cleaner seemed to ignore this by putting it back up after every time it had fallen, and balancing fresh towels on it......very frustrating! Tea and coffee were provided, but the milk was powdered.......dissapointing and surprising for a hotel that sells itself as being upmarket. One of the much better aspects of the stay was breakfast. Our host was polite, attentive, and the breakfast was delicious, freshly cooked and timely. St Regis has got this just right. In summary, the hotel was a nice place, and breakfast was delicious, but we were let down on several occasions, most noteably by the reception staff. I note that this hotel has won an award from trip advisor for best service......we certainly didn't receive any award winning service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AMac305
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is a great place to stay in Vancouver. The hotel is central, the staff are friendly and helpful, the room rates are good with international calls thrown in. I will definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the core”
Reviews.Author: Presontheprowl
Reviews.Content: A masterful renovation of an old building. Certainly a premiere boutique hotel right in the downtown core. Nice pub, great breakfast and helpful courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ParisPeaprincess
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so good that one has the feeling that the person who created it was a traveller who really knows what travelers need in a hotel. Good rates, comfort, free international phone calls (!), free internet, good breakfast, amazing professional massage, centrally situated, helpful desk. What more could one wants?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rhena1169
Reviews.Content: In November 2011 myself and 17 business associates stayed at the St. Regis while attending the CUPE National Convention. The location, service and $$$ hit the mark. One of the group is a Celiac and the glueten free breakfast options and the glueten free options for luncheon and dinner was a huge plus. The majority of our group were female and there was a concensus that safety was a bonus at this hotel. The stairwells are spotless so you don't hesitate on that bit of exercise. Janet Thomas, Director of Sales and Ryan (front desk) are both amazing ambassadors for this hotel. While I don't have names for the other staff the benchmark for service is met. Thanks and all of us will be back! free internet and long distance...Wow! Again Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Rygar101
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the St. Regis many times. The best part of it is that it's consistently great. The staff and the rooms are all first class. I have stayed at many hotels in Vancouver and none would rate as high as St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Stopover”
Reviews.Author: PaulFarina
Reviews.Content: Located downtown and a 5 min walk from the Canada Line, this was a great stayover for a business trip to Vancouver I was on. Rooms were nicely updated for an older hotel, which as some nice classic charm. Staff were courteous and the breakfast was excellent. Free wireless was definitely a bonus. I'd recommend staying here if you are heading to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AustinFoodie3
Reviews.Content: We really wanted to like the St. Regis. It just wasn't in the cards. On the plus side, the central location is convenient and one can walk to many downtown Vancouver points of interest. That's where the positive side ends, however. To the hotel's credit, everyone on the staff that we encountered was friendly and professional. However, it's an old outdated hotel and theres not much to be done about it without taking extraordinary (read very expensive) measures to update it. Our room (a king bed room) was very small and dark. Upon entering the room the smell reminded me of long closed-off rooms in my great grandmother's house. It was obvious that the room had not been occupied (or aired-out) in a very long time. The bathroom had been updated but it was small and oddly laid out. There is one (very old and very small) elevator for the whole of the hotel. We cancelled our second night's reservation and stayed elsewhere. To the hotel owner's and management's credit, they have obviously tried to make a silk purse from a sow's ear but some things just aren't possible I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Bcbunny
Reviews.Content: This beautiful boutique hotel is my favourite place to stay when in Vancouver. Everything about it is exceptional. I have stayed here for business and pleasure. It is great for both! The customer service can't be beat. The decor is exceptional. Beautiful art, comfortable beds, beautiful washroom, clean clean clean. The free morning breakfast is gigantic and made to order. Totally reasonable rates. The only place I stay when in Vancouver. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: AussieBella
Reviews.Content: Vancouver was the last stop on our 6 week trip and this hotel was certainly the icing on the cake! Starting at the check-in desk we were greeted warmly, efficiently and in a very caring manner. All the hotel had to services were explained to us with the offer of any assistance at any time. Next the room.. nice corner room with plenty of light on the 4th floor. Very clean and beautifully decorated and fitted out, the bathroom was the best we have had on this trip. Breakfast was included (as was overseas and local phone calls surely the first of any hotel to offer this?) .... back to the breakfast... served in the lower ground level. There was one waitress for all of us during the week, I wish I could remember her name as she was great. Very efficient and friendly... I noted on weekends they had 2 younger girls who struggled to keep up with what she did alone! Plenty of options to choose from and all very nice (we went through the whole menu by the time we left!) The business centre, near reception, was great. Free computers to use and a little lounge with large television. Free wifi also included. Location of this hotel was great for us, very near to the Skyrail to the airport, shopping a plenty but can't rave about the restaurants/cafes nearby. We did eat in the hotel restaurant on the first night and that was good, little noisy with all the tv's going but no complaints re the food. The attention to detail in this hotel is very evident, we only wish there were more of them throughout the world!! Go stay there and see.

Reviews.Title: “Great part of a memorable trip”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: My father-in-law wanted me to post this for him as he was so pleased with the hotel. The managment and staff were so helpful and friendly at this hotel as in fact were everyone we came into contact during our 3 week Canadian Tour. The hotel was ideally located for tours and sight-seeing and as an elderly couple it was ideal for our needs. Taxis were always readily available both ways. Be careful what you order for breakfast .. it's huge! We would definately return to the St Regis on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Just relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Kyfu262000
Reviews.Content: Everything about the St. Regis is just easy. My wife and I spent four relaxing nights at the hotel, just a short walk from the trains that take you to and from the airport. It is walking distance to almost anything you want to do (we even did Stanley Park, which took about 35 minutes to get there). As others have said the breakfast is amazing with a very wide selection and almost too much food. We want to take a moment to thank Jeremy for his wonderful dinner recommendation. He over heard us discussin dinner options in the hall and got us into a wonderful very up beat itialian resturant.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjenke
Reviews.Content: I spent two days at this hotel when I got married in Vancouver and the hotel was fantastic. The room was stocked with all the usual hotel amenities, the bed was very comfortable, the decor fantastic, the room service was delicious, the front desk associates went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect and all our needs were met. The breakfast they provide in the morning is wonderful, it is a full breakfast and there are choices for everyone. I will absolutely be staying here in the future and will recommend the St.Regis to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sdingivan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis for four nights when we came to Vancouver for our anniversary. It's location was amazing. Close to Gastown (which we loved), downtown and a quick train or bus ride to almost anywhere in the city. The complimentary breakfast was huge and filling. The bar even allowed us to watch American football! We would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great home base to explore this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ruth G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St. Regis Hotel in Downtown Vancouver for two nights. The staff was amazing, helping us with every request. The staff is prompt and courteous. We liked the historical aspect of the hotel and the room are totally redecorated, comfortable and cosy. I will not hesitate to stay there again. Ruth G.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Kim S
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to find out the menu at breakfast and in the lounge could accommodate gluten free preferences when dining at this great hotel. I like the historical significance of this hotel, the experience of seeing the pictures that depicted landmarks gone by and still around Vancouver was what especially appealed to me. Great service with the staff in the breakfast area and lounge. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Og99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year, and were so impressed that we turned down an invitation to stay with family when we visited Vancouver again this year, and re-booked at the St Regis. It is in a perfect location, the staff are truly excellent, the rooms are comfortable, decorated beautifully and immaculatly clean. And the size of it all is just right - not too big and not too small. I can't praise this hotel enough and I am looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: barb8647
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed for three nights at the St. Regis in June prior to leaving on an Alaskan cruise. We were all very pleased with the room and services. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and made some great recommendations. In particualr we enjoyed renting bikes at Spokes (they even gave us coupons) and cycling around Stanley Park. Be sure to do that while you are in Vancouver. The location was great-easy walking distance to the park, shops etc. We even took the train from the airport and were able to walk to the hotel from the station. There is a Pub located at the hotel which was lots of fun and the breakfast was included in our price and was very generous and cooked to order.
