As for the room it was well appointed-beds were comfortable, bathroom was large, and plenty of hot water. We had 3 in our room so it was a little crowded but no major complaints. Overall, I highly recommend the St. Regis and would definitely stay there again if I ever get back to Vancouver which I hope is soon as it was a great city to visit. Wish we would have had more time.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: bbrethour
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at the St. Regis in Vancouver and I can truly say it was one of the best boutique hotels I have ever stayed in. From the fantastic included breakfast which you order from a menu, to the free international long distance and very modern rooms. The services provided were fantastic. Great staff as well. If you need a hotel that is central to everything and a great price, check them out, you will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Unique!”
Reviews.Author: Daphne G
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in hotels on 5 continents this hotel is truly unique! FREE wI-fi/internet/FREEinternational telephone/local calls/FREE breakfast and even FREE bottled water every night! The rooms are large with comfy beds and bathroom floor is heated. Staff are so friendly and welcoming. The hotel is central to all amenities and close to all the main shopping areas and excellent restaurants. The hotel itself has its own sports bar/restaurant. This is an hotel that is cosy and independent - not part of a chain and that is what makes a wonderful difference. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NXOTucson
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 2 nights stay at the St Regis. What a wonderful hotel! The rooms were beautiful and comfortable, the staff was the friendliest ever and the amenities were a pleasant surprise. Free large breakfast, free wi-fi/internet & free world-wide long distance calls. This hotel is conveniently located among all you would want downtown. Walking distance to the water - it wasn't too bad to walk to Cardero's either. I will definitely stay there next time work takes me to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ladytraveler858
Reviews.Content: I am not typically a 'boutique hotel' kind of person, because my extensive business travel mandates that I have no problems. However, this hotel will make me think again. As a business traveler, I greatly appreciated the wireless and international long distance at no charge. They are by far one of the best - and much better than the 'cookie cutter' offered by so many chains now. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were great, with a lot of 5 star amenities, the breakfast package is actually restaurant quality, and they are located at a great spot. I highly recommend this to anyone traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wavalen
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel was a great place to stay in downtown Vancouver! My husband and I came to visit our daughter at UBC, there are no hotels near the University so the next best thing was downtown where all the action is! The hotel located in the heart of the city was great for walking to many of the happening neighborhoods in Vancouver. The room though small was nicely decorated and with plenty of space in the bathroom for out toiletries. Plus the hand written welcome note and bottle of Fiji water was a great touch! All the employies at the St Regis were super nice and very helpfull! The bonus was the full breakfast every morning included with our stay, they were even nice enough to let our daughter eat with us for free. I would for sure stay here next time I come to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accomodations and Service”
Reviews.Author: Timothy P
Reviews.Content: My niece, a travel agent, recommended the St. Regis for our three days in Vancouver after our Princess cruise from Alaska. We were pleasantly surprised that this hotel was as nice as any of the "first class " hotels we've stayed in over the years. The rooms were beautifully appointed and cared for. The staff were extremely gratious and helpful and the adjoining restuarant and lounge was perfect for a late night dinner after touring Vancouver. The price was amazingly reasonable for what was provided including a fantastic full breakfast to start our day. We would highly recommend the St. Regis and would definitely stay there again. They did a fantastic job of reconditioning an historic hotel into a modern day facility. Cudos to the ownership!

Reviews.Title: “st regis”
Reviews.Author: pip u
Reviews.Content: Hotel was amazing and the customer service was great, very high standards in terms of the room and dinner was lovely, and breakfast was pretty good. I would definitely stay their again. I would like to make a special mention about ryan's customer service, such a friendly and warm guy and amazing customer service. Never fails to have a smile on his face and make conversation with his guests. it made me feel as a guest at st regis very welcome. I hope this gets forwarded on to his manager.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMFTW1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend on a trip to Vancouver, booked last minute in the cheapest room available. The beds were comfortable, spotlessly clean, fantastic bathroom and shower. Parking available ($25 charge), full breakfast included, wifi, complimentary telephone calls. The guys on the front desk really make this hotel. It's not often that hotel staff get the perfect balance between friendly, professional and courteous. For example they offered to help us with our luggage but there were no pushy doormen insisting on carrying everything when it really isn't necessary for most people. They gave us fantastic restaurant recommendations and sightseeing suggestions. Brilliant. Well done St. Regis, keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ditchmond
Reviews.Content: I live in a Vancouver suburb and have heard of this hotel from others. Since everything I heard was positive and I knew the location was central to everything, I booked a night away with the wife away from the kids. I couldn't be happier. We stayed in a suite that was slightly smaller than other suites I have stayed in. However all the furnishings were top notch. I was worried about the noise that everyone has commented on, but with the window closed I didn't hear any of the street noise. Of course the comfy bed (the most important part of a hotel in my opinion) probably helped. The complimentary breakfast was awesome. My nose and eyes kept wandering over to the other tables to see what the other breakfasts looked like and everyone seem to be really enjoying themselves.

Reviews.Title: “elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: yael2
Reviews.Content: the hotel is certainly great as the reviews promised. even the least expensive rooms are great, clean, comfortable and stylish. the complimentary breakfast is also very good and nothing like the cheap buffet breakfasts you get at most hotels. the complimentary long distance calls is an exceptional treat. get the massage with Mishal, too. only drawback is the noise coming from the street traffic and people returning from their nights out. we were on the fifth floor (top floor) and the noise still woke us up in the morning. the windows should be double-glazed or something. maybe the rooms not gacing the streets are different - i don't know. overall, the hotel is great apart from this drawback.

Reviews.Title: “excellent place to stay, ideal location, friendly staff, couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: lorraine b
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the St Regis for 3 nights and thought it was an excellent hotel. it'.s ideally located for walking to most of the key tourist sights and s next door to the sky train for longer journeys. The staff were very friendly and helpful. we tried the massage that's now available in the hotel on the third floor, and can recommend it. The rooms and beds were slightly on the small side, but nothing to worry about. Make sure you ask for a quieet room though, we faced onto the allyway, so not the best view, but certainly a peaceful night's sleep. The free internet and international calls were a great bonus which meant | could call my mum in England and have a good chat with her without worrying about the expense. I woudl certainly stay in this hotel again, it was great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Just what you want from a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grant E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to (3 blocks) the Canada Line from YVR. Check-in was friendly and efficient. Rooms not that big but clean and attractive with all the usual mod cons you need. Bonus that you can either choose to use the a/c or open a window (but street facing could be noisy for some). Breakfast service quick and tasty. Nice touch having free internet access and printer so I could check in on-line. Staff all very pleasant and helpful. A really well run operation. Priced competitively against other downtown options too.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pash53
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the St Regis and cannot praise it highly enough. The staff were efficient and helpful the rooms beautifully decorated and the room rate included a full breakfast and free international calls !!! The hotel is also really well located in the centre of town and they have a car park which is reasonably priced. Wifi is also free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a central location!”
Reviews.Author: Bannie66
Reviews.Content: Our Canadian adventure started and finished at the St Regis in downtown Vancouver. The staff were professional, attentive and friendly. The rooms were clean and efficient. Breakfast was an added bonus as it was part of the cost and was excellent. (NB; Beware of car parking costs although this seems to be standard with Canadian hotels). Overall a fantastic experience and we will be using St Regis when we return to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Room & Service”
Reviews.Author: Billxma
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights of business meetings in early October. The hotel is in excellent shape and for the room rate this was a great value. The rooms are nicely done with a marble bathroom, flat panel TV and higher quality linens/towels. Free wired or wireless internet is available as is a free breakfast. The breakfast is a sit-down a la carte full breakfast that is made to order, not a buffet breakfast. I didn't try the restaurant/bar but it looked pretty nice. The staff were nice and even had umbrellas available if you forgot one. The hotel is a short walk from any meeting you might have downtown. I didn't do any of tourist related trips, but anything downtown would also be a walk. I parked in the adjacent garage for $25/day with full in and out privileges which I felt was a fair price (unlike some downtown hotels that charge $30/day for overnight valet only). One my colleagues got a free pass to the gym next door and said it was huge and clean. Downsides I can think of: 1. If you are light sleeper you will want a high floor as there is traffic noise on the lower floors (it's located in the middle of downtown). I was on the 2nd floor and it didn't bother me, but it might other people. 2. There's only 1 elevator and it can take a couple minutes to get a ride. I solved that by using the stairs which suited me fine. 3. The rooms can be on the smaller side. I didn't have a problem with mine, but one of colleagues felt the rooms were smaller than average (he still liked the hotel though). Overall, I'd highly recommend this to anyone staying downtown who likes a newer boutique hotel kind of vibe at a good value.

Reviews.Title: “st regis vancouver perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: michael h
Reviews.Content: fair price, great value. Hotel was clean comfortable, well located and exceptional staff. It is small enough they know your name and make you feel like a special guest. I have travelled extensively on business and believe me on my own dime this time this was an excellent hotel experience Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Just as we had been led to believe- GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Alan S
Reviews.Content: For a city centre hotel St Regis ticked all the boxes. Very good standard accomodation, excellent location and best of all extremely friendly and helpful staff- and I mean all of them, form managers to cleaners, could not fault them. Stayed twice in 2 weeks- before and after another trip, both visits just as consistant in quality. Very slight niggle- breakfast room not as pleasant as rest of hotel, dark and a bit gloomy- lightened by excellent staff. Quality of food very good- excellent cooked to order omlettes. Would highly recommend for pleasure or business stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geoff018
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located perfectly to access all sights in Vancouver. The reception staff were incredibly helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was clean and the sports bar which is attached is lively and serves a good range of food and drinks. Free wi fi is a bonus. The only slight negative is the room we had 410 is very noisy and for large parts of the nights we were there we heard people shouting outside, buses and cars rumbling past and the hotels air conditioning clanging away.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient boutique with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: teraflop
Reviews.Content: Business center with multiple workstations, printer, and an HD TV with comfortable chairs and a chess set. Signing in was rapid and even though I arrived after midnight, the front desk was very attentive to get me settled in. Free WiFi + long-distance + free breakfast made for good, convenient daily value. The hotel also provides a health club coverage through the local Steve Nash franchise, it's an excellent facility. Best of all, proximity to business, nightlife, shopping, Stanley Park, and the harbor. There's even a Skytrain station the next block, so my day-trip to Vancouver Island didn't even require me to rent a car. Would I stay again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Boutique Hotel with Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Bob B
Reviews.Content: We were spending only 1 night in Vancouver prior to boarding our cruise ship. Through an internet search I found the St. Regis Hotel. Since it is located near both the train station where we'd arrive and the ship terminal where we'd depart, I opted to stay here. I could not have made a better choice! It started with immediate attention and luggage assistance from front deskman, Benjamin who met our taxi, took our luggage inside while greeting us warmly. We were very early for check-in and Benjamin offered to store our luggage until the room was ready. Claim tickets were given to us along with a city map and a hotel business card with phone number to call in to see if our room was yet ready. We left everything save our camera and off we went. We found ourselves back at the hotel about an hour before official check-in time but decided to check anyway. We were told our room was indeed ready and our luggage had been taken up. The room itself was nicely appointed and quiet even though our window faced out to Dunsmuir street with a lot of traffic. The spacious bathroom is a real treat for a hotel - roomy, well stocked with soaps and shampoos and impeccably clean. Internet connection was easy - plug it in and go. Cable-fast response time. Within 20 minutes, a knock at the door and we were presented with a hand-written, personalized greeting note from the manager, Jeremy. While we were out to dinner, room service came in to turn down the bed and place chocolates on the pillows - my partner enjoyed getting two pieces as I'm allergic to the stuff. We enjoyed an extremely quiet night in a very comfortable bed. Some street noise could be heard when in the bathroom, but we didn't notice any while in the sleeping chamber. Breakfast downstairs the next morning was quite good. Table service and cooked to order meals from the menu were a pleasant surprise! Check out was quick and easy. We'll definitely stay here on our next trip north to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Roy B
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is an older hotel that has been completely renovated with style and comfort. The decor and furnishings are very well done. The location is central to many attractions and close to transportation stops. The Brew Pub downstairs was very good and convenient after a long day of sightseeing and walking. The staffs of the hotel and Pub were outstanding. They were the best of the four hotels we used on our 12 day Northwest trip using every mode of transportation except a helicopter and submarine. Since the hotel is small and in the middle of the city, the views were not the best, but then we did not pay for a view either. Would definitely stay there again because of the service, which is important when you are strangers in a city for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Boutique Hotel with Excellent Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: afriesen
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at the St. Regis was fabulous. Our room was modern, comfortable and exceptionally clean. Crisp linens, comfy couch, spacious bathroom, and details like bottled fiji water and tasty chocolates on the pillows made us feel at home. The room was well insulated from the noises of the city so we enjoyed an extra long sleep-in. It was great to have a Starbucks on-location. We also attended a special event at the hotel. A wine tasting fundraiser benefiting those affected by the drought and famine in Northern Africa. It was a great experience. Excellent food, excellent selection of wine and even a few local breweries. The location is close to everything you want to see when visiting Vancouver. You can walk everywhere and if you need to go a bit further, transit is just a few steps away. If you are looking for something special in the heart of the city then you should stay at the St. Regis. You will not be disappointed. The value-added factor is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line accommodations at a reasonable price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jan J
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, friendly courteous staff, good location central to everything including the transit system, comfortable, attractive and recently re-decorated rooms with all the amenities, good restaurant/bar on site, spa services available, full breakfast (with lots of choices, made fresh and served at your table) included with the price of your room. There is also a pharmacy, convenience store, coffee shops, great restaurants steps away, as well as access to a full service gym. From the moment we arrived and were immediately able to access our room with no waiting in line our experience at the St. Regis was extremely positive. We will definitely stay there on our next visit to Vancouver and will recommend the St. Regis to all of our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis is Underrated! 3.5 stars is not accurate.”
Reviews.Author: Amy_from_bc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. Everything exceeded our expectations. We were upgraded to a junior queen suite when we checked in. It had a beautiful marble shower, comfortable beds, an ipod dock to play your favourite music and so much more. Everything is so close too. We went for a concert at Rogers arena and it was a 7 minute walk (with high heels). There were restaurants all around, a beer and wine store next door and a convenience store across the street. Delicious breakfast in the morning as well. Top notch place! this is a gem and I will stay many times again :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: I booked into the hotel as part of an onward trip to north BC - staying there on the way & the way back. On my first visit: location (near Canada Line), rooms really comfortable & quiet, bed really comfortable & friendly welcome. All looked good. On my arrival I asked about getting a light breakfast before 7 am as I had an early flight to catch. I was told breakfast started at 7 am but if I came down early I would be able to get something. The following morning I came down to find that I couldn't access the breakfast lounge & the concierge. though very pleasant, said he couldn't do anything to help me now. I left disappointed & said so at the time. A few days later the hotel sent me an email asking for feedback. Needless to say I provided it! What surprised me was the prompt personal response from the manager (Jeremy Roncoroni), he apologised & explained I had highlighted an issue with staff training which he would address. He also offered me a room upgrade from my return stay. On my return stay, I was delighted with the room. What delighted me was I received a personal note & a complementary bottle of wine (which amazingly included 3 glasses which recognised that I was now travelling with my sister & her husband). This amazed me and showed a great attention to detail. I checked out in the morning & Jeremy approached me at the desk to check if everything was ok. The bottom line was that I was blown away at how this hotel took its feedback seriously. I think you can tell so much more about a place by how they deal with their mistakes. Well done St Regis & I would have no hesitation in staying here again. One small point was that the lobby/lounge bar was very noisy when I stayed. I understand that this was due to a major sporting event & reopening of the Stadium at Vancouver. I would have liked to have gone there for lunch but it was just too noisy at the time.

Reviews.Title: “St Regis Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gillinho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis for 4 nights following a 2 day trip on the Rocky Mountaineer, this was as part of our honeymoon. On arrival the room we were allocated was very dissappointing as it only had a small window with a view of the air con machine - not great esp as on honeymoon so we paid to be upgraded (as no offer of an upgrade). We moved to a suite which was ok, just average to be honest and way too many light switches, don't think it was worth the difference in price so for the following 3 nights moved back to a standard queen size room, (with a better view) which we think had the better shower! The location of the hotel was perfect and Ryan on the front desk is a great asset to the hotel - very helpful with directions and recommending restaurants. Would recommend going to Yaletown - a very good selection of restaurants and only about a 15 min walk away. A big tick for this hotel on the freebies.....new bottles of water in your room every day with a chocolate each, free wi-fi and free international calls. We would look at staying there again if revisiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leah W
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here. Clean, fantastic service, nicely appointed rooms, free international phone service!! free breakfast with omelettes, etc. free internet, great location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Staff was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “A gem...”
Reviews.Author: J_Lew22
Reviews.Content: This hotel came highly recommended by a friend. I was looking for something above and beyond the traditional chain experience, as I would be staying for a few days. In particular, I wanted something intimate - the hotel delivered. I was thoroughly surprised. The hotel itself is lovely - the art will blow you away. The concierge was incredibly helpful, the rooms, lobby, etc are stunning, and everyone (even the guests) was so friendly. The price was right too and the breakfast each morning (included in the price) was a real treat. I’ll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: brandon b
Reviews.Content: The customer service was amazing, everyone was so nice and helpful. I was treated like a star even though I may or may not look like a bum! Love the bathroom, heated floors a great. Perfect location, close to vibrant granville street and nice restaurants. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a find!”
Reviews.Author: dorsetgra
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 10 hotels during our trip to Canada - this was the best by far and a fantastic place to stay in Vancouver. The room was perfect and replenished daily with a chocolate each and a bottle of water each. Very comfortable bed and bathroom - my Husband particularly enjoyed the floor heating in the bathroom. Staff couldn't do enough to help us - thank you Ryan in particular for all your help and advice of where to go in Vancouver and how to get about! The breakfasts were superb with an enormous choice and set us up for the day. We stayed for five nights and couldn't fault this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great location! When we arrived they upgraded our room to a king bed to a suite for no extra charge and the staff was so friendly and helpful. I also booked the St. Regis Hotel because it came with a continental breakfast, and the breakfast we received was well beyond what I expected from a continental breakfast. It was a full sit down breakfast restaurant with great choices on the menu and wonderful food. I would highly recommend this hotel and when I go back to Vancouver, I am staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Woe to the naive traveler”
Reviews.Author: AnalyticalTraveler
Reviews.Content: Could it be coincidence that this small independent boutique hotel has the same name as a large luxury hotel chain? Is it chance that the style of lettering is identical? Don't be fooled! On a positive note, this is a quaint hotel. The rooms are relatively clean (dust on the lampshades). The staff are very polite. However, the sole elevator, shared by hotel staff, is tiny. Miniscule.The neighborhood is fringe. Bedding and pillows could use updating. Don't expect any help with you luggage. It's high rating reflects the reasonable rate and proactive marketing. For us, disappointment set in as soon as the taxi pulled up in front and we realized that this was not the St. Regis we'd expected. Perhaps a blatant disclaimer on the website would help avoid confusion.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: awh20015
Reviews.Content: We had an impressive stay at the St. Regis. In the world of customer service the goal is usually to "delight" your guests and that happened repeatedly. Upon check-in we were told the bottled water in our room was for us - no charge, and all local and international phone calls were free (no small deal, since roaming charges in Canada had us turn off our cell phones). Likewise the complimentary full breakfast was just that - restaurant style seating, waitresses at table-side taking our custom orders. Even more impressive was the personal service - a hand-written note - addressed to us - welcomed us in the room, and upon exiting the elevator the following day - the desk clerk greeted me by name. Staff was helpful throughout and the location is wonderful - walkable to most everywhere and next door to light rail. The rooms were lovely, clean and comfortable - with sizable bathrooms and all the expected amenities. A definite winner to be highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: RuthT00TH
Reviews.Content: Great location, comfortable well appointed rooms, breakfast included, free wireless internet, free international phone calls and best of all wonderful friendly staff. Vancouver BC is one of the friendliest cities I have visited and the staff here are a wonderful example of that. It's not overdone, but you can have a friendly chat with the lovely breakfast staff, get recommendations and directions from the front desk staff all at a very personal and interested level. Also very close to shops, Stanley Park, train station and most other services. On my favourite list!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: LadyDebby
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Hotel is a hidden gem. Our room was absolutely spotless and the bed was heavenly! The room rate included a full breakfast in the morning which takes place in a large old fashioned dining hall on the lower floor. There were bottles of water and chocolates on the pillows when we arrived. The hotel provided good value for the charge. We loved the location and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place..”
Reviews.Author: summaquies
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there numerous times in the last few months and found the staff exceptional, the hotel spotless and the included breakfast an unexpected treat. i will continue to make the St Regis my default hotel when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages......”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoJCU
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, wonderful staff, great room. This small hotel couldn't have been better. We arrived in Vancouver a day ahead of schedule. I called and asked if the hotel could take us without us having to move rooms twice. Not only did the St. Regis not have us move twice but they upgraded us to a beautiful suite. The reception desk was helpful with restaurant suggestions, where to go and what to see. Our Vancouver adventure was outsanding thanks to this little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Pedro52
Reviews.Content: Newly refurbished rooms, secure access, free internet and really helpful staff. We stayed for one night before visiting friends in the US and Vancouver Island and the hotel put what would have been our "checked in" luggage into safe storage for us until our return a week later. The staff were extremely helpful on both occasions (the second was for 3 nights), the breakfasts were good and the adjoining bar/bistro was good for evening meals. We'd definately book into this hotel again if we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Canada_Trip_2011
Reviews.Content: We loved the Stay in the St. Regis Hotel. The Staff was very friendly and obliging. It has a complimentary Internet Access and international phone calls are for free. The Sleeping Room and the bathroom were very clean and big enough. The Breakfast was served and we could choose between 3 breakfast menus. The hotel is in Vancouver Downtown and you can reach many tourist features by a short walk (Lookout Tower, Skytrain, Gastown, Harbour, Chinatown, Robson Street, Stanley Park...). The Hotel offers a parking possibility for 25CAD per night, but there are also several car parks next to the hotel which are cheaper (www.easypark.ca). Recommendation: 100%

Reviews.Title: “Clean, clean, clean”
Reviews.Author: Lee C
Reviews.Content: The staff left the reception desk to help the cabbie unload our luggage (and did it again when we departed a couple of days later), they stored it for us because we arrived in the morning, they arranged for us to take a tour of Vancouver (recommended) while waiting for our room to be cleaned. A regular restaurant type hot breakfast was free with the room (anything you wanted on the menu), free WiFi, use of computers, and free International phone service, newly remodeled rooms with delux baths, and did I mention how clean everything was? Handy to other restaurants, sky train, and sights to see. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Kathie H
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel for us to use at the end of the two day Rocky Mountaineer Train trip from Calgary. We were not expecting anything exceptional, but were we surprised! At first they could not find our reservation, so to make up for that, they gave us a corner room that was beautiful! The bed was excellent, neither one of us wanted to get out of our unbelieveable showers, it was within easy walking distance of most activities, and there was a wonderful full breakfast that came with the room. It is also a block from the Skytrain depot that goes directly to the airport! We also had a question as to where to leave our luggage until we left for the airport in the afternoon. They offered for us to leave everything in our room until we left which was after checkout time. They kept saying not to worry about the time, just have fun! For dinner, they made a suggestion for an excellent restaurant within walking distance. We will definitely go back here on our next trip to Vancouver, which we hope won't be too long!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - would definitely come back again”
Reviews.Author: Sundowngirl
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples staying for 3 nights before joining a cruise down the West coast of Canada and America and chose hotel after reading the reviews and we loved it! The staff couldn't have been more helpful, the rooms were clean very well equipped and the beds extremely comfortable. The breakfast was a bonus in North America and cooked to order. The location was great, near to the station, Canada Place port and in walking distance from the harbour and Stanley Park - we just couldn't fault it especially as it had so much character and charm unlike the chains and what other hotel gives you free international calls. We phoned family in England and didn't need to watch the time ticking by. Well done St Regis - a great find and a very reasonable price too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: AKTravelerFAI
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel while attending a convention at the far more expensive Fairmont. Overall, it was a very positive experience. I had a spacious corner room--with one bed--and especially enjoyed the free WiFi and the large, full breakfast that was included with the room. Portions were generous and the wait staff was very pleasant and attentive. The young man at the front desk was friendly--albeit with a slightly sarcastic edge--and was very helpful with restaurant recommendations. The other desk staff were also very helpful. Despite the attractive, modern refurbishing, though, there was an old-hotel musty odor that occasionally seeped through in my room and in the lobby. And on Saturday night, I could hear considerable street noise. Still, given the complimentary WiFi, the full breakfast, and the attractive rates compared to other properties in the area, I'd definitely consider booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Eddie C
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay the rooms were very clean, very friendly and helpful staff, I would recommend this hotel to everyone, great location, the hotel is ran very professional and very customer friendly. [---]

Reviews.Title: “Beyond excellent”
Reviews.Author: Helenseaborne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on our multi-city canadian trip in Aug and it was amazing! Loved the deco, the facilities. Very nice shower, excellent breakfast with a nice selection. I would return tomorrow (if only I could). Location was excellent, with Tim Hortons and 7-11 across the road, we didn't lack anything.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Farther”
Reviews.Author: JohnGradyHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: This is THE place to stay in Vancouver. The location is within walking distance of many attractions. The breakfast at the St.Regis is great. The rooms are very attractive. We had two rooms, one of them on the corner and both facing the main street. Absolutely no street noise. We especially liked the easy access via rail from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service & Location - Best Hotel Stayed in for a long time”
Reviews.Author: KrazyAngelKat81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis for 9 days in August 2011 whilst we explored Vancouver and the surrounding area. The room was comfortable and modern and the food and service at breakfast time was lovely and varied. The best things about this hotel are the location and the service. You can easily get around to all entertainment areas. Ben and Ryan who ran the front desk were extraordinarily helpful with any queries that we had and happily researched more unusual trips, Hatley Castle for example, and told us best options for getting to them. I cannot thank them enough as they helped to make our trip very memorable. If we ever return to beautiful Vancouver we would not stay anywhere else. The St Regis has become the benchmark that we will measure other hotels against.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, yummy breakfast each day included”
Reviews.Author: TKsBaskets
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights before our Alaskan Cruise. The location is a quick walk to the waterfront where you can catch one of the many tour busses to take you around town. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Calling cabs, suggesting places to eat or things to see. The hot and delish breakfast was included with our lodging. I'd recommend this hotel to any friends (or cyber friends reading this review)!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Curly003
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for five nights, Comfortable bed, clean, good pressure in shower, loved the toiletries and chocolate they had in the room, also the free long distance call deal.location was excellent as I was there for a conference so it was walking distance to the convention center, a nice walk. Breakfast was good but had only 3 choices after since I am vegetarian did not have much choices after two days it would have been nice to see a 4th choice there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: RichardCham
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights at the St. Regis and it was great. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. The free breakfast was really good. They give you 3 choices but you can mix and match which was nice. The location was within walking distance of most places we wanted to go and the train station was next door. Room was small but very comfortable. The bed was great. Will stay again if I make it back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome spot!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey F
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful boutique hotel! The staff were all outstanding, especially Juan who was so helpful and friendly. The rooms are wonderful, comfortable beds and great showers. The breakfast was wonderful. We will definatley stay here again and recommend the St Regis to anyone who may be attending an event at Rogers Arena or BC Place, its just a short walk. Thank you to Janet Thomas who booked the hotel rooms. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: OverThereOverThere
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel, definitely worth the little extra coin. Oh, and don't forget the free full American style breakfast, included in your rate.

Reviews.Title: “great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mglmgl
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel -- especially the staff. We had a special rate for a queen, and, while the room was small (we expected it to be), it was very well appointed and comfortable. Great beds. Best of all, the location was fabulous and the cooked-to-order breakfast delicious. We stayed in Vancouver 3 nights before leaving on a cruise, and we were able to walk to the ship. All downhill and a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay. We will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: Rick A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for three days. The location was perfect for reaching all areas of downtown Vancouver. Every aspect of the hotel was excellent. The staff went over the top to make sure we enjoyed our stay. We send our thanks to Ben, Adrian, Nelson, Ashley, Tammy, Dora and Dave. We had the pleasure of meeting the Genera Manager, Mr. Jeremy Roncoroni and understand what makes this boutique hotel shine above the others. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable, central with helpful staff- would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: truman08
Reviews.Content: following a 4.5 day trip across Canada on the train(from Toronto) we were looking forward to staying in a hotel. we had arrived earlier into Vancouver than anticipated and stopped by the st Regis to see if we could store our bags until check-in. they were most helpful and our bags were already in our room when we did check in. we enjoyed the breakfast, our room(standard double I think) was clean and comfortable. we faced the street on the 2nd floor but it was not noisy. the only issue was on our first night around 2am, the smoke alarm began to emit a piercing beep. this was at regular intervals. around 2:30am an electronic voice started with the beeps declaring lots of different emergencies. it was incredibly shocking in a dark room in the middle of the night. we called the front desk and the night porter was extremely helpful. he took away the offending smoke alarm. unfortunately it was really hard to get back to sleep, and we ended up pretty tired the following day. when I asked about it the next day, the staff were apologetic and replaced it by the time we returned. as we were only staying for 2 nights this incident slightly interrupted our plans as we had to retire early the next day as we were so tired from the night before. a similar incident happened to a friend in a New York hotel, and they received a substantial discount from their bill. we didn't push for this, and although staff were very helpful and apologetic. one friend said they would have requested an upgrade. overall despite the nocturnal interruption, we would heartily recommend the st regis. infact our friends who live nr Seattle have already stayed there on our advice.

Reviews.Title: “Now we know why St. Regis is so highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LandM58708
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in late August to meet friends. The hotel was recommended by a travel agency. We were very impressed. The staff is friendly, and very helpful. They seem to have not overlooked anything from amenities to first class decor. You know they care and want guests to appreciate the surroundings when you see bright, carpeted, decorated stairwells with wall hangings and art. I have never seen that before. This is a very hand's on staff. They jump to assist and respond quickly to requests. The General Manager is right there with the rest of the staff helping the guests. He carried our luggage to the parking garage upon checkout and sent a personal, signed thank you note by mail. Now that is a personal touch. We understand that the rooms may vary in size but the ones we had were clean, plush, quiet and very compfortable. We will remember this stay and return again.

Reviews.Title: “what a find ! hope we can be back”
Reviews.Author: Margie I
Reviews.Content: really great hotel - staff very helpful, breakfast beautifully presented & yummy , free international calls and WiFi - rooms very modern, with all amenities - lovely nights stay before our Cruise Margie Barwon Heads Australia

Reviews.Title: “I chose this hotel because of the reviews re: their service and we were not disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole C
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay. Everyone was helpful and seemed very happy at work - a rare and nice find these days :) My husband and I were constantly greeted with pleasant, genuine smiles and courtesy. All staff were excellent and the manager, Jeremy, was exceptional in his assistance when we first arrived and my husband ironed a white dress shirt that he was to wear to a wedding the next day and stained it with the hotel iron. Jeremy was immediately at our door, helpful and courteous, and he solved the problem. Thank you again Jeremy! The room itself was very clean and the bed was super comfortable! Soft, soft sheets and wonderful comfy pillows. The breakfast which is offered included with the price of the hotel room is excellent and bountiful...pastries, coffee, juice, full breakfast of eggs and bacon and toast - no skimping here! I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again and wished I had stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Margaret D
Reviews.Content: I NEVER write reviews BUT the St. Regis Hotel is such a lovely property I had to weigh in. This is a great hotel. Location near downtown is very convenient. Every staff member was helpful and courteous. The room, though small (it is a boutique hotel, after all), is really clean and beautifully decorated. The breakfast is generous and delicious! We have stayed in many different hotels in many cities this is, by fa,r the nicest property we ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Travelforadventure
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central downtown location close to shopping, theatres, etc with easy access to the rapid transit to and from the airport. It is a completely and tastefully restored historic hotel with gorgeous marble bathrooms. I am fussy and have stayed in many hotels ...our room was super clean! Price included free long distance and internet which I have not seen offered in many hotels. Breakfast offered a good selection and was included as well. Front desk staff and everyone we interacted with was friendly, professional and knowledgeable. Would definitely stay again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Thank-you St Regis!”
Reviews.Author: Michael F
Reviews.Content: Last Friday I had a last minute and very unexpected business trip to Vancouver. I had back to back meetings with 2 potential investor groups. As it was so last minute, my favorite hotel that I usually stay at was booked. One of my staff instead booked me a room at a hotel I had not heard of before called "the St. Regis." I got a late start from Seattle and then had a delay at the border. I was unable to reach my contact from the first group to let them know I was running late. I didn't know what to expect of the hotel. I arrived at the hotel 5 minutes late for my first meeting. I rushed into the very nice lobby and approached the desk where the person behind the desk was busy checking in someone else. He looked at me and said "you must be Dr. Failla" He welcomed me to the St Regis and someone else then came and welcomed me from a business area behind the desk. He told me that some people had arrived to meet with me and he had them waiting in the a very nice room off to the left of the front desk. He asked if I would like to use a conference room. The room my group was already sitting in looked as perfect as one could ask for and so I asked if we could just meet in there. He said fine. He took my credit card, checked me in, parked my car and brought my bags to the suite while I greeted and met with my guests. My guests were comfortable and happy. They had been offered and served refreshments before by the front desk staff even before I met them. I applaud you St. Regis for 5 star customer service! We simply closed the door and had a good meeting. After the meeting was over they gave me the key to the room. My bags were there. They had given me a complimentary upgrade to a suite which was wonderfully comfortable and appointed with a see through fireplace seperating the sleeping room and the living room and desk area. Even though the hotel is in the heart of downtown there was not any street noise. It was quiet and peaceful.....a true oasis in the heart of the city. For my next meeting they put me in the stunning conference room. Once again the staff made sure everyone was comfortable. They didn't even know ahead of time that I was having meetings there and they made it so perfect! As it turns out the St Regis is in the heart of everything. You couldn't ask for a more perfect location with the best shopping, restaurants and nightlife a short walk away. The Concierge suggested and made a reservation for us at a place called Coast. Coast is now my favorite restaurant in Vancouver! They also sent us to another amazing place.....called Sanafir. Sanafir reminds me of the "Buddah Bar" in Dubai. Anyway, the final surprise was when the bill arrived. There were no charges for the internet or phone calls. There were no charges for the use of the the conference room. The bill was so reasonable and the final tally so much less than I am used to paying in Vancouver that I had to read it twice to make sure it was right. Thank-you St Regis for everything. Your hotel is now my new favorite hotel in Vancouver. Dr. Michael Failla Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: Rafael F
Reviews.Content: I went to Vancouver to visit some friends, and recommended by a friend I stayed at St Regis. I couldn't choose better. Location, charm, personalized, cleanness, friendly and efficient staff. Everything was prompt to make me feel comfortable and enjoy the best of my stay in Vancouver. I strong recommend this hotel. You will not regret.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: neil r
Reviews.Content: So I had to come into Vancouver for business and was set up by my employer at some lee-than-stellar hotel downtown. Long story short, the first place was awful with terrible service and I had to leave. I went down the street to St Regis and it was the polar opposite. The staff were warm and welcoming, the room was spacious and comfortable, and i ended up extending my stay from 3 nights to 5, primarily because of St. Regis! I didn't want to leave. Next time I head back to Van, you can bet i'll be staying at the Reg!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL STAIRWELLS”
Reviews.Author: tfeeney69
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reviews, a hotel that delivers what they say “everything you deserve more than you expect” the inclusion I have never seen in any other hotel: full breakfast for two, internet, LONG DISTANCE FREE!!!! Gym passes to the beautiful Steve Nash, business center usage, faxing, FIJI water. If that was not enough the manager wrote me a personalized welcome note asking me to call if he could be of service. The staff were at my beck and call, the restaurant recommendation just great, I went to Two Chefs and a Table, one of the dine packages and they gave me a taxi voucher to get there. If you want fab local food have their five course menu. The rooms are perfectly cleaned and appointed. Room attendants that greet you. Over all a great hotel with a BIG heart and a SMALL elevator. That is offset with stairs wells that are also beautifully appointed with original art, carpeted, nice wallpaper with funky light fixtures. My favorite piece of art was beside room 210 I look at it daily. I can only say that if my travels take to YVR again I WILL stay with them.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Kelly T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here shortly before Christmas and we couldn't have been more pleased with this find. The rooms were very comfortable and homey. There was a fantastic breakfast every morning included with the room. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and friendly in giving advice for places to eat as well as what sites to see. The hotel was right around the corner from the sky train so we could come and go all around Vancouver at a moments notice. We would highly recommend this hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas D
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 4 nights at St Regis.... There are plusses and minuses to this hotel..... I was with a group of approx 30 people for business meetings... Negatives.. 1. Some of the rooms are VERY small. The room I was allocated also had a wall 2 feet from the window and virtually no natural light so I requested a change. The second room was at the front of the hotel with a street view but was even smaller than the first room. Fortunately I was on my own as two people in the room would have been quite tricky!... 2. The business office consists of 2 computers off the lobby and no printer that I could find.... 3. The bar is a seedy sports bar.... 4. There is no restaurant and the room in which breakfast is served has the ambience of a railway station cafeteria.... 5. There is only one elevator used by both staff and guests and is very European in size, ie. holds about 4 max. We found it quicker to walk up and down. ... 6. There are no business meeting rooms in the hotel, you have to rent a room at a university building down the street. Positives... 1. The staff were very friendly... 2. The rooms were clean and modern... 3. Breakfast is included.... 4. All local and international tel calls are included. I have stayed in many different hotels in Vancouver over the years and in my opinion there are much better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant with a few nice surprises!”
Reviews.Author: Whizzzy
Reviews.Content: I agree with the good reviews here and thought I could provide more detail. Pros: Very friendly, pleasant and efficient staff, they work hard to give you city information, directions, restaurant suggestions. The room I had (#301) did not have street noise from below, although some of my associates staying on the 1st floor did hear some night sounds from the street. Great location, being just a few blocks from the Robson Street shopping district, a few blocks from the waterfront, next door to a T station (Granville stop) and bus routes. The room is a bit small, but very clean and well appointed with muted color theme and blackout windows (plus a small window that actually opens)- a large walk in closet with light and safe and iron/board, dresser, desk and chair with lamp and computer hookups, flat screen TV with a good choice of channels plus on demand movies ($), upholstered chair and a very comfortable bed with pillow top. The desk includes a note pad and pen. The bathroom is a good size with nice glass & tile shower (hand held with holder), plenty of hot water, and nice marble and decorative tile with dark cabinets and wood decoration. You get 2 big towels, 2 vanity towels and 2 face cloths. The toiletries include shampoo, conditioner, lotion and a vanity kit of nail files, cotton pads and qtips. You get a large rectangular bar of soap - my only comment would be having 2 bars would be nice so you are not always moving it from the shower to the sink. The coffee maker is located in the bathroom - reg and decaf coffee and some tea, coffeemate (real cream like Land O Lakes mini-moos that don't need refrig would be nicer), and a hair dryer There is a lighted makeup mirror and two nice robes. There's an IPod docking station/clock as well, but I could not figure out how to set the alarm, so I had the front desk set up wake up calls for me that worked well. The surprises I mentioned above include: (1) you can get a free day pass from the front desk to the Steve Nash gym next door to the hotel (nice facility with all expected machines and free weights, dressing rooms with locks you can set yourself, towel service - no pool.) (2) the breakfast is included in the room cost and is substantial and in a very pretty wood panelled room in the basement that has flat screen TV's; there are 3 breakfast choices consisting of a bacon/egg type combo (apple chicken sausage or ham available) with toast and potatoes or you can swap potatoes out for a nice fresh fruit cup, and fresh juices (orange, pink grapefruit, cranberry, apple); a second choice of a continental breakfast that can be a belgium waffle, danishes, yogurt and fruit or their own granola (good); or a third choice of omlett with all the fixin's and toast. There's a variety of good bread choices for toast, and for the gluten free folks a tasty rice bread toast. (3) worldwide phone calls are free; (4) the St. Regis bar next door is a large open space pub-like woody area with good beer choices and tasty food (I ditto the previous steak sandwich thumbs up from another reviewer.) (5) Gotham steak house is next door on the other side and is a very pretty bar with good steaks if a bit expensive. There are also free apples and newspapers in the small lobby area for guests, and a business center off the lobby with free internet access and a number of terminals available. Although no transport is offered, cabs regularly drive by and the front desk will call for you. Also, the hotel has parking for $25 per day, which is one of the more inexpensive hotel parking options other than farther distance public parking. Con The elevator (only one) is tiny and you can wait a while for it, especially in the morning in the breakfast room. I took to taking the stairs, which was probably good exercise - but note the stairs are not accessible that I could see from the breakfast room. There are stairs from there into the St. Regis bar that has an entrance into the lobby, but it is closed in the morning hours due to liquor license rules. I would stay here again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tmstraveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Staff was very helpful with recommendations for dining and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl I
Reviews.Content: I loved this quaint hotel with beautiful and spotless rooms. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The full breakfast was amazing. The location is excellent as you can walk to many restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a gem in owntown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: mitchybc
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the St Regis for 1 week and was very impressed by the caliber of service and the amenities. Free phone calls world wide, free secure internet, and breakfast was included which as delicious and made to order.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Prior to Alaska Cruise”
Reviews.Author: niftyfiftyCalgary
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel due to the proximity of the Canada Place Pier and ratings from past "tripadvisors reviews". What can I say other than they treated you like royalty from the minute you step into the lobby. Breakfast is not a Buffet but rather "sit down order from the menu" which we were gladly suprised with. We had a corner room and had windows on two wall (thus traffic noise) and our travelling companions had an inner room which was a bit smaller but "no noise". I must say that for the price, selection and service you could not go wrong in selecting this hotel and their services. For the heritage of the hotel, rooms were very accomodating, bathrooms where very updated and overall appearance was very cared for, thus extending a warm and inviting stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Welshcake2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the St Regis from the positive comments from Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We were able to check in early and our check in was quick and professionally done by Juan and very informative. We had the room we requested and the room was a good size with a great bathroom and shower.The standard of the decor and furnishings were excellent. We found every member of staff excellent, friendly and polite and very professional. Like other reviewer's the free international calls, breakfast and WiFi are great and such an added bonus. Excellent location,you know its a city hotel so there is going to be some noise. I always travel with ear plugs but didn't need them! If in Vancouver again I would have no hestitation, this would be the hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel -- will recommend to visitors”
Reviews.Author: JD549
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel; beautiful rooms, friendly staff, excellent food and service. I'll recommend the St. Regis to friends coming to Vancouver for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel we have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: Kayvan N
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, complete service...what ever needed for a relax stay is available. very good location

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY SUPERB!”
Reviews.Author: Richard1491
Reviews.Content: Arranged for a group to stay here after spending a week at another downtown hotel in Vancouver back in April. Last hotel was also great, but add on costs were terrible. The St Regis is smaller, quaint, personable, pays close attention to customer needs and wants, great location. AND, the FULL breakfast included in the room was the best ever. I'll stay here again either as an individual or with another group!!!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Vancouver!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WendyBux
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the St. Regis on August 20/11 with three others from work. We had two separate rooms and both were extremely well appointed, quiet and so clean and welcoming. The St. Regis staff go out of their way to ensure your check in is smooth and welcoming, they really do care that you are staying with them. All requests are handled efficiently, quickly and with a smile...if you have issues staying at the St. Regis, please reflect upon your expectations as this hotel has absolutely no deficiency. Will be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Tied for my favourite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: JJ_vacations
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot but don't typically write Tripadvisor reviews, but this one actually made me take the time to send a commendation. Wow -- what a great hotel!!!! We were only in Vancouver for 1 night after an Alaska cruise but almost wish we could have stayed longer to enjoy this place. The location was absolutely perfect -- it's in the heart of downtown, walking distance from the cruise port, restaurants, public transit, the gas lamp district, and you name it. It's 2 blocks from the Sky Train so you can walk out of the hotel with your luggage and be on the direct train to the airport in 3 minutes for only $2.50-3.50 (vs. a $40+ taxi ride). We arrived early in the a.m. and our room wasn't ready yet but the staff welcomed us anyway, gave us use of the business office, gave us directions for sightseeing, and took care of our bags without us barely even asking. When we arrived back in the afternoon, they greeted us by name and sent us to our room where our bags were already waiting for us. We typically only get that type of service in high-priced resorts! The room - a smart queen guestroom - was decorated with a cool blue palette that was a nice combination of contemporary with classic finishes. It wasn't a huge room but it was comfortable and the closet and the bathroom were sizeable. The shower stall and bathroom were gorgeous. The electronics panel in the room was top-notch and so much better than the typical hotel for charging anything and/or displaying your laptop on the room's flat-screen. The only small downside is that the walls are thin - you can hear people in the hallway pretty well - but it's an old hotel and it added character. After a great night stay, we headed down for breakfast and were expecting a quick uneventful meal. We were pleasantly surprised with a wonderful, home-cooked, hearty breakfast that far exceeded expectations. The only other hotel that has exceeded my expectations like this is Hotel Le Crystal in Montreal, which is the only place I'll stay in that city. This was our first time in Vancouver but we now know that this is the only place we'll stay next time we're here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay-a must while visiting in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine L
Reviews.Content: Staff at front desk were incredibly helpful, delicious breakfasts & accommodating. On our last day we came down a bit late for breakfast & Gerry Kleinhout the head chef did an amazing job to accomodate us, even though they were into lunch mode, he made a delicious breakfast for us. Staff at front desk could not do enough for us with answering our transit questions, even to finding a measuring tape-thanks Merl MacDonald-you were amazing. Rooms were comfortable & spotless. We can't wait to come back for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Traveller17
Reviews.Content: I booked the St. Regis Holt Renfrew Shopping Experience - and it was just excellent - worth every penny. The King Executive Suite was perfect, small'ish, but keep in mind it's a boutique hotel. The service was flawless; I felt expected and appreciated. There was a dossier with shopping itinerary and welcome information together with a gift bag of Holt Renfrew goodies in my suite upon arrival. The staff at the hotel and at Holt Renfrew were an absolute delight - especially Michael the Bartender at the St. Regis Bar & Grill on Saturday night! I felt very safe; the elevator is only operated by guest swipe card as is the front door to the hotel after hours. My suite was surprisingly quiet considering how busy Vancouver streets are. I'm looking forward to staying at the St. Regis again and wouldnt hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “highly reccomended”
Reviews.Author: BrianBARROW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in July ,the rooms have been refurbished to a very high standard and were very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpfull and breakfast was brilliant, only fault i could find with Vancouver was the street beggars who were quite aggresive and plentiful but i suppose every city has these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: 70Lynn
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with friendly helpful staff. Clean & spacious room and free international calls and internet facilities. The breakfasts were excellent with lots of choices of cooked, pastries and fresh fruit. It is just a short walk from the marinas and seafront. and there are lots of great eating places around. Would definitely stay here again if we come to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hot breakfast and good location – all you need in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: burukku16
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the St Regis Hotel and very much enjoyed our stay. The location is great and the breakfast is quite simply one of the best I’ve ever had in a hotel. Guests are spoilt for choice of breakfast items, which included custom omelettes, eggs, bacon, sausages, ham, toast, fruit salad, potatoes, cereal, pastries, lots of juice options, coffee and more – all presented with full table service in a nice dining room. It was a huge meal that kept us going well into mid-afternoon each day – and it’s included in the price of the room, something you just can’t beat. The staff at the St Regis were very friendly and knowledgeable, and we were delighted that Juan thought to tell us about the annual fireworks show happening the first evening we arrived. We were not aware it was happening and it was definitely something that was not to be missed. Our room was a queen-size and our travel companions stayed in a king-size room. The rooms themselves didn’t appear to differ much in size or amenities, other than the bed in the king room being bigger. It’s worth taking this into consideration if you decide to splurge and pay the higher rate for the king room. The bed was very comfortable and had European-style duvets in place of top sheets and blankets like American hotels tend to have. The bathroom was also nicely presented, had a great shower and featured under-floor heating, which is such a luxury (as were the soft, plush bathrobes that were provided)! We did think that the room seemed a little small, especially for the price we paid, but overall we were pleased with it. It would have been nice to have a fridge/mini-bar in the room and we felt this was a significant oversight for a hotel of this star rating. On more than one occasion during our stay we agreed that a fridge would have been a helpful thing to have. Noise from the street was also a minor issue for us on the Friday night of our stay. Although the room had double-glazed windows, we were on the first floor facing the street and the Friday night revellers got a little bit raucous in the wee hours of the morning! Maybe consider asking for a room higher up in the building to avoid this. It’s also worth mentioning that St Regis has a lovely ‘business’ center with computers and free high-speed internet located just off the lobby. It also has a great bar right next door and attached to the hotel (breakfast is served in the basement here) – perfect for a nightcap at the end of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Truly amazing hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: DarrenNCSU
Reviews.Content: Free WiFi. Free *cooked to order* breakfast. Reasonable downtown parking. Just a few minutes walk from Gastown and the waterfront. You can't beat it in Vancouver. The staff was amazingly nice, and the rooms were outrageously clean and comfortable. This is how all hotels should be -- truly a standout in a world full of forgettable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terffic experience, will return”
Reviews.Author: Adam F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at St. Regis Hotel for a week while attending a conference at the Vancouver Convention Centre, which is a pleasant 12 minute walk away. Great location, with good restaurants and shopping nearby, and easy access by train from the airport. Room is nicely appointed and impeccably clean. Staff uniformly courteous and helpful. Great value includes ample breakfast, free wifi and international phone calls. When I return to Vancouver I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: twiglene
Reviews.Content: Great accommodations. Very friendly staff. Great staff and food in bar. Absolutely fantastic breakfast included with lodging. Nice to be able to make international phone calls. Would definitely recommend this place for anyone to stay in Vancouver. Top notch hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagzRoss
Reviews.Content: This is THE best hotel in Vancouver. We have stayed at the Pan Pacific and at the Westin Bayshore, but value for money, I dont think we will ever consider sataying anywhere else but here in future. The staff are truely fabulous and the most helpful I have ever come accross. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated and apointed. They are extremely comfrotable. The breakfasts are great, the business centre good, and there are free phone calls anywhere from the room. Unbeleivable. Made use of that to call the UK twice. Free bottled water in the room too. The parking is convenient and there is a great bar attached to the hotel. Location is just perfect. I cant praise this place enough,

Reviews.Title: “"TOPS"”
Reviews.Author: RONMIEL
Reviews.Content: Our stay of three days was too short. The accommodations were sweet. The concierge, RYAN, was so HELPFUL to us: thank you for making our stay memorable! The central location was so great for all we did after our cruise. The beds were comfy and free phone world over was valuable; add free internet in a boutique style hotel with great free breakfast(full), and a great steakhouse and another pub: this hotel has it all. We highly recommended it for any stay. Did I mention free Fiji water in our room?

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the best hotel in Vancouver!!”
Reviews.Author: changs8989
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at St Regis in June 2011 and were very pleased of the choice of hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Ivan at the front desk has in-depth knowledge of all the good eateries. He recommended Miku to us and we ate there for lunch and then dinner the same day. Thanks Ivan - Miku is just heavenly!! St Regis is also centrally located, opposite a big shopping mall and walking distance to Canada Place and other tourist attractions. The free international calls came as a big bonus for us too. We loved St Regis and would definitely come back. - the Changs from Singapore

Reviews.Title: “The BEST of the best - St. Regis deserves to be rated at the top!”
Reviews.Author: nanaguide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St. Regis on August 1. We got there really early but they were so accomodating. They found us a room that was ready. They went out of their way to help us with parking and our luggage. The room was small but elegant and the bathroom was fantastic! The business center was great. The best is the breakfast in the morning - WOW!!!!!! The breakfast is a 5 star breakfast - like a fine restaurant. We also stayed there on August 9 after our cruise - same fantastic service. They kept our luggage and gave us directions to the places we wanted to visit. All the employees were so helpful and courteous. I definitely would stay there again - it is so conveniently located. We walked to Canada Place, Airtrain station, Sears, Bay Company and nice eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: clc043
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel in Vancouver in a central location. Staff was extremely helpful in anticipating our every need. Delicious breakfast served by friendly staff. Room was clean, bed very comfortable, with convenient amenities (i.e. computer connections, long distance telephone calls, etc.) Our stay was a great way to relax and enjoy Vancouver after an eleven day cruistour in Alaska. Will definitely go back when we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, wonderful staff, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: RBW5711
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the St. Regis for our 4 day/3 night trip to Vancouver. The hotel’s location made the hotel a perfect home-base for our trip. It is conveniently located within walking distance to the waterfront (which is just beautiful), Vancouver City Centre subway station (2 block walk away, making trips to the airport very easy) and several bus stops (the bus to the Museum of Anthropology was 2 blocks away and the bus pickup for the Capilano shuttle and bus to Whistler were 4 blocks away). We saved a lot of money by never having to take a taxi. The staff was very friendly, cheery and helpful. Our hotel room was a bit on the small side, but it was very nicely decorated and I loved the heated floor in the bathroom. I also really appreciated the complimentary Wi-Fi, bottles of water, phone calls (both international and domestic) and warm breakfast (the omelets were excellent). My husband and I would stay at the St. Regis again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the staff”
Reviews.Author: rbnk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis the night we got off of our cruise ship. The room was cool, and inviting. It had everything we needed, including two robes, two bottles of free water, two chocolates, and FREE phone calls, even to the states (this was very nice for us as we hadn't been in contact with our kids and families from the ship and we don't have international calling on our cell phones!) and I have to say that I LOVED the bathroom, especially the shower!! There was a free breakfast - that was way beyond your typical hotel breakfast. You are able to pick what you would like from their printed menu, and it is brought to your table and well as your choice of morning beverages. It was delicious! The people at the front desk were very helpful and we had the good luck of bumping into the gentleman that was working on their security system (he didn't even work directly for the hotel!) He talked to us about where to go in both Vancouver and Seattle. Because of him and one of the gals at the counter we went to Grandville Island and had a great time! We were leaving on that day, and they happily stored our luggage for us! We were leaving on the train that evening and when we got back to the hotel the manager was there and we had a very nice conversation with him about Vancouver and our day. He brought us free waters and let us sit in their comfy chairs in the computer room and watch TV until we needed a taxi. They were more than happy to call us a taxi when we needed to leave. What a wonderful place to stay in Vancouver. I highly recommend the St. Regis and look forward to staying there when we can get back to Vancouver for a longer period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy I I
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the St. Regis hotel for three nights while awaiting a cruise to Alaska. We could not find fault with this hotel. The staff at reception were the most helpful they could be with advice and recommendations. Full marks to them. Even helped with the IPad that was not working. The rooms were very modern and clean and we would most certainly recommend this hotel for a stay in Vancouver. Handy to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful rooms for the value!”
Reviews.Author: bayfieldbelle
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is a perfect location for getting anywhere in Vancouver! Also has a great sports Bar attached, for sporting fans, or just and evening nightcap. The rooms were clean and well appointed, and service and staff could not be beat. The concierge were all so very helpful, with travel tips and excellent restaurant suggestions. The breakfast is WONDERFUL , and a great way to start any day. Loved this hotel and would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SCharbs
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay. A great location and the room was excellent. A very nice bathroom (huge). The parking garage is in the next building, not very far. Lots of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start”
Reviews.Author: ETWTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and got the perfect start of our vacation in Canada. Specially appreciated the nicely decorated and quiet room (5th floor) since we were jet lagged. Loved the big bathroom with roomy shower. Very friendly and personal service and a central location as well. Only downside was the not very charming breakfast room located in the basement, but the food was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, well managed, high-end finishes and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: garyfromSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St. Regis for 7 nights and gained a lot of insight into what a great hotel this is. A pleasant high-end boutique hotel which is not affiliated with chain hotels. It was completely renovated with high quality finishes throughout and not just in the lobby. Standard rooms are on the small side, but we elected to upgrade to a studio suite which had a living area, bedroom and very nice bath. The shower was a good size with high quality non-slip marble floors and very nice counter-tops. A great choice if you prefer boutique hotels that don’t allow smoking or pets and want to minimize any allergies that you may have. In my mind, the hotel is not too big and not too small…..just the right size! St. Regis is very well managed with excellent staff at the front desk, exceptionally clean, and offers a full breakfast in their downstairs breakfast room (perfect size with wood flooring and paneling) which is included in the price. Breakfast is not a buffet but you sit at a table and order from a fixed menu. The hot food and sides are very good and the servers are efficient with a great attitude to make breakfast a very pleasant experience and handle special requests very well. Breakfast stops at 10 AM or 11 AM on weekends. They also include free Internet and phone calls. The extras made our stay an excellent value given the disadvantage of the current USD exchange rate. Staff knows the best Vancouver restaurant scene (especially Breanne at front desk…a foodie) as well as where to go and what to do no matter what the weather is. The moment you arrive it is very obvious that the staff takes a lot of pride in their services and care about their guests. They also have a good size on-site restaurant (done in very nice wood finishes) which offers an alternative if you don’t want to venture out at night. The only con is their small elevator. But the hotel is just 5 stories which minimizes the wait time from floor to lobby. The City of Vancouver strictly enforces parking. There are expensive meters everywhere. It is not a good idea to have a car and you don’t really need one due to the vast number of public transportation options. Our experience during our stay was Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: mlricker
