Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in the downtown area that is very nicely decorated (looks newly decorated), very clean and has many technology connectivity features...... Staff friendly and helpful. I would certainly stay here again if I get back to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel, GREAT People!”
Reviews.Author: ma3rk
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the St. Regis Hotel in Vancouver. The staff was excellent and couldn't be more helpful. The rooms were immaculate and the decor exceptional. It was a very comfortable place to stay and a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: talkshowsonmute
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel definitely lives up to what I've read on this website! Every single staff member was friendly and always had a smile on their face! Benjamin and Juan were my favourites! Always helpful and friendly. If you have any questions about tours ask these guys! There's nothing they don't know. Room was small but very cosy! The bathroom was very nice and the bath robes (supplied with the room) were an added bonus! The restaurant in the hotel was delicious and very reasonably priced! Location was great! Right next door was a sky train station and only one block away there is a bus stop. Apart from that it's near to shops and restaurants and pretty much everything! When you book any day tours they pick you up from outside the door. Great stay in this hotel wouldn't change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: TandR_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis for four nights as the last stop in our three-week roundtrip of BC and Alberta, and it was our favorite hotel of the whole trip. The hotel seems recently renovated, everything is new and stylish. The room had a reasonable size, and the bathroom was large. We also liked the big walk-in closet that enabled us to stow away all our luggage and keep the room neat and tidy. The breakfast was full-service (no buffet), - excellent and with quick service. The location is a minute away from the shopping and entertainment on Robson and Granville streets, with Chinatown, Gastown and Canada Place just 10-15 minute walks away. Finally, as other reviewers have pointed out, the hotel staff is remarkably nice, in a completely natural and relaxed way. Whether in the front desk, in the breakfast room or just running into someone in the corridor or elevator, - staff members are ready to share their knowledge and advice. One of the best hotel experiences we ever had. Note that the hotel entrance is right on the street, with no parking. If you arrive by car, better be prepared to unload your stuff quickly.

Reviews.Title: “An urban gem”
Reviews.Author: PatMcGill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few nights before going on a cruise. Fabulous furnishings, great service from a very attentive staff and an unbelievable full breakfast, included. Seemed European. Down the block from a culinary school, stop in for lunch. But be aware of ambient street noise, it is a city!

Reviews.Title: “Good location; good price; great staff and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rga777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for a few days. The hotel was well-located in downtown Vancouver. The room did not have a view and was a little on the small side but was clean, modern, and well-appointed. Wi-fi was very good and free international phone calls was a nice treat. The breakfast is excellent and definitely worth a good portion of the room rate. It is a small hotel so you need to keep in mind there are few on staff. We returned to our room mid-afternoon one day and put the "do not disturb" sign on the door despite the lack of housekeeping at that time. When we left a couple of hours later we found out that we missed our only opportunity for housekeeping. We asked Brittany and Ryan (?) at the front desk if we could have new towels. We came back to find out Ryan made our room himself. In fact, I was thinking of giving the hotel on overall rating of four stars but the staff (especially Brittany and Ryan) were so much better than even strong staff at other hotels that I need to give this one five stars.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL- highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lafayettepurduefan
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel. The location was great- right in the heart of Vancouver and close to the convention center. The amenities were fabulous- free internet, free WONDERFUL breakfast, free international calls, free bottled water in room everyday. The hotel is beautiful on the inside. The rooms are very nice- specious bathroom. I was in Vancouver primarily for business with a few days extra added to the trip for fun. It was a great place to stay. We would stay here again. Staff was wonderful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Bobfrint
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel - clean, comfortable beds, great location and, most importantly, the friendliest and most knowledgeable staff I've ever encountered. We really enjoyed talking with the front desk staff, the servers in the breakfast area and the maids and maintenace folks. The attached bar is very nice and convenient, and the included breakfast is great.They also provide nice amenities at no charge - free international calling and free internet. The rooms are on the small side, but certainly adequate. The bathroom is well appointed with plenty of room. I'll definately stay there next time I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel in Centre of Vancouver - we will return”
Reviews.Author: Serendipitous2011
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many hotels in many cities and this one rates very highly with me. Elegant decor, staff very accommodating, nothing too much trouble, bags carried up with no expectations of a tip. Great breakfast and.....free international calls to wherever in world for as long as you wish. Had to return to hotel to ask a favour a week after we left and they recognized me and assisted with my request without demur. Much much nicer than any of the big hotels I stayed at. A bit expensive for one person travelling in the high season but reasonable if a double or twin share. However, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Asolutely fantastic, would highly recommend it to friends & family”
Reviews.Author: poolboyUk
Reviews.Content: Our room was spotless and kept that way the whole of the 2 weeks we stayed here. The staff were extremely polite and very helpful. The bar/restaurant was great, good service and great food choices, everything we tried tasted excellent and the portions were large enough to share often. Our 'personal waitress' Dora was so much fun and provided high standards of service. Will definitely go back there. Breakfast was very good and started our day off well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in a Great City -would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: tseki
Reviews.Content: First of all, amazing location! Just a walk away from many fantastic places to eat, and practically right above the subway line as well. The rooms were classy and really comfortable. Just the kind of environment where I would like to return to after a long day. Complimentary breakfast was a fantastic way to start the day, along with the wi-fi to pass time. I did have 2 minor cons during my stay. The wifi had terrible connectivity when I was lying in bed, perhaps due to being near the edge of the hotel. Unfortunately, the checkout was not as friendly and swift as I had anticipated. Great stay regardless, and would definitely revisit again if I were to visit Vancouver in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: J_M_S_Toronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the St. Regis for 5 nights (July 22-July 26). We were very impressed with this cozy, charming boutique hotel, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It is ideally located in downtown Vancouver, within easy walking distance of many attractions or transit options (Sky Train, taxi, car rental, etc). The St. Regis has a retro, upsacle charm. It does not contain too many rooms, nor is it a high rise hotel, which also gives it a cozy, intimate feeling. There is only one elevator in the hotel, so be prepared to wait on occasion if it gets busy. Since we stayed on the first floor, we found it faster to take the stairs if the elevator was backed up. And it is the smallest elevator we have ever seen. We stayed in a Queen Suite on the first floor. The room faced onto Dunsmair and looked directly into the Tim Horton's and 24-hour A&W across the street. I would recommend trying to book a room on a higher floor, with a better view and perhaps not so noisy with traffic and pedestrians below. The Queen Suite itself was on the smallish side, with a separate sitting area (sofa, desk, chair, console table with TV), and bedroom area (queen bed + TV). The decor was classy, with a designer's touch. It was kept immaculately clean during our stay. The bathroom was luxurious and well-appointed. We found the St. Regis staff to be very accomodating and helpful. We experienced several minor issues with the room fixtures, and they were promptly fixed by the staff. The front desk staff was polite and cheerful, and they took the time to answer questions about Vancouver-area sites & attractions. Breakfast was included in our booking, a great way to start the day. The free long-distance calls, wi-fi, Fiji water, Acca Kappa spa toiletries, plush robes...all little touches that went a long way to make our stay so enjoyable. Overall, the charm, quality, location and value of the St. Regis were fantastic and we recommend it to anyone looking for hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: Jonahs
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, with great desk service helping with what to see in the area and locations for dinner. The Skytrain is a short walk away giving you more access to the city. We walked to Gastown and had dinner there. The only thing we didn't like were the "tall" pillows that were lumpy, everything else was terrific. Breakfast is not so much a buffet as it is cooked to order after choosing from 3-4 options on the menu, and very nicely done. We would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Mind as well be a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: FirstClass2011
Reviews.Content: I definitely felt taken care of during all of my stays at the St. Regis. I take business trips to Vancouver almost every weekend and I always stay at the St Regis. It has the price of a 3-star hotel and the service of a 4-star.... just best value from my experience. You have to try the breakfast, the steakhouse, and the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay--Would Definitely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: CameronH_11
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Vancouver knowing nothing about the city and having no contacts here. I stayed 3 nights at the St. Regis and it was a perfect hotel for someone new to the area. Small, elegant, and cozy. Very good downtown location and the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in downtown.”
Reviews.Author: frankg_2011
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a hotel in a centralized location in downtown Vancouver and choose this one in the end due to its full complimentary breakfast. I was pleasantly surprised to find that it's next to the Skytrain stop at Granville. And that the Canada Line station (subway) to Vancouver airport is a 5-minute walk around the corner. Gastown/Vancouver Lookout is about a 10-minute walk to the northeast and Robson St. with all the shopping area being a 5-minute walk southwest. The room was immaculately clean with complimentary bottled water and chocolate on the pillow bit. Free Wi-Fi and long distance call from the room phone are provided, which were very nice touches. All in all, the hotel was a great base to start exploring a vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “I can see why this hotel is rated so highly.”
Reviews.Author: TravelTexan1
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at the St. Regis. It is a pretty hotel and I had a great room and a wonderful bathroom to use. The major positives: (1) The Skytrain Granville station is practically next door to the hotel and the stations for the other lines are close by as well, (2) The quality of the bed was close to a Westin Heavenly bed, (3) The room was clean and well-decorated- nice bled of modern and traditional, (4) Not sure if all rooms have this, but I had a wonderful soaking tub in my bathroom (room 105), (5) The breakfast in the morning was excellent, (6) Loved the free phone calls back home- really cut down on my mobile phone bill and (7) Free high speed Internet, used wired, but they have wireless. The negatives: (1) Get ready to hop in and out of cabs really quickly since there is not much of a place for the cabs to stop and (2) if a little street noise bothers you do not get a room with a street view. These are very minor negatives in my opinion and I would gladly stay here again and highly recommend staying here. Note: I did not eat at the bar/restaurant in the hotel so I have no idea of food quality there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Lots of Extras”
Reviews.Author: cantravel00
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a good experience in this hotel. My room was extremely modern and attractively decorated. There are quite a few little extras like free Fiji water daily in the rooms and little chocolates on the pillows. Breakfast is also included. Then the real stunner - free telephone calls to anywhere in the world. The only drawback is occasional street noise. But it's close to everything you want to see in downtown Vancouver. Overall, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PinkLady66
Reviews.Content: its just a quick walk from the hotel to Gastown, where you will find the Steam Clock and great restaurants and souvenier shops. We ate at a restaurant called Rouge which we thought was very good and the meals were not the large size we thought they may be (which I have found it fairly common for North America) so that was nice as they were a much more managable size. The hotel was lovely, and the staff very helpful and friendly. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here agian”
Reviews.Author: melanie1964
Reviews.Content: We arrived from a long flight from London to a warm welcome by the staff. The room was clean, small, but elegantly furnished with good facilities. The hotel is located 5 mins walk from the waterfront and is an excellent location to see all the main attractions. The bar next door which is part of the hotel, serves excellent food and the staff are particularly friendly. We took a seaplane to Victoria, to experience the Orca whales, this is awesome !! We left early in the morning, prior to breakfast, to get the amtrak train to Seattle, the hotel provided us with a hearty "breakfast to go" - this sums up the willingness of the staff to "go the extra mile" We would love to return to Vancouver one day and would definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rsilver4608
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vancouver for 2 nights after a cruise. Couldn't have been more pleased with the St. Regis, staff, accomodations and amenities. Particularly appreciated free wi-fi, business office and free phone calls. The location was great too. Only negative, no view.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel with Big amenities!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleBabs
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the St. Regis Hotel! We booked two junior king suites which was perfect for 3 people in each suite. Good location right around the corner from the Granville skytrain. Easy walking to Canada Place. All the staff were very helpful. We got recommendations for restaurants each day along with directions and what bus to take! The breakfasts are delicious! You can have a full breakfast or continental. The minute you sit down you are greeted and served your choice of juice, coffee or tea. Our room was always fresh and tidy after a day of sight seeing. Free bottled water is provided. Two robes are provided with a good size closet. Chest of drawers, a room safe,r efrigerator and coffee maker. I can't say enough positive things about the St. Regis Hotel. I would stay here again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: VooMed
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times. Sometimes for business, other times for pleasure. While the service and rooms are great, it's the little touches that win you over. Free long distance calling to anywhere in the world is, quite frankly, a godsend. The made to order free breakfast is amazing considering the "free" breakfasts other hotels offer. To be honest, the list of little touches that will impress you upon staying here are too many to mention. And there is something reassuring about staying at a hotel where the bedroom and bathroom are so well designed.

Reviews.Title: “Will Always Go Back Its Home Away Home”
Reviews.Author: MrBill29
Reviews.Content: Great service begins at the front desk and NEVER stops. Staff goes way out there way to make your stay as if you never left home. Super CLEAN and well appointed rooms, FREE phone service anywhere in the world, Outstanding FREE breakfast. Free Intenet Service From YVR to Hotel on Canada Line in 22mins @ 3.75 per person, why pay a cab 10 times that amount. Right in downtown Vancouver and walk to everything, Great City. Good Luck Brittany

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: allergymom
Reviews.Content: Room was very comfortable and clean, front desk was extremely helpful and courteous, and included made-to-order sit-down breakfast and free wireless internet made this a relatively good deal. ($25/day parking ate into some of those savings, but wasn't too bad for being in the heart of the city.) Will definitely stay here again if I'm lucky enough to get back to Vancouver sometime. One thing that would make the experience nicer (though difficult in the tight quarters of downtown) would be to provide somewhere to park & unload cars--they allow you to stop right in front of the hotel, but it's in the middle of traffic and seemed potentially harrowing.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE TO STAY IN VANCOUVER”
Reviews.Author: TheWhitePanther
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in downtown; close to shops, excellent restaurants, and the Vancouver Art Gallery! We were very tired from our travels and found our bed fantastically comfortable. The Staff were friendly/courteous/helpful- everything you come to expect when staying at a first-rate establishment. Originally, we were worried that there would be a lot of street noise; however, the rooms are outfitted with double-paned glass windows, which make a huge difference. The hotel is classified as a heritage building. Guests are in for a treat because the hotel possesses a modern charisma, supported by a touch of class. The St. Regis has a rich history and we left with a supreme sense of nostalgia. Meals were superb; we wanted to take the chef home with us! When you visit Vancouver this should be at the top of your list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Librabby
Reviews.Content: The location was great, walking distance to many areas and also close to all public transportation. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious (with a great hair blower!). There is also a nice, big safe in the room. The front desk staff was always very pleasant and very helpful with suggestions for restaurants or directions. The daily breakfast was hearty and delicious. The free worldwide calling was also amazingly generous. We had a great stay. Our only complaint was about the weather!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: anafricanincanada
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is one of my favourite hotels in Vancouver - my only gripe is it is not pet friendly. The benefits of staying here are too many to mention - For me Bed comfort rates as number 1 - then the central location, the friendly staff - the FREE global telephone calls, the business centre and best of all FREE internet - No gouging here ! So if you are on business this is the place to stay. Breakfast is included and is excellent - they used to have a buffet style of help yourself and you then just ordered the hot breakfast - I prefer this to ordering everything as is the case now - the quality and service is excellent but I was irritated by some rude demanding patrons on my last visit - the staff in the breakfast room need to be complimented on the professional way they dealt with this client - Having the buffet certainly would help staff during the rush hour. Note - they do not have a fridge in the room - I like a fridge for keeping milk for my morning coffee as I despise coffee creamer - so that is on my wish list. My pet hate is Ice makers - At the St Regis,the ice makers are in sealed rooms to silence them - Great thought has gone into every aspect of this hotel - so if they are not totally booked out - make sure you try them!

Reviews.Title: “A Royal Treat”
Reviews.Author: astrobohy
Reviews.Content: If you want 5 star service at a competitive price at a sophisticated hotel located in the heart of the city and accessible by transit to and from the airport, then this is the place for you. Don't bother staying at a weston, sheraton, or hilton. This place has free long distance, internet, and a real made to order breakfast and a great bar. it's just around the corner to clubs for the nigh owls as well. Superb service from all the staff. The beds are really comfy and the typical loud air conditioner is quiet as a whisper. The washrooms are marbled and glass showers are an upscale touch. Oh yeah, free bottles of water each day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service all round”
Reviews.Author: Tweetcoz
Reviews.Content: Great small boutique hotel. Was pleasantly surprised to learn that full breakfast was included, as is free wireless internet, as is free international calls!!! Their currency exchange rate was also the best. Very convenient to the train station and we took the skytrain to the airport - it was our first train ride to any airport, usually it is by taxi. The train trip to airport was only $3.75 each!!! Porters were very helpful. Requests for scales were sent up immediately. Advice on tours were given with great information. Would definitely come back to this hotel again and very happy to recommend everyone here. The room and bathroom is also very modern. Very clean and spacious enough.

Reviews.Title: “Mr”
Reviews.Author: Sept_2010_john
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a great city centre location. Having purposely picked a smaller hotel, we could not have chosen better. Excellent room, great staff and huge breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: soyyo26
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been completely renovated. Everything is new and modern. Very comfortable. The staff was outstanding, they couldn't do enough for us. Hotel is quiet, bed comfortable, and the complimentary full breakfast huge.

Reviews.Title: “6 nights at St Regis...”
Reviews.Author: dexter60811
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small and cute and soundproof, beds very comfortable.. Excellent breakfast,, Great location,.. Just one problem, the wooden shutters did not keep out all the light in the early mornings.. There were no curtains to cover the shutters.. This annoyed us a bit, as at 5.30am, we were woken up by the sun streaming in the slits.. But apart from this, we loved the St Regis.. I would stay here again.. Go Canucks!!

Reviews.Title: “High Quality good service”
Reviews.Author: wilf66
Reviews.Content: Very high quality, clean hotel. Spacious room. Great service. Very friendly personnel. Although slightly understaffed front desk/reception: a single telephone call to front desk alreay made the staff direct you to the other person behing the desk, in stead of putting the caller on hold. Staff at reception walked with me to the parking garage when I was uncertain how to get to my car at the other building, and carried all luggage! Standard in St Regis is: FREE telephone calls from your hotelroom all over the world. Never saw that before. Breakfast very extensive and in cosy part of the restauarnt. (Incident not the fault of hotel: disgusting commercial on all the 3 big television sets in the breakfast room during breakfast of a shaving burning tool. It showed in detail and zoomed in extensivley on shaving burning of hair being removed almost all over your body!!)

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A FIND!”
Reviews.Author: BLITZMA
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is excellent! The staff suburb, free wifi, free phone calls to anywhere in the world, great free breakfast, and a great value, I am giving the Hotel a five star because it was magnificent but we had a real problem sleeping. Our room was on the second floor facing the street. All hours of the night there was noise from outside; sirens, buses, but most of all loud drink people. Make sure you ask for a room on a high floor not facing the street!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely lived up to expectations...”
Reviews.Author: trapperjeff
Reviews.Content: Coming from Southern California and knowing that the St. Regis in Monarch Beach is an excellent option for residing in the South OC area, I was hoping this would provide the same. It's a bit smaller, but this is to be expected in the downtown area where everything is incredibly vertical, but overall, 100% satisfied with the outcome. The rooms are impeccably clean. I stayed in one of the suites with an adjoining room to the bedroom. Ameneties as lavish as I expected and very comfortable. The hotel staff went out of their way to make you feel comfortable. Room service was excellent. Internet was included and had adequate wi-fi. I think the only thing that I can say that was remotely a concern was the pressure on the showerhead was a bit weak, but the stay was on a while amazing and I'd definitely come back! By the way, breakfast is included each morning where you have a choice of great options that far supercede the typical "continental" breakfat. Locale is excellent near the CityCenter mall within a block and the SkyTrain or the Canada Line and a few blocks to the waterfront!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the most beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: nurmpa
Reviews.Content: We booked St. Regis because of the good reviews, amenities and location. Overall we were very pleased to all what hotel offered. Here are some pros and cons: Pros: - Superb location. Walking distance everywhere in downtown area, Chinatown(15min), Stanley park(20min), seafront(5min), Granville Island(30min), skytrain to YVR(10min with baggages, this option to YVR is very convenient and cheap. At weekends with fare saver tickets only 2,10) - Great staff, especially the younger man who has studied in Europe (can't remember the name). Very polite and eager to help. - Free WiFi is in my opinion a must nowadays. And in this hotel, it worked smoothly. - Free long distance calls. As we live in Europe this was an excellent bonus to us. - Room (King executive) was nice and kept clean. As we read before the trip, the room might be noisy, if it is located to street, but we found it none distracting. Though our room was in 3rd floor, but still, located to Dunsmuir street. It was somehow nice to be able to watch nightlife from window just before getting to asleep. - Bed was superb excellent! I tend to have bad back, but this bed didn't cause any harm to it, quite opposite. - Checkin and checkout were undetectable. Cons: - No handshower, only shower that was mounted to wall - Breakfast service at weekends. We had four weekend mornings and three of them were lousy. Especially one of them. We got service after 20min waiting, then we got some coffee and juice and made our order. When dishes arrived, they were totally mixed up, we didn't get what we ordered, not even the second try... BUT, place were very crowded, stuff busy and weekdays worked smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: sumerbk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took a trip to Vancouver, B.C. and we chose to stay at the St. Regis for it's convenient location and included amenities. We had heard good things about the St. Regis, and were very pleased with our stay. Breakfast is included with your room, and it definitely does not disappoint. The breakfast service at the St. Regis is not like your typical complimentary breakfast you find at most other hotels...it is set up like a restaurant (not buffet style) with a wide variety of menu choices. Service is quick and the food is delicious! Beware on weekends though - it gets crowded mid to late mornings. Our room was clean and very inviting. The hotel concierge service is also fantastic! One of the gentlemen (Benjamin) offered us a ton of valuable information regarding the hiking trails in and around Vancouver. He recommended Capilano Park to us, and it was one of our favorite memories of the entire trip. Benjamin was so helpful...providing us with a map of the park, driving directions, and even wild animal coaching incase we stumbled upon a bear or mountain lion on our hike (we didn't, but it was helpful to know how best to deal with the situation should something like that arise). Check in and check out were a breeze, and overall we were extremely pleased with our stay at the St. Regis! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrism4549
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in late June. Very, very good experience. Pro: - Great location, location - Lots of amenities included in the price including breakfast, and free wifi - Most of the staff was great, particularly Benjamin Con: - Breakast service was slow and not that great - They didn't let our daughter in the bar/grill area because she was underage for dinner

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, great service & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tuffy0317
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St. Regis Hotel (no relation to the Starwood chain of St. Regis hotels) while I was in Vancouver for a weekend conference. I chose the St. Regis largely because they were offering a discounted rate for my conference. It turned out to be a great choice. The list of amenities included in your room rate is exhaustive: a huge hot, made to order breakfast. WiFi (which worked well for me) & use of the hotel’s business center. Worldwide long distance calls. In-room bottled water (which I chugged like it was going out of style). Heck, the rooms even had a window you could open to let in the fresh mountain air & radiant heat in the bathroom floor. The location of the hotel, a block from two light rail stations & an easy walk to the hockey arena, convention center & cruise terminal, make it a great home base for both business & leisure travelers. In addition, the Starbucks in the building & the Tim Hortons across the street provide ample opportunities for caffeine. Check-in was easy, even at the dreadful hour of 1:00 am. The front desk staff was even patient in repeating most of their schpeel to me the next morning, since I had forgotten most of the key information in my jet-lagged haze. They also helped me out by converting a small sum of U.S. cash to Canadian dollars at a fairly reasonable exchange rate when my ATM card wouldn’t work. My “Smart Queen” room on the 4th floor was indeed smart - smartly decorated & wired with smart “green” technology. The hotel’s attention to detail in decorating is superb. The walls of my room were covered in one-shade-lighter-than-Tiffany-blue leather rectangles stitched together. The baseboards & crown modeling were painted a bright white & the curtains covering the room’s four windows achieved something few hotel curtains do: they were both stylish & actually kept out the light. The bathroom was small, but the lay out worked well, with lots of fluffy towels, a non-wussy hair dryers, & a surprisingly large stall shower. The small closet in the room contained just enough room to store a suitcase & a few hanging items & also contained a safe large enough to fit a laptop, a great security feature. I felt like a valued guest throughout my stay, always greeted warmly by the person working the front desk when coming & going. Even Friday night, when the streets, the hotel restaurant, & the hotel rooms themselves were lined with deliriously happy hockey fans (I was there during Game 5 of the Stanley Cup - lucky the game the Canucks won, and was not there for the riots that happened a week later), service was still top notch. Upon checking out, they held my suitcase for me behind the front desk to allow me to enjoy the day before returning to get it prior to my red-eye flight. When I find myself in Vancouver again, I won’t hesitate to stay at the St. Regis. The three-egg omelet the size of my head alone would be worth it. Some things to consider when planning your trip to the St. Regis: - Request a corner room on a high floor. The views of downtown are great, as is the light that pours in from the numerous windows. - The elevator is small. It can really only fit four adults, with minimal luggage. A great security feature to see, though, is that the elevator is only accessible with a room key. - If you’re in a hurry, let them know at breakfast when you first sit down. The speed of service can be tailored to your schedule, something I found out after having to shovel my eggs down to make an appointment I was running late for. - If you’re hungry, make sure & order room service or stop by the restaurant early. The kitchen closes at 10pm & there aren’t really any other places in the immediate vicinity to grab a decent late night bite to eat.

Reviews.Title: “perfect !”
Reviews.Author: masffonseca
Reviews.Content: Iam brazilian and spent only few time at st regis hotel , but everything was excellent ! The hotel, the staff , the room and all service were perfect ! If you are looking for a nice hotel , choose st regis !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LoveLife022
Reviews.Content: Everything from the friendly, helpful staff at the front desk to the clean room to the delicious breakfast was exceptional. The location in downtown Vancouver couldn't be better. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: steem21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here was 3 nights towards the end of our trip to Vancouver. The hotel is situated very well for all bus and train routes and had secure underground aprking for a price. You can walk anywhere from the hotel to the main sites in Vancouver. The hotel is very well appointed and we a had suite for the first night and then a "smart queen" room for the remainder of the stay. The suite is lovely and it was nice to have the extra room but the smaller queen room was adequate. Bathrooms were very nice. Our room faced onto Seymour Street and it was quite noisy in the mornings with traffic. We did stay when the riot broke out so we didn't get much rest that night! The staff are friendly and are very helpful. The free international calls is an excellent service that was used many times. Also the breakfast was fantastic and ensured that, if you go for the full hot option, you will not feel hungry for quite a while! All in all, a very nice hotel to stay in downtown Vancouver, but it can get a bit noisy due to its location on 2 busy streets.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!! Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Prue07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently whilst touring Canada. Hotel was perfect, room was immaculate and had updated decor including fantastic King size bed. Location of the hotel was excellent, we walked everywhere and the train station was right next door. Staff were very helpful, infact probably some of the best we had in the 5 weeks of travelling. They recommended us to the Vancouver Trolley Cart tour which was great and discounted when purchased through the hotel lobby. The free breakfast was amazing! There were some fantastic restaurants close by and great shops too! We couldnt say a bad thing about this hotel, and would absolutely stay here again. The location, staff and quality all great!

Reviews.Title: “REFRESHING CHANGE - LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT THE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: joy0530
Reviews.Content: I will definetly stay again when in Vancouver. The Hospitality was second to none. Very clean, modern rooms with comfy beds. Close to great shopping and Vancouver transit. Very accommodating, it seems everyone with the hotel loved working there. The General Manager recommended and got us into to some fabulous restaurants. Included breakfast was great, made to order. Didn't have a need but there is free international calling. The massage was one of the best I have had. Refreshing change from most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly service and good quality all around”
Reviews.Author: muzzik17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis after our Alaska cruise. The front desk service was uniformly wonderful - friendly, knowledgeable, helpful. The room (101) was large and comfortable. We had read on TripAdvisor to request a rear room to avoid the street noise, so we had no view (mechanical equipment etc.) but it was very quiet. The breakfasts are plentiful and delicious. We liked the free wi-fi and phone calls as well. All in all, a great hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel..will return!”
Reviews.Author: NYLover30
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from check-in to check out. Room was beautiful and clean. Staff went out of their way to offer assistance for anything and advice on sites to visit. Would recommend to family and friends and will definitly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service, Guestrooms and Location”
Reviews.Author: Sunhazel25
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and this is by far one of the best hotels at which I've stayed. The entire staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The guestrooms are so comfortable. I slept very well despite the fact I was on the first floor and on a busy street. The bathrooms are huge! I actually had a hard time getting out of the tub because it is so big and deep. Not a bad problem to have. The food in the restaurant is excellent and there is a decent selection for vegetarians. Next time I go back to Vancouver, I am staying at The St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location To See The City”
Reviews.Author: Bluemozzie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - you can walk to most of the main tourist attractions. Free phone calls both national and international - plus free internet access. The pub adjoined to the hotel is fantastic - great atmosphere and food. The staff are really friendly and helpful - and honest (we accidentally left our safe wide open all day and were HUGELY relieved to discover nothing had been touched - including a large amount of cash, iphone, ipad, camera, etc, - even though the room had been serviced while we were out). Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: PoblanoJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while I was in town with colleagues for a conference at the convention center and could not have been happier with the hotel. The service was truly outstanding. Brittany, Juan, and others at the front desk quickly learned our names and went out of their ways to anticipate our needs. A mistake on our bill was quickly resolved. When he heard that our room was having a roommate change on the last night, Juan checked which bed was switching over and made sure the sheets were changed without our having to ask. Location was great -- in the middle of the action, around the corner from the Skytrain to the airport, and a ten minute walk to the convention center. All of the included amenities (free phone calls anywhere in the world, faxes, internet, bottled water, and great breakfasts) kept the costs from adding up, and simplified our lives. Breakfasts were great -- you have your choice of one of three very complete breakfast packages made to order, but the cheerful and helpful staff had no problem with my straying from the script and ordering a la carte. The room itself (a "smart double") was not huge, but the bed was fine and everything was very clean and in working order. The housekeeping staff clearly takes pride in its work. The room was spotless always. If I'm ever back in Vancouver, it will be my first choice in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “First-class boutique gem”
Reviews.Author: GeneNutmeg
Reviews.Content: If you look up "how to provide a boutique hotel experience" in Wikipedia, you will find a photo of the St. Regis. Not even the loud and boisterous all-night-partying crowd following Game 5 of the Stanley Cup playoffs on the first of my three night here could detract from this excellent package of bread, circuses and attentive/friendly staff. The rooms are small but well-appointed, with more spacious bathrooms than the square footage of the room would portend. The European plan breakfast is a terrific value, and the food plentiful, freshly prepared and cheerfully presented (great coffee, too). The free in-room wifi and business center wifi and comfy leather sofa library setting make an excellent place to meet a client (or a pal) before moving to the noisy and friendly on-premises pub. For workaholic international business folk, here's the REAL value: free global phone service, with no strings. For under CAN$150 (my rate in association with the conference I attended), there is no better comfort-for-value to be found on my trips to Vancouver (or most other business destinations). Bottom line: stay here. If you are in Vancouver on business or staging here for an Arctic cruise, add an extra night or two before and after those events and you won't be disappointed. Gene, Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “outstanding effort to "please" made by the staff”
Reviews.Author: woundedbird
Reviews.Content: The Stanley Cup playoffs were in town and all the hotels were booked, so after shopping around for a place to stay for just one night, the reservations clerk recognized our difficulty finding an appropriate room. Without a big story of circumstances: the desk clerk went way beyond the standard effort to get us the sleeping arrangements we needed. Furthermore, being late, she stayed late at her post until we arrived, when she personally saw that the arrangements were complete, beds turned down, car parked and luggage in the room, before she left for the night. The rooms are very comfortable and well appointed. The breakfast came with the room, and its essentially made to order in a large, white tablecloth dining room, and best of all, Breakfast was served until 10AM! The parking garage is very, very secure, well lit, clean and safe. With its downtown location with other 4 and 5 star hotels, we could not have found a better situation. I assure you'll like this quaint, uptown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoPhil
Reviews.Content: We were in Room 506 (top floor, facing Dunsmuir Street). Quietness : We never heard anything from the elevator despite being right next to it. Noise from the street was a different story: although quiet enough Mon-Thu, on Friday and Saturday night it got louder. If you are a light sleeper, and will be there on a wkend, I would recommend using earplugs in addition to a white-noise machine (we used a white noise application on our Android phone that we plugged into their clock-radio) The bathroom was very nice (shower only; large with excellent styling), as was the room itself (which had a large dresser). The bed was comfortable and firm. Clock radio had audio plug for smartphones/ipods. WiFi: they called a technician in to resolve issues plaguing guests. Once resolved, it was a little inconvenient in that it forced us to relog onto the system with both a username and password every time we re-entered the hotel. ***Mgmt: please have hotel's router cache our hardware address for 3 day periods so that we don't have to relog on every single day, often multiple times a day*** Breakfast: Filling and tasted fine, but of limited choice: every day they gave us the same three choices of a) eggs over easy b) an omelete or c) waffles (they all came with coffee/tea, a large glass of juice, toast/bagel, and hashbrowns/fruit). For a weekend trip it would have been perfect, but for a week long trip I prefer buffets with a greater selection. TV: Picture surprisingly unclear for such a modern hotel. Signal obviously degraded, at least in our room. Gym: Although none in the hotel, we walked next door to the very excellent Steve Nash gym and got a 24 hour hotel rate of a mere $8; the gym doesn't advertise this rate (their $25 advertised daily pass is for locals, not for people visiting from out of town)..... this was better than the $15 a day rate at which the St Regis itself would sell you the passes. For $250 a night, I would have liked a little better experience. But, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay in a high quality boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pandpCalifornia
Reviews.Content: we had booked a 2 room suite on the 5th floor. room quite clean and obviously recently updated. nice linens and good TV. Bathroom a bit small but more than adequate. check in was very courteous and quick, hlep locatiing missing luggage from our cruise and the staff went the extra yard. nice included breakfast though, a bit slow due to understaffing. nice bar next door for a drink before going out to dinner. what was a bit strange, is standing outside the hotel around 11 p.m., having a smoke, I was hit up by no fewer than 20 pandhandlers in the shortest time. no reflection on the hotel, just at night, there are a lot of you transient types coming into central Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “St Regis turned something negative into positive”
Reviews.Author: tak3
Reviews.Content: We went to Vancouver for an Alaskan cruise, and picked St Regis based on tripadvisor reviews for our 1 night pre cruise and 3 night post cruise stay. Upon arriving at the hotel shortly after 9 pm, the front desk clerk greeted us by name as soon as we walked in. Since I've never stayed there before, I had a feeling that this may not be all good. Indeed, she informed us , very nicely, that the hotel was overbooked due to having a very large convention in town, and unfortunately we had been the ones affected. She explained , and at the same time gave us a letter written by Front Office Operations Manager Casey Kitamura, that St Regis would arrange for us to stay at Metropolitan hotel 2 blocks away, pay for room and taxes, internet, all telephone calls and breakfast for two. In the letter, Casey emphasized that this over booking was not typical for St. Regis Hotel and hoped to welcome us again in the near future. I have frequently heard of guests being bumped to another hotel in such situations, but to have EVERYTHING ( telephone calls, breakfast) all paid for was news to me. Brittany , front desk clerk, immediately called a taxi, and out of nowhere came Ryan who loaded our luggage into the taxi while Brittany paid the taxi driver. Metropolitan was rated #8 on tripadvisor, so it was not a shabby substitute. Check in process was smooth. Another amazing part was a phone call from Brittany within 5 minutes of our arrival in our room to make sure we're happy with it. I was very impressed with this level of service and called Casey the next morning to praise his staff. I informed Casey that I would be back from my Alaskan cruise in a week and would be their guest again, and requested early check in. He immediately said he guaranteed it. Sure enough, shortly after 9 am a week later, we walked the 10 minutes from cruise terminal and arrived at St Regis, and was promptly checked into our room. We knew the elevator was small from reading reviews here at tripadvisor. It was actually bigger than the one in our hotels in Rome and Sienna. It had room for 6 passengers. During our stay, we took stairs half the time despite being on 5th floor. This small elevator and nice staircase reminded us of boutique hotels in Europe. Entrance to stairs is 10 ft from elevator, 15 ft from front desk, and required room key card to enter, so it's very secure ( as did elevator) Room was very nicely done. I paid particular attention to the quality of finishing , as some recently built establishments had poor workmanship. My room although did not have expensive furniture and wood work, the finishing was of very high quality. Even minor details like alarm clock was thought of and a couple levels above other hotels of similar classification. One feature we did not make use of was the free world wide telephone calls ( except Nigeria, I was told) but it certainly would be handy for many travelers who come from far away. When we're at breakfast the next few days, we were satisfied with the selection ( see my photo) but what was surprising was the level of service. In many places where breakfast was included, we found that the wait staff were rushed, but here they ( 3 different staff over the few days) smiled, took the time to take the order, and seem happy with their job. Back to the front desk. I asked Ryan how I could hook up my iPad 2 to the control centre to view my pictures.Minutes later, he searched the web and printed out a page on an Apple gadget that is required to make that connection, and explained that the hotel was built before there was iPad so the control centre did not have allowance for it. He further advised how I could go to Apple store two blocks away. Wow! That is service. St Regis, through the management style of General manager ( sorry I do not remember his name but it was mentioned here on tripadvisor) and Front Office Operations Manager Casey Kitamura, has indeed set the standard for service. They are proud of being ranked number 1 in service in Vancouver, and has posted this accomplishment in their elevator. Well deserved!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Content: we had two nights here, room was great very clean and moden, breakfast was is very good, its walkable to everything you need in Vancouver, I would recomend this hotel to anyone visiting the area

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Chachajian
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, the hotel is not big but very comfortable, staff are friendly and helpful, they are young and happy, so when you meet them, they always make your day. Breakfast is simple but yummy, and there is a star bucks just beside the gate.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Debelyn
Reviews.Content: Carefull how you book, the hotel didn't honor our reservation from an online booking agent. Quite the surprise, total disappointment. It might be for the better, it looked like a dive.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Stranger44
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the last night of our 3 week trip to Canada and absolutely loved it. It was great value for money especially considering the prices of similar hotels in the area. The staff could not have been more helpful and polite and I can see why the hotel won a tripadvisor service award. Pros: Service, location, free breakfast, free long distance phonecalls, free computer access + free wifi, great shower, complementry bottles of water in the room, comfortable bed and radio with ipod dock which actually charged my iphone (in other hotels the ipod docks didn't) Cons: Room size - not the biggest of rooms but quite big enough for my partner and I

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: boltarella
Reviews.Content: Three couples chose this hotel to stay at prior to our Alaskan cruise. It was a great choice. Newly remodeled, clean, good location, service was very good & price was very good, considering the wonderful full course breakfast that was included. We all agreed it was a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, location and quality”
Reviews.Author: vagabondtoronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed eight days for two back to back conferences so this became my home away from home. The staff always remembered my name, "please call me by my first name", the breakfasts were enormous (best to ask for the granola and fruit unless you want to gain some kilos), and the telephone long distance to any where in the world were free ... hello friends from Brazil and Turkey! The rooms have been refurbished in a 1915's building -- great style and comfort in this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia0310
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. The staff could not have been better, the rooms were updated and large and the free breakfast was perfect. The location was convenient to everything and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property”
Reviews.Author: directine
Reviews.Content: Our most recent stay at the St.Regis was lovely--gorgeous rooms, comfortable beds, delicious breakfast. We love the location of the hotel, as it’s next door to major shopping and eating destinations. There is a liquor store underneath the hotel near the train station, and a great sports bar attached to the hotel. You can’t really go wrong here…UNLESS service is your dealbreaker. FOH staff here are not known for being engaging, or quite at the service level you'd see at a Four Seasons or Marriott. They certainly aren’t mean, aside from one waitress in the breakfast area who we have now twice witnessed being rude to her perfectly competent kitchen staff. But a handful of staff who we have chatted with at the front desk do lack a certain grace, mindfulness and perhaps genuine interest in their hospitality positions. But that's alright--again, this hotel is in a prime location, and the most important parts (location, room) were perfect. I must make mention of the hotel's General Manager, Jeremy, who should be the model for hospitality industry service, and if only his entire staff could be as caring, practiced and polished as he is, then we’d have a true 5 star boutique hotel here, with zero hesitations. We will stay again, and we will suggest the St.Regis to colleagues, friends and family who are looking for a nice room in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else- better value and better service”
Reviews.Author: mandcwolf
Reviews.Content: I am a fequent traveller, often hitting hotels at least once a week. Given the recent experience at this hotel I thought I would share my experience.\ the pros Rooms are clean and the location is good and central. They offer a good breakfast for free and the interiors are decorated quite nice. the cons rooms are very small. No tub and hard bed. TV was of terrible quality with very poor picture. Lots of noise could be heard from street traffic in the room. Breakfast is comprised of three selections. That's all and they don't change. Internet did not work for the two days I was there. Elevator only holds 4 people and there is only one in the entire hotel. Lobby is small and shabby. When my agent booked the room they got a rate from the website. Almost right after the booking, the hotel called the agent back and said he was not entitled to the rate. My agent was upset and said so much so the hotel honoured the rate. He later told me he has never heard of a hotel denying a rate posted on their web site. Keep in mind this is not a cheap hotel. When I asked to extend my stay at the front desk, I was told a room was available and it was not a problem. I then told my agent to re-book my flight to the next day. About 30 minutes later the desk called my room and said this was a mistake. There is no rooms available. This forced me to change my flight again as all the hotels were booked and this ended up costing me in excess of $400. When I told the desk this they said they needed proof of the costs. So not only did they make a mistake on the room being there, they then questioned if I was telling the truth. When I complained to the desk about the issues around internet, the mistake on booking and the rate issue, they said they are aware of the issues. No apologies, no nothing. Did not seem to care. For the money you would pay here try some of the other hotels in the city, the Fairmonts, the Delta, the Marriott etc. Far nicer hotels and better value. Free long distance calling does not make a hotel great.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a one night pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: JoeHeg758
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for 1 night before leaving on an Alaska cruise from Canada Place. The hotel was located less than 2 blocks from the airport train. Upon getting to the door, our bags were taken to our room and we completed check in process and told of all the amenities available (free wi-fi, free phone calls, free breakfast (cooked to order), free bottled water in the room. After unpacking and freshening up, we asked the front desk for suggestions for dinner (based on our travel clothes we felt our options would be limited). She offered 2 suggestions and gave us menus to look over up in our room. We had a hard time deciding but went to a Japanese sushi place which was the 2nd best sushi we've ever had. The bed in the room was comfortable and the iPod dock/alarm clock was used to also charge our phone while listening to music. The walk to the cruise dock was a couple of blocks, but mostly downhill and not difficult. The only possible problem was the neighborhood was in the midst of renewal, so it's still close to the sketchier part of town. I never felt unsafe but some might be a bit uncomfortable with the vagrants on the sidewalks just 1-2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stays in two years”
Reviews.Author: SzeNg
Reviews.Content: Last year in May, we stayed at St Regis on two ocassions in May and we were very happy during our stays. We returned for another two stays in the last week of May this year and were are equally delighted during our stays. The Reception staff is very cheerful and welcoming. They gave us help in booking restaurants and advising transport. The rooms are quiet and restful. We are grateful for the loan of umbrellas during the rainy season! The staff in the breakfast lounge is helpful and the breakfast is well cooked nad presented. We had a great time and will return.

Reviews.Title: “"Just as advertised"”
Reviews.Author: edconw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for two nights after taking a cruise to Vancouver. This hotel met everything we had read about in other reviews, and we were very satisfied. The hotel staff was very professional and attended to all your needs. Our room was superb! Looked exactly as shown on the website, very updated. Complimentary breakfast was cooked to order. They offered three different choices of breakfasts, and the servings were plentiful, and served in a nice lower level dining area. Good location, within walking distance to the pier. We took the hop on hop off bus to sightsee, and we were able to purchase the tickets at the hotel front desk as well. Free international long distance calling, free newspaper, water in room...what else do you need? We would definetly stay here again when visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellysanleon
Reviews.Content: Don't you love it when people bend over backward to make sure your stay is great. And it was. Lovely Boutique hotel. very comfortable and lovely .. Great location.....would stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Great for free long distance phone call”
Reviews.Author: StrongForest
Reviews.Content: The free long distance phone call is perfect, so I can contact my from all over the world every time, I love this feature.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Overnight Stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: pricewyke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the St. Regis before joining a cruise to Alaska. We flew into Vancouver from Calgary and found the trip downtown on the SkyTrain very convenient. From the station it was a short walk to the hotel. The next day it was a quick cab ride to board the cruise. The hotel was very attractive and comfortable and the staff were very friendly, helpful and efficient. We will stay at the St. Regis when we visit Vancouver and recommend it to our friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “An accessible oasis of comfort with an eager to please staff.”
Reviews.Author: petemann
Reviews.Content: In Vancouver for a conference, my husband and I stayed in the Junior Suite at St. Regis. We appreciated the extra space and had enough room to spread out. The rooms were very clean and well appointed with tasteful, well constructed furniture and electronics. Choices for the abundant breakfast, included in the cost, were speedily served by friendly wait staff. The front desk personnel proved to be knowledgeable and accomodating, recommending two excellent restaurants that were just what we wanted. The hotel is two blocks from Sky Train, and we easily walked to Gas Town and the downtown sites. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: megmay8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and it was a lovely hotel. The staff was incredibly welcoming, the room was in great condition, and the morning breakfast was spectacular. It is in a great location with nearby public transportation which was very convenient. We will absolutely stay here again the next time we visit Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: medsklm1
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience. Great location with lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Quaint and dainty building with rooms that have been completely modernized. Bathroom was awesome. Breakfast exceeded expectations. Breakfast servers (who may also play other roles in the hotel) and front desk employees were great - very helpful suggestions and friendly smiles. Will DEFINITELY stay here every time I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!"”
Reviews.Author: Rhena1169
Reviews.Content: Our group of 14 stayed at the St. Regis while we participated in a week long convention in Vancouver. The hotel staff were friendly and very accommodating. The facilities were clean, modern and affordable. Our day began with a delightful breakfast served by cheerful staff who happily remembered our breakfast choices from day to day.The location allowed for a very comfortable walk each day to the convention centre. As a business client I can affirm this is how I like to be treated and I wasn't disappointed. Our entire group will be returning in the fall of 2011 and you can bet we will be staying at the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Service is top-tier, rooms are stylish but dark”
Reviews.Author: GoneTrippn
Reviews.Content: I understand why people like this hotel: It's clean, the service is excellent, the location is pretty good. My only complaint is that it might be a little too central for some people. Might be loud if you're on a low floor on the street side. I was in the back, which was quiet, but not much to look at. The rooms and finishes were of high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardtaylor10
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel in an excellent location. Top marks for free American cooked breakfast, free internet, free long distance phone calls, friendly and effiecient staff, 2 minutes walk to Granville train station, and 10 minutes walk from downtown Vancouver. Located in a heritage listed building with lots of artwork and wood panelling. Rooms and single lift a bit on the small side but otherwise a brilliant choice for anyone visiting Vancouver. We will highly recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pampering at a Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsuffidy
Reviews.Content: I had a memorable experience with the Holt Renfrew shopping package. A gift and $100 gift card from HR was waiting in my hotel room - and my appointments for makeover and personal shopping were ready. The staff at HR provided excellent service. Champagne during shopping was a nice touch. The hotel was impeccably clean and service was friendly and professional. I also liked the free long distance calling - something that sets this hotel apart. The complimentary breakfast was a cut above the usual, with the expertly cooked omelet being a standout. Be aware that parking is $34 for the night - at Pacific Centre the overnight fee is $24. However, the hotel garage is secured. In a previous trip to Vancouver I had my rental car broken into at the Pacific Centre parking lot. I felt the additional $10 was worth the peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a boutique hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: YuriArtibise
Reviews.Content: My wife and I we the lucky recipients of a Holt Renfrew ‘Shop and Stay’ package, which including a night’s stay in one of their executive suites. I’ll let my wife review that ‘shop’ portion of the package and stick to the ‘stay’ part. The St. Regis is everything a boutique hotel should be. The hotel is a perfect mix of a historic building and modern amenities. It has been beautifully appointed with close attention to nearly every detail. We loved the comfy king size bed enjoyed the soaker tub. The staff were friendly and attentive. Located in the heart of downtown, the location of the hotel is great for tourists and business travelers alike. The free use of the business center, including printers was a nice addition. We loved the complimentary long distance calls and were impressed by the complimentary full breakfast (including table service and omelets!). The only room for improvement would be to improve the (admittedly free) wifi quality and perhaps consider a doorman to greet guests and help unload and direct cars, and/or even a valet parking service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: BigFred64
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay very much. Service was extraordinary at all levels; maids, waitresses, front desk. Room was quiet and very comfortable. A couple of amenities were missing: complimentary mouth wash (with liquid ban on air travel this would be appreciated); no nightlight because one switch turns everything off; no face soap, just bath soap. Showers are very light straight down "rain" type which some of use don't like. Vending and Ice machines only on floors 2 and 4. Only one small elevator which seemed to miss stopping on the 3rd flood a lot. Otherwise really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: Trotwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights during a major convention. Everything about the St. Regis was beyond my expectations. The room and bathroom furnishings and fixtures were all high quality, maintained in like-new condition and spotless. Even the stairwell, bright and containing original art, was spotless. Full breakfast, included in the rate, was in an attractive room on a lower level. The breakfast offerings were traditional and complete (including cooked-to-order omelets), the food prepared and presented well, and the service very prompt and very friendly. Friendly, in fact, describes all of their very efficient staff. And an unusual feature -- free worldwide telephone calls -- was of significant value to a colleague that was traveling from Bermuda. Location was good: in the center of the downtown area and one block up, one block over from the City Center Skytrain station that provides quick, comfortable and inexpensive transit from and to the airport. The lobby is small but there is a small seating area in a room adjacent to the lobby that was good for quiet conversation with up to four people. They also have a pub-type bar and restaurant attached to the hotel (very popular on the night of a hockey playoff game), while two high quality restaurants -- Gotham Steakhouse and The Shore Club -- are on the same block. An appreciated detail: my room had an openable window that allowed enjoyment of the fresh Vancouver air. Overall, a great hotel experience in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: balhannah
Reviews.Content: This hotel ranks very highly on TripAdvisor, and rightly so. We stayed for a few days then went to Tofino for Easter, then returned for another couple of days. Our rooms for these two stays were identical although on different floors, on a corner, quite spacious, with a lovely bathroom. The people at the front desk are without a doubt the best I have ever encountered. I would like to specially mention Brittany, who was on duty when we arrived and who helped us orientate ourselves and also to come to grips with the whole tipping thing (a source of anxiety for Australian travellers!). The St Regis is really the whole smooth deal. The little touches make so much difference, like free bottled water and little bedtime choccies, but really it's the big things that count, and the St Regis has at least two really big things going for it: all telephone calls are free, global or local, courtesy of an internet phone system; and breakfast is included in the very reasonable price, and is substantial, varied and delicious. The wait staff at breakfast were wonderful - friendly, efficient, really helpful. The hotel also has a sports bar for those who like ice-hockey, and we spent a few fun hours there meeting locals and learning about the game, coinciding with Vancouver's success in the play-offs. The meals at this bar are also very good, great steak and a good wine list. Sure it's noisy, but it's fun for those who enjoy this sort of atmosphere. The first room had both a fridge and a microwave, so we were able to buy supplies and occasionally save a bit by eating in. Inexplicably, the second room, two floors up, had neither fridge nor microwave ... but this is a mere quibble. The hotel is quite conveniently located close to a train station, two blocks from most buses, and a moderate walk from Robson Street, the waterfront, Gastown, the Art Gallery, and other downtown attractions. Overall, our stay at the St Regis was a wonderful introduction to Canada, Canadians and Vancouver. I really didn't want to leave ... and I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure To Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: whofan1
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews, I had begun to wonder if they were true or not. They were! This is a terrific hotel, located incredibly convenient to just about everything, including the Skytrain from the airport. The staff was unconditionally pleasant, the included breakfasts were wonderful and the list of included amenities stunned my colleagues who were paying more to stay at a nearby "name brand" hotel and received NONE of what I received. Do not hesitate to stay at the St. Regis!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing quality and service in the heart of downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: lilac73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a find! For a very reasonable price (as booked directly through the website, I got a AAA discounted rate), you get a choice of 3 made-to-order breakfasts in the morning - including fresh juice and your choice of coffee/tea/hot chocolate. You also get free use of a very comfortable business center (including printouts), free wi-fi in the room and throughout the hotel, and free bottled water. Inside the room, there is an iPod docking station/player, plus a cool instrument panel where you can supposedly hook up your camera/phone/computer etc and watch images or movies on the provided flat-screen TV (we didn't make use of this feature). The bed was super-comfortable, and the robes provided in the closet are a fine touch. The toiletries in the bathroom are also high quality, and I was glad for the shaving mirror! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is smack-dab in the heart of downtown, right next to the bus stop and a light rail station and the Pacific Place mall (which has an underground garage for paid parking). We got a 1/2 hour massage each from the in-house masseuse, and he was AMAZING! My sore shoulder and back muscles felt super-great after the service, and the price was also extremely reasonable compared to other 5-star hotels or spas. The only negative I can think of is that the shower pressure was extremely weak (which can be a put-off for people like me who like a thundering waterfall of hat steam after a long day or travling), and the bathtub (inside which the shower is located; there is no separate stall) is very deep, so I almost twisted my knee trying to come out of it with my wet feet. If they could fix these two issues, this hotel would be prefect!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: stegrif
Reviews.Content: We found the St Regis hotel lived up to all the excellent reviews that have already been written. The staff were very welcoming and knowledgeable. The hotel was in the perfect location just a few blocks from the waterfront and one block from the station for the airport. We had a Smart Queen room which was plenty big enough, and probably bigger then most city centre hotel rooms we have stayed in, the bathroom was large and everywhere was exceptionally clean. The temperature of the room was also easily controlable via the air con controls. A great breakfast was included which was a bonus as was free wifi and a business suite with PCs and printer, free international calls were also included. All in all a great stay in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “FAIR Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: LouisLouis1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the St Regis Hotel for one night in April, 2011. Here are our pros and cons: PROS: Clean and modern (but relatively small) room. Free international calls, wi-fi and flat screen,. We had a "Smart Queen" room. Good downtown location., Afternoon check in staff, very friendly. We received a very welcoming greeting from the young lady at the desk. She was very pleasant and explained all about the hotel and parking situation (except for the fee and unlike the morning "manager"-see parking below). Cons: Breakfast is ordered from a menu and there were only 2 hard working waitresses trying to serve all the guests AND clean dirty tables. I would estimate the breakfast room has at least 20 tables for 2 and each was packed at around 9am. They seemed understaffed. So the wait for drinks and food was very lengthy. We saw people standing besides dirty tables waiting for them to be cleaned so they could get a seat. If the hotel is going to serve breakfast "waitress style", they must improve service and perhaps have a better system for seating people. Besides the wait, I dont enjoy eating with people standing around me waiting to sit down. Coffee cup was dirty and had to be replaced. Tea pot was cracked, leaked on table and had to be replaced. Hidden fees - Parking was never referenced on my reservation confirmation. I was charged $25 at checkout. When I questioned the morning manager he said it was mentioned somewhere on the web site. I said it should be referenced on the reservation. He said it was not on my reservation due to space considerations. Are you kidding? I showed him the print out of my reservation which was 2 pages with plenty of empty space. After arguing back and forth about unexpected parking charge he started telling me about all his years of experience in the hotel business and that parking charges are not on resevations. The fact is whether he is right or wrong I really dont appreciate checking out with a manager ( I think he was) who is defensive and argumentative. One small elevator to serve 6 floors. If you are in a rush the wait for the elevator can be frustrating. I saw people on the lower floors take the stairs. that's ok provided you are not physically unable or dont have much luggage. Hotel only has 6 floors. We had a 3rd floor room in front of hotel. We had a poor nights sleep due to cars, motorcycles, people yelling at all hours of the night (which I dont understand), and the garbage trucks in the morning. They share a parking lot with the building next door. We found it logistically inconvenient. If you are driving to the hotel, there is no room to park in front while checking in. We parked on the side of the hotel in a narrow drive way. My wife had to move the car several times to allow access for other cars until I checked in and was given the gate card for underground parking lot. We found this stressful and inconvenient. Overall, our experience with this hotel was fair. After weighing the pros and cons I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location to be able to walk around the centre of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: KirstM
Reviews.Content: A very modern friendly hotel which accommdated a family of 4 in the room with a bed settee in the living area. This comfortable for one night. You don't have to just stick to the menu for breakfast.....if you don't ask you don't get. Plenty of car parking around the area..we parked up the road in Sears which was really reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean moderist interiors in restored historic exterior”
Reviews.Author: 21sounderfan
Reviews.Content: We chose the St. Regis because it was super close to Simon Fraser's Vancouver campus and Woodward building. The bedroom was nicely detailed with a comfortable bed, fluffy duvet a large tiled bathroom and had big desk with wifi. There is an all night restaurant and store across the street but our 3rd floor room was quiet. Breakfast is served in the basement but the room is nice and the service really friendly and fast. We were on our way quickly. I plan to bring the whole family back. It was a bargain and could not be better appointed or located for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, centrally located, courteous and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_M54
Reviews.Content: We finished off a 2 week ski holiday with 4 nights in this hotel. I booked it via the net purely on the reviews of previous patrons and I wasn't disappointed. We were in comfortable walking distance from everywhere in the city. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or attentive. I needed to know which restaurants catered for a gluten free diet and they showed me menus from most of the city restaurants! I was stunned. The only negatives were - the room was a bit small but hey we were only there to sleep. The breakfast menu did get a little monotonous after a couple of days and the traffic noise was annoying. I would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully refurbished old hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: bshell
Reviews.Content: We live in Vancouver, but booked into the St. Regis for a one night romantic getaway on our anniversary. We booked it because of the glowing TripAdvisor reviews, which have given the St. Regis a high ranking. I have to say, the manager is a genius to do this, because it works. Everything in the reviews is true, from the gorgeous remodelling of rooms, to the (slight) noise from the street below. In fact, I booked the hotel partly because it's right across the street from Vancouver's best pub by far, the Railway Club. Excellent craft beers from all over the region. You must check it out if you stay at the St. Regis. Also, all of Vancouver's greatest bands have played the Railway at one time or another. Excellent beer, pub food, and live music. Right across the street. We had only one problem. When we got to our room it had no bathtub. Make sure when you book (if you require a tub) that you specify you need a room with a tub. We were upgraded to a small suite, which was absolutely exquisite. I can't say enough how gorgeous the suite was. However, they charged us an extra $50, which was unexpected. But here's the best part.
