When we received the follow-up email after our visit asking us to give a glowing TripAdvisor review, I mentioned this extra room charge, and the brilliant genius manager behind this hotel refunded our $50!! The only other warning I'd give about this hotel is the $25 parking charge, which if you include the ridiculous state parking tax actually comes to $32/night!! In fact, you can find overnight parking in the area for $9 flat fee. Just ask the helpful valet at the nearby Gotham steak house for advice on where to park. The bed was great. Sheets were fine. I don't know what that other reviewer was on about, or else they bought new sheets. No wine glasses in room. That would have been nice. Breakfast was pretty good as others have said, but you can get a better breakfast in downtown Vancouver at countless restaurants. My current favourite is Joe's Cafe in the West End. I'll just make one more comment and this is a general point for all Vancouver hotels. The shower in this hotel was like most others: flow restricted, weak and insipid. If I was running a hotel in Vancouver, I'd take out those damn flow restrictors. I know of only one hotel that has great showers: the Four Seasons. Look, when patrons are paying (with tax) nearly $200 to stay a single night in a hotel, how about giving us a decent shower, eh? So how much more does it cost for the extra water and heating? 25 cents? Come on. And this is Vancouver, where it rains all the time, and water is plentiful. Get rid of the flow restrictors. Please!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: ExpatAus
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for a few days. We had high expectations, having read the reviews. Those expectations were met. The room was clean, well decorated and very quiet. The hotel itself is in a good position and we were able to walk to Yaletown and Gastown. There's lots of good public transport nearby as well. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The wireless internet was a good speed. The breakfast was fine, nothing special, but as it was included in the price we had no complaints! Overall, this is a good value hotel and we would definitely return to it and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, comfort and value”
Reviews.Author: lgunarat
Reviews.Content: My stay at the St.Regis was fantastic in every way. It began with top class customer service from the moment I arrived until I was in the taxi to the airport. The room was very clean and equipped with all the usual amenities. The hotel was established in a historic building in downtown Vancouver. The rooms are quite modern and renovated appropriately to contrast the the outside. The room ate was extremely competitive and is a superb value as it includes a full breakfast and free long distance. The hotel is situated within walking distance to the convention centre, restaurant and public transport. The most impressive feature of this hotel is the customer service. The staff went out of their way to help to give directions, calling taxis, suggest restaurants or even just chat about the city. The staff were also very knowledgeable about these things. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Vancouver. You won't regret it. The only down side was the slightly smaller rooms which may be typical for hotels build in small historic buildings. It reminded me of similar places in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: sarah0812_11
Reviews.Content: This place is great, the staff go above and beyond to help and accomodate you, especially Ben at the front desk, he would have to be the most helpful concierge out of all the hotels we have stayed at. The rooms are very modern, clean and the beds are so cumphy with a very reasonable nightly rate thats includes breakfast daily, wifi and free worldwide phonecalls, St Regis Vanvouver is highly reccomended, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, modern, convenient, great value”
Reviews.Author: NawlinsNewYork
Reviews.Content: I liked: free hot breakfast friendly staff was always at the desk ready to help modern decor comfortable bed downtown location free wifi business center affordable price sleek bathroom great design (there is actually a place to put your things) room had sunlight and city views I didn't like Wish it had a gym our room was on the small side, but I think it was one of the smallest they had *The hotel itself was very quiet but be aware that you are downtown and expect some street noise on Fri / Sat nights. I would definitely consider staying here again. Terrific hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable location, quality and value!”
Reviews.Author: mcv11
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is our favourite hotel in Vancouver. Our room was beautiful, new, fresh and sparkling and the hotel is located in the heart of downtown near everything you'd want to see. We couldn't believe all the amenities our reasonable rate provided besides the great rooms: free wifi, unlimited long distance anywhere in the world, full breakfast. The rooms are beautifully renovated, so tasteful and with guest comfort in mind. My husband had a massage at the hotel and he says it was the best he's every had. I'm pretty picky about hotels but I found myself saying over and over, "I can't believe this hotel is so fabulous for such a reasonable rate!" This really is a jewel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Fyodor76
Reviews.Content: From the instant we arrived at this hotel, to the moment we left, our stay was a complete joy. The hotel has fantastic amenities: free long distance phone calls, free internet, free printing at the business center, breakfast included. It also has tasteful, comfortable, contemporary looking rooms. The bathrooms were a delight to behold. Staff were amongst the friendliest people i have ever dealt with. The breakfast was delicious, well-prepared and served by pleasant and helpful servers. I will stay here again and will recommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: SR32
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are travel extensively and have stayed at a wide variety of 3-5 star hotels. We have NEVER come across rude staff - on pretty much every level from manager through to wait staff at breakfast - as we did at this hotel. The rooms themselves are comfy and modern, although fairly cramped. The hotel is situated on a busy main road and has single glazed windows so you hear every possible sound on the street. The location isn't bad but I really couldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. To top it all off they pretty much begged us (to our nods) to leave them a nice review on tripadvisor. It really can be the only reason this hotel is so highly regarded on tripadvisor. It really was a very forgettable experience and we couldn't wait to get out of there.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant oasis in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SienaCincinnati
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Hotel in downtown Vancouver provides a wide variety of options for those who stay there. Rooms range from standard rooms to executive suites. We booked an executive room but found, to our pleasure, that we had been upgraded to a junior suite. It was great to have the extra space, seating and tv. The rooms have been upgraded beautifully, and all of the amenities are wonderful--from the bottled water, pod-type coffee maker, daily chocolates to the great soaps, shampoos and lotions. The beds are comfortable, and the bathroom is very clean and modern. Additionally, there is free worldwide calling from the rooms! A full sit-down breakfast is included in the price. It is so hearty that we only ate one other meal per day. The staff is extremely helpful with questions you may have, and they offer great directions and suggestions. Since the hotel is in the heart of Vancouver, there are many places within walking distance, and public transportation options are very near. We only rented a car for two of our seven days there.

Reviews.Title: “St Regis is Tops!”
Reviews.Author: Anna23Rotorua
Reviews.Content: We stayed at St Regis on two separate occasions in February and March this year, for a total of 7 nights (in a Smart Double room), with our two children aged 8 & 10 years. Our stay in Vancouver was more enjoyable because we stayed at St Regis Hotel. All the staff, with special reference to Benjamin on the front desk, could not have been more friendly and helpful. The hotel was probably the best location you could get in Vancouver City (right next to Sky Train access and Pacific Mall). The free breakfast was amazing (the trip advisor review we had read described it as the "best free breakfast in Vancouver" was accurate). The interior designer responsible for the 2009 renovation deserves a medal for good taste and it was easy to see that no expense had been spared in fitting out the hotel. Yes the rooms are on the small side but they are incredibly well designed, and because of the hotels superb location we could return to our rooms time and again to refresh or drop off the shopping. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to stay here again next time we are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, rooms lacking.”
Reviews.Author: SkyeBlues Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a 2 night stopover late March 2011. Easy and cheap access from airport on Skytrain, a 5 minute walk from Vancouver City station. Hotel is well located for shops and harbour front, and a 30 minute brisk walk to Stanley Park. A day pass on the excellent public transport is great value for money for exploring Vancouver and North Vancouver on the Seabus. Service was impeccable and cooked breakfast was superb, although Continental option was lacking inspiration. The bar/restaurant attached was fine for a 'pub' meal, anything more elaborate is not so easy to find Downtown. The room was disappointing. Although well furnished with a very comfortable bed it was a little on the small size. The adjacent room was a suite and it seemed that the floor space had been compromised to accomodate it. Incredibly for a hotel of this standard it had no room minibar or fridge. Even the staff were surprised when we had to ask them to use their staff fridge overnight. There is free wifi and internet lounge, and free international telephone calls from the room. We tried to make a call on four occasions and either the line didn't connect or the person being called could not hear us, so the value of this feature was lost on us. Overall the hotel is a very good choice for a stopover or longer stay, good value for money and friendly , helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis is a keeper”
Reviews.Author: MuftiMixandmatch
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days recently for a local getaway at the St. Regis, a charming, elegant 100 year old heritage hotel. The rooms are not spacious but have a desk and a chair. The room configurations on their website show which rooms do not have armchairs. This might be a consideration after a full day of walking. The edge of the bathtub is knee height and very wide (25 cm?) A farmer would build a stile. Next time a room with shower only. The air con/heat was state of the art. Everything about the hotel was immaculately clean. The staff, particularly Brittany, was knowledgeable and able to help expertly. The breakfast room staff was amiable and capable. Global worldwide phone calls, internet, sit down breakfast are included. The elevator needs your key card to work which seemed like excellent security. The hotel is in a prime location. 5 metres from the entrance to Granville Skytrain Station, 3 blocks from Waterfront Station. A block away from a number of bus routes. It was a most pleasant experience and we would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hosts...”
Reviews.Author: Bilist
Reviews.Content: I live in Northern BC, I have children & Family in the area. The staff, graciously, welcomed my family as they visited. They were very helpful with directions for ALL our needs. Location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Boutique Hotel in Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ashleyogloff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with a friend, two double beds on the fifth floor for under $200 including a full sit-down breakfast the next morning. Room was very small but very clean and modern with a large bathroom with double sinks and a great glass and tile shower. Our view was off the back of the building and not the most flattering- but overall the service was discreet and polite, the hotel was clean, modern, and in a great location close to shopping, restaurants, and Rogers Arena- and for the price it was amazing considering it included that full breakfast with fresh orange juice and coffee as well. Again- the location made this stay even better as we didn't need to take a taxi anywhere at all during our stay- walking distance within 10-15 mins to all the spots you need! Nice looking building, classy. A really nice stay! The also have free international phone calls if you are travelling abroad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Jennycowie14
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Vancouver and would stay at this hotel again. When we arrived we were upgraded to a Junior suite and we were meet with very attentive staff. Our room presented extremely well with beautiful amenties and very comfortable beds and fluffly towels, very important when travelling. The breakfast was table service with a large choice to satisfy everyone. The staff in the bar especially Chelsea and on the front desk Brittany cant thank enough for their kindness and help in directing us to many attractions. I look forward to another stay next year when back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “" W " meets " Hampton Inn"”
Reviews.Author: Riamiller
Reviews.Content: It's a botique hotel with a modern flair and with more amaneties than any other hotel I have ever been in. Free Internet, free LONG DISTANCE, free water ( and Fiji at that!), chocolates upon on turndown, and if you are lucky enough, you get the HOT breakfast with your hotel stay! Like I said, it's as cool as the "W", but without the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MDD_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis on Friday, March 25, 2011. The hotel was excellent in every way (service, cleanliness, amenities, etc). Great location! Close to everything we wanted to see and do. Would definitely stay here again the next time we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “going the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: Frollana
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here every 2 weeks since the end of January for 1 or 2 nights each time. The service level is unsurpassed anywhere, including what you would receive at an all inclusive resort. Staff remember you and always treat you like you are the best customer they ever had. Rooms are clean, and great decor. This hotel has become my new favorite in the Vancouver area.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: 4trevorcass
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis was great and right downtown. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. After I left and forgot something there they were quick and returned it to my home right away. The hotel looked nice with artwork everywhere. The room had a super deep bathtub, was stylish and quite deluxe. It was a great stay and I would certainly go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “HEAVENLY”
Reviews.Author: Cass06
Reviews.Content: I need very dark and quiet to sleep. It was perfect and the mattress was heavenly. The room was more than expected - the location was great - downtown - and I would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Richard3150
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The staff are all so friendly and helpful, it was just a pleasure for us as new to the city to be assisted as we were. The hotel room was well appointed and great value when we were there in March. Our room was very quiet at night and very comfortable. The hotel is well located if you want to stay in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite Vancouver hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Designer_11
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews, no matter how pleased I am, but my compliments simply have to go out to the St. Regis. What a great hotel! The location is second to none. Being a light sleeper I was a little worried about noise with the hotel bordering on the Gastown District of Vancouver but ear plugs were more than sufficient for the couple of nights that the streets were busy down below (Saturday and Sunday, but my stay coincided with St. Patrick's Day, so to be expected). The room was small but tastefully decorated, impeccably clean and equipped with everything I could want save a vase for flowers but the front desk produced that too! Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. My only concern is that the St. Regis will become so popular that I won't be able to get in the next time I plan to visit Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Yoko_11
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful, awesome stay in this Hotel. All of staff are so kind, so nice! By the grace of them, I was able to have pleasant time in Vancouver. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: sjnseattle
Reviews.Content: We were incredibly happy with this hotel. Very clean and updated, very polite and helpful service, and in a Great, very walkable location. Booking through the hotel itself provided a great rate, and the free Wi-Fi and breakfast are a wonderful benefit. Although the Smart Queen was a bit small, it was fine for the price and all the other amenities of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and service”
Reviews.Author: simchah3
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. The staff are friendly and enthusiastic! They were eager to suggest activities and help us find a rental car. We will definitely stay here again. The room was clean updated. This is an environmentally conscious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!"”
Reviews.Author: pat83rod
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly and helpful. The rooms/bathrooms were very clean and beautifully decorated. The breakfast lounge and waitstaff were perfect. Lots of little extras at this hotel (free printing in the bussiness center, long distance calls) made a big difference! Only downside was the traffic noise on the rooms that face Dunsmuir.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but not obsequious, well-designed, surprisingly good value”
Reviews.Author: xml167
Reviews.Content: Our two nights at the St. Regis were some of the most pleasant I've had in a hotel anywhere. The included breakfasts (3 choices: continental, 2 eggs however you want, or omelettes) were high quality and waiter served, quick and hot, in pleasant surroundings, I've never seen an included breakfast like that for anything even close to these prices. Location was excellent, staff was incredibly pleasant and went out of their way to make things easy for us, the room, while cozy, was spotless and beautifully designed. Parking was convenient ($25/day, unlimited in/out) and the beds comfortable. Sleep was undisturbed. And, there's free long distance phone service anywhere in the world. Wireless internet was free and fast. Bathrooms were plush and the lobby-level business center convenient with decent computers and printer. All this for $149/night, pre HST. I wish I could find such a fine operation in every city I visit, and would certainly return to the St. Regis for another stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a Repeat St. Regis Client”
Reviews.Author: BigCityTour52
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the St.Regis several nights now, but haven't been there since the new upgrades, till this past weekend. The breakfast has been upgraded from the usual continental breakfast and the new renos are great. An espresso bar and subway entrance are literally next door, and a 24 hour donut shop and variety store are across the street. I'm going back whenever I have to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, European boutique hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: NiftyN0mad
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a lovely facility, with newly remodeled rooms done in a modern and stylish décor, with elegant bathrooms. The location, lobby and restaurants are reminiscent of high end European boutique hotels. However, the thing that the St. Regis does best is to provide customer service. The staff is friendly and actively helpful. From giving directions, to suggesting restaurants, to providing any amenity you wish, everyone we encountered could not have been nicer. As an example, when we had some difficulty understanding how to get to the adjacent garage (being entirely unfamiliar with Vancouver), without being asked one of the desk staff accompanied us in our car, directing us to the garage and back to the hotel. We had an extremely satisfying stay and would unequivocally recommend the St. Regis to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded my expectations,”
Reviews.Author: dog33
Reviews.Content: from the time we arrived Juan and Benjerman went out of their way to exceed our expectations, from recommending earting places to getting our vehicle. Room was very clean and was pre heated. breakfast was fantastic. would highly recommend hotel to friends and family..great location! Will always stay at this location when travelling to Vancouver. Thanks for a great stay! Michelle and Doug Green Nanaimo BC

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: hpfanlibrarian
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed twice at the St. Regis, and recommend it highly! It is a little oasis in the middle of the city. It is faultless in cleanliness, decor, and efficiency. And it includes a lovely breakfast. But the real feather in its cap is the friendly service - you actually feel like you are visiting a friendly little inn in the country instead of a hotel in the anonymous city!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Parking expensive and Inconvienent”
Reviews.Author: cascadetrekker
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The room was somewhat small , but very comfortable and wonderfully decorated, with a great compliment of technology features available. The location is one of the best in Vancouver with convenient access to most activities as well as transit. The complimentary breakfast was amazingly complete and delicious. We had stayed there before and will return again. Some might consider the parking rates and convince as cons as well as the only passenger/luggage drop-off being in a very busy traffic lane.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous little hotel in the middle of the city.”
Reviews.Author: Wren84
Reviews.Content: I LOVE staying at the St Regis. From the comfy beds, fabulous bathrooms, great location to the fantastic breakfast, it is a great hotel experience. GREAT make-up mirrors. It is within easy walking distance to Skytrain and the Canada Line to the airport. Parking is a bit puzzling at first, but it is very secure. Staff is ultra friendly and ready to meet every need. I look forward to my visits to Vancouver when I can stay at the St Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay...”
Reviews.Author: volvoc70m
Reviews.Content: It was on the tail end of our trip across Canada and to be honest, what a fitting way to end such a wonderful holiday. We had a nite stay at the St Regis and it is all that was written here. Staff were extremely accomodating and friendly, they went the extra mile to tell us how to get to Granville Island, and showed us exactly where to take the bus from. We were upgraded to a junior suite by the way, and the usual, free water and free internet and free international phone calls, which was brilliant! Breakfast was a good spread of bacon and eggs and juices. Location was superb, right next to the Granville Subway line or about 150 metres to the canada line which will take you to the airport. overall the stay was brilliant, beds were extremely comfy, couldnt hear noise from the streets even though we were facing Tim Hortons. Would definitely come back here again and without a doubt, its affordable, location's great and the perks that comes with it and the staff makes it very worth while. Thank you St Regis for capping our fantastic holiday to Canada. Adrian

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: lomas156
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Vancouver before not sure what to expect but certainly not disappointed, after a long journey we had a pleasant welcome and more than satisfied with our room which was tastfully decorated and very spacious (wonderful showers), breakfast was included, not too much choice but enough to keep you going for the morning. The location of the hotel could not have been better, skytrain from the airport was one block away, bus stops a block away and most attractions within walking distance. My husband and I were more than happy with hotel and location and would happily return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service from all staff!”
Reviews.Author: JCADJC
Reviews.Content: The staff of the St Regis go above and beyond to make sure you have a great stay at the hotel. From the front desk right through to an excellent breakfast in the morning! I will always stay here when I need to be in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Comforting, Special and now my First Choice”
Reviews.Author: tstk4ca
Reviews.Content: I was a little leery at first as I had not been to the St. Regis before, however, from the moment I entered the premises I felt welcomed, safe and special. The staff I met were marvelous from the man who opened the front door to the desk clerks, office worker, cleaning staff and room service deliverer as well as the massage therapist. Everyone had a smile and greeted me in a friendly but not overbearing way. Food from room service was absolutely wonderful -- elegant, reasonably priced and scrumptious. Having free long distance anywhere in the world is a lovely surprize and bonus. Touching base with family even though I was only gone a few days is essential and to call easily was great. The massage therapist, Mishal Rijal, was incredible. He is worth the trip to Vancouver! The free internet service was appreciated. The hotel has an excellent location close to the sky train, shops, the ocean as well as many superb eating establishments. The room I was in was a jr. suite. It was roomy, warm and clean. Having the covers pulled down with a St. Regis chocolate on the pillow and a beautifully hand written personalized note upon arrival made me smile. Starting the day with a 'down home' greeting from staff and major choices for the complimentary breakfast just added more to my stay. The ambiance at the heritage St. Regis Hotel is second to none and I will definately choose this charming place again, soon I hope!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Big modern rooms, Free wifi and long distance calling, freindly staff, awesome location near everything. Worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, and beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mickey0440
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the St. Regis for 2 nights in February. What a gorgeous hotel that mixes the charm of a 100 year old building with all the modern amenities. The staff were extremely pleasant and very helpful with any questions that we had.We ended up having dinner in the bar/ restaurant both nights we were there ...again the staff was so pleasant(it was packed in there both nights!) and the food was very, very good. We were surprised at how reasonably priced the menu was for downtown Vancouver. The full "continental" breakfast (eggs, home fried potatoes, bacon, sausage)plus cereal, muffins etc,etc, was fantastic. We loved looking at the photos of downtown Vancouver decades ago in the dining room. We had a wonderful time and would highly recommend the St. Regis Hotel .....almost forgot the free calls to ANYWHERE in the world!!!Definitely a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abozz
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel last minute and this one was recommended to me. The staff were incredibly helpful on the phone and very personable. In person they were just as friendly which is important to me because grouchy desk people can easily ruin your stay. The room was gorgeous. The room was split into two with the first having a couch, TV and a good size desk with free internet connection. The bedroom also had a TV in it as well. The bed was very comfortable as well. The desk person said that breakfast was included but I didn't get the chance to try it as I was consistently rushing out in the morning. Overall I really liked this place and will be definitely staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: chiefdog55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Regis for a night on a quick trip and late arrival, the Desk Staff were super helpful as I drive a larger Chevy Truck, and where to park in the middle of downtown Vancouver. When I got too the room the bed was turned down the heat was up and on a out character cold night for Vancouver this was great. I slipped out for a late snack and drink and the staff were very helpful as to what was open and what was good Upon return room was extremely comfortable, all the amenities I needed a safe to lock up laptop, iron for morning ironing, great tv selection and a ipod or iphone dock alarm clock Bed super comfortable and clean Had to call in a interview to Toronto and the free long distance was a great bonus, called in my interview for 45 minutes and not a cent charged to me !!!! Got up little late fro the complimentary breakfast and wandered in 10 mins to 10 am and the staff in cafe were great, got me a couple eggs and sausage and lots of coffee paired with a USA Today I was set Check out fast and accurate Ill be back with my girlfriend next time for sure and spend some more time there

Reviews.Title: “hotel riding on reputation!! not as good as reviews”
Reviews.Author: Stevieduttmer
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here because of the rave reviews on the hotel, although we were unhappy with the stay and will not stay again. Found hairs on the toilet seat when we checked into our room, we had to pay $35 a night parking. The front desk attendant (Benjamin) was rude and unhelpful to our questions about the local area. And we were advised as we had ski bags that we must remove our skis and store them in the lobby. We where then told another 3 times in the one day + a phone call to the room to make sure our ski were in the room. The bar downstairs also had load music until after 12. breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: snowsaltlake
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the St. Regis. The staff was courteous and helpful, the rooms were clean, cozy and beautiful. The breakfast was yummy. I could hear some street noise at night but it didn't disturb my sleep.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to love this place... but it didn't quite live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: none17
Reviews.Content: I really, really wanted to love the St Regis, and at first, I did... the staff were friendly and helpful upon booking and check-in, and the rooms were clean and modern. Its location near two skytrain lines means great access all over the city. I am a relatively light sleeper, so I travel with earplugs and my iPod and accept that there will usually be some sort of noise to drown out. Unfortunately, the St Regis is one of the loudest properties I have ever stayed in. The main part of the hotel is along busy Dunsmuir Street and the Granville skytrain station - meaning that from 11 p.m. to 4 a.m. I was woken up constantly by the traffic noise and the yelling bar crowd. As I was in town to write an exam at 8 a.m. the next two mornings, the terrible sleep was a problem. In the middle of the night I also found the room stiflingly hot - when I called the front desk to ask why the thermostat wasn't responding to my adjustments, they told me that the settings didn't allow it to go lower than 70 degrees. (Am I the only person who finds that too hot to sleep in, particularly with synthetic bed linens?) Opening the windows was not an option since the street noise was already intolerable. While I understand that there is a trade-off between a central location and a certain amount of city buzz, there are construction techniques that can be used to mitigate these problems: upgraded windows and insulation, heavier window coverings, adjustable ventilation systems which can contribute white noise. Sadly it doesn't appear the St Regis took any of these steps. The next morning when I informed the staff I would be checking out early due to the noise and uncomfortable temperature, they were quite rude and said I would have to pay a cancellation fee nearly equal to the value of one night's stay. While I understand hotels protecting themselves through such fees, my feeling was that these were circumstances beyond my control. However, in the end they did not charge the cancellation fee, for which I am grateful. I should also point out that they did offer to re-accommodate me elsewhere in the hotel, but due to its layout and location I wasn't convinced it would make any difference - and with my exam I couldn't take the chance of having another terrible night. Ultimately, if you are not bothered by noise, I would recommend this hotel for its price, rooms, breakfast and location. But if it's important that you get a good night's sleep - I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, family orientated”
Reviews.Author: BMS3
Reviews.Content: Would stay in a heartbeat, family orientated people, good and down to earth. Tammy excellent in the breakfast room, love ya girl keep up the good job. All there to accommodate all your needs. Haven't met all these people so personable and help[ful, can't wait to stay there again. I like the full breakfast service, so close to all ammentites, safe parking, fresh drinking water each day and just a wonderful excellent staff. Thank you all. Bill and Marlene Kalesnikoff

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel - I won't stay anywhere else now”
Reviews.Author: cvqgirl
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vancouver frequently for business and while St Regis can't compare to the larger chain hotels in terms of glitz, it has everything that I want and more. The staff are professional and helpful, breakfast is very good, free wireless, great location, and now they offer unlimited international calls from your room. Their focus on excellence in customer service and providing great value will keep me coming back. I won't stay anywhere else now when I come to Vancouver. Keep up the great work St Regis!

Reviews.Title: “Small, good potential but lacking two big criteria”
Reviews.Author: GBBusinessTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Good - bathroom was exceptionally clean, as was the room. Great towels. Decor was modern without that cheap feeling. Front desk was pleasant. Very small hotel, small lobby, good sense of intimacy and certainly quiet and serene. I think it was pretty empty, so didn't see anyone during my stay. The health club they associate with is excellent, and they were giving free access. For a business travel work out, you can't beat it. Good ironing board, full size and sturdy. The Not So Good - Horrible bed linens. Pillows were fat bricks. Any hotel claiming to be 5-star needs decent sheets and pillows. These were the worst I've encountered in a couple of years. I liked quite a few other aspects of the hotel, but I would not go back for this reason. I asked for a feather pillow after my first night and they said they would send one up, but when I returned late it was not there. Rooms are pretty small but tolerable. If you want a full service hotel, this is probably not the place to book. Weak breakfast/restaurant selection, no concierge... I couldn't find any decent restaurants in teh immediate vicinity and the staff was clueless.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: davidob1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night last year right after the Olympics, and decided to come back for 3 nights in January 2011 before heading up to Whistler. This is one very good hotel and very fair prices. Free wifi, free bottled water, and free long distance phone calls. I wish other hotels were that generous. I will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Inner City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trif123456
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St Regis for two nights and it will be hard to list all the great things about the hotel and out stay. The hotel is located 1.5 blocks from a direct train to the airport and for $2.50 per person on a Sunday, it can't be beat for convenience. The rates were excellent and the offered CAA rate gave us an excellently priced Jr King Suite which was beautifully decorated and offered a sitting area with flat screen TV separated from the sleeping area with another flat screen TV. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. The room was over the restaurant and was a bit noisy but nothing a set of ear plugs didn't eliminate.The bathrooms are outfitted to the highest quality. Small attention to design details are taken every where in the hotel with beveled glass accenting floral arrangements at the elevators and artwork in the hallways and stairwells. The walllpaper, carpet and furnishings were chosen well and added to the feel of a boutique hotel in a heritage building. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. The included breakfast was great with a continental buffet as well as eggs, bacon and hash browns served to your taste. Frankly, can't imagine a thing to complain about at this hotel. When we were leaving someone was complaining about being charged for smoking in their rooms and not getting a late check-out. The staff were pleasantly trying to address this complaint but hard to imagine anyone upset when a hotel asks you to leave at the prescribed time to ready the room for the next guests and asks you not to smoke. It seems hotels have been doing this for years--no news to anyone else. I admired the staff's patience with this complaint. Would definitely look to stay here next time we are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to sky train and tasty breakfast included in price”
Reviews.Author: monkeyboy30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights prior to Whistler and booked after reading reviews on TA. The location is just few minutes walk from sky train so ideal for getting to and from airport. The hotel staff were all very obliging. The breakfast was very very nice, buffet style but with cooked 'American' style too if wanted (eggs as you wished). The studio rooms are adequate for couple of days stay with large bathroom and soaker tub. My only small complaint would be the mini fridge in the room...useful to have but very loud especially as it wasn't built into cupboard/sideboard. Grill/bar located in hotel again has very friendly staff, great place to watch sports game and tasty food.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: kimsw
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite place to stay and recommend to friends. The staff are amazing and the location can't be beat. See you again in March!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic introduction to the west coast!”
Reviews.Author: jaytay72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our friends stayed overnight at the St. Regis prior to taking an Alaskan Cruise. Our hotel room was beautiful..decorations were very tasteful and the bed made for a wondeful night's sleep! We were not far from the downtown area so we decided to take a tour bus since we were only going to be there overnight and wouldn't have much time to see things on our own. The staff at the St, Regis excelled at answering our many questions and gave us great advice regarding tours, restaurants, etc. We enjoyed a delicious full breakfast before going to the boat. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast & outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: amsW6
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way back from Whistler. Hotel was brilliantly located for Gastown & entertainment district, It is also close to Skytrain for airport transfer. The staff could not have been more friendly and welcoming without being obsequious or pretentious. We met various members of staff and they were all lovely. They have free WiFi but if you haven't a computer or need to print documents they're happy for you to do it in their business centre. The WiFi code is printed on your room key holder so you don't find yourself in the infuriating position of being in the room trying to get online while ringing down to reception for the password. They also offer free International calls in the room. The room was a bit small/ oddly shaped but nicely decorated & there is good storage, & equipment (like iPod docking station & tea/coffee) but no fridge. Bathroom was small but stylish and super-soft towels. The inclusive breakfast was fantastic with good variety and enormous portions in the cooked breakfast. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant but the bar area was bright and open and the evening menu looked very appetising.

Reviews.Title: “great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizhambling
Reviews.Content: Smart, modern, very well situated hotel in downtown Vancouver. lovely bedroom with very comfortable beds, modern fittings and every amenity one would expect.. Excellent customer service in all respects. Satff were all friendly and very helpful. Very good cooked or continental breakfast included. Free international phone calls which was fantastic as we needed to keep in touch with our family. I would happily recommend to anyone and hope to return one day. The only thing we didn't like was the noise in the hotel bar which was next door so it put us off eating there and we went to find somewhere a bit quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ratio quality/price”
Reviews.Author: hazinheira
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis hotel is very well located close to the main shopping streets. It was recently renovated therefore it offers good value for money. International calls were free during our stay, which we really appreciated. The access to the business centre was also free of charge. The staff is friendly and glad to help. The room was spacious and clean. Breakfast is not varied (it has the basics) and the dining room is not as confortable as the other hotel facilities. They don't serve early breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but overpriced, rooms small-ish and rather dark”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean, but had more of a large hotel than boutique feel in terms of furnishings and details despite its small size. Room was much too small to be called a suite, and had a wall rather awkwardly separating the bed from a small loveseat to achieve "suite" status. Between the dark gray-blue wall paint, brown furnishings, low ceilings, and lack of light/windows, the overall effect was rather cramped and dark. At about $400 USD per night, there was nothing standout that made it worth the price. A brighter, roomier stay at the Westin or Sheraton is more my style but everything was booked. Staff were nice enough and gave meal recommendations although the Japanese place they sent us was bad to mediocre. I've stayed more enjoyable places for half the price in Vancouver/Whistler/Nanaimo and would keep looking unless you can get a great deal on a room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SuperPicky53
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. No need for a car, in walking distance of everything - great restaurants, great shopping stores, just blocks from the waterfront. The gentleman on the front desk was very polite, very helpful. The hotel room & ensuite bathroom was exactly like the pictures on their website - Really tastefully done. It was a pleasure staying there. For their price of a room with complimentary breakfast there is no better in downtown Vancouver. We return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Nix32
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel went above and beyond to help us, particularly Benjamin. We stayed there over Christmas. He found a restaurant for us to eat at on Christmas day and ensured I got to have a white Christmas by recommending we spend the day at Grousse Mountain. Our room was very modern & new, very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and I loved the big bath. The included breakfast is amazing and I loved the free bottles of water and chocolate each day. We were also blown away with free phone calls!!! We rang home to Australia and it was free!! The hotel is an excellent location. We would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A Vintage Yet Modern Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: s_davis22
Reviews.Content: I was surprising my husband with a trip to Vancouver for a couple nights and I chose this hotel because of the reviews also because the price was excellent! I had never stayed here before so I was hoping for good service and we got GREAT service. The hotel staff were absolutely amazing and helpful. The restaurant staff were really nice and friendly as well. They always talked to us when we walked by or came home from a day of shopping/sightseeing even if it was just a "good evening" or "have a good sleep." We were also welcomed by a note from the hotel manager on the desk in our room and were thanked for staying with them via email when we returned home. It's nice to see people that enjoy their jobs. The customer service at this hotel was the best service we've had at any hotel. It's nice to see people go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and relaxed while you're away from home. The included breakfast wasn't what I expected but it was nice. The only thing I wish was that they had a waffle maker out for us to use because we ate waffles that were cooked previously and we just warmed them in a toaster. It would've been nice to have fresh waffles. That, I think, would be the only thing I would've changed about our stay. Also, it was a little noisy at night (mostly sirens) but we didn't mind it because we chose to stay right downtown. The beds weren't too soft or too firm - they were just right. The rooms were clean and so cute. They are small but it's expected in a vintage hotel. I loved the elevator! It's the tiniest elevator I've ever seen but it was nice to see that they haven't replaced the original elevator with a bigger one. The outside of the hotel and the structure of the hotel is very vintage but the furniture and decorating is very modern. It's very cute. We would and will definitely stay here again. I love this hotel and I recommend it to anyone that enjoys great service, good food, cute hotels and can appreciate the great location.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: cali-lum
Reviews.Content: Great location! Everything is in walking distance and the convenience of a Skytrain station being right next to this hotel was perfect. We hit all the Vancouver hot spots in just a matter of minutes without having to rent a car or take a taxi. The staff is awesome! Upon arrival my girlfriend & I were greeted with a warm welcome on a cold rainy Vancouver day. The front desk staff were very helpful in giving us advice on what to check out since it was our first trip to Vancouver. Also the breakfast was really nice and a great way to start off the day. The room itself was worth the money. Very nice looking, clean and comfortable. What more could you ask for? Trust me the St. Regis is worth every dollar for an awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: perthguy6
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews for this hotel off this website we booked a King suite for four nights with the Glowbal dining package. Even before arrivving the Manager Jeremy had already booked restaurants for our stay. An easy 20 min ride by train or taxi to the hotel which is perfectly situated in the centre of the city. The room was fantastic and very modern and we could walk with our young children to everything! The restaurants we were booked into thru the hotels global package were brilliant and we enjoyed all of them and great value too. The breakfast at the hotel was terrific and the hot food is cooked for you to order which was nice. The front desk helped us every day in regards to what to do or where to go. If you are heading to Vancouver make sure you stay here, a fantastic boutique hotel with very friendly and helpful staff and did I mention long distance calls back to Australia were free too! Keep doing what you are doing Jeremy and we hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Daniyou
Reviews.Content: St Regis is located in the heart of Vancouver. The boutique hotel offers all necessary amenities and is much like an upscale European hotel. The rooms are clean and simple, nicely laid out, though - similar to many European hotels - they are on the smaller side. The staff were friendly and the breakfast is very good - fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, toast, danishes, etc. and eggs/potatoes and bacon/sausage made to order. Be advised that the noise levels are a bit high as the hotel is located directly downtown, however, this is to be expected per the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: James186284
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Dec 2010 and must say I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here, newly done up to a very high standard with nice little eatery attached, staff were always to hand for advise and help and the location was perfect to enjoy all off downtown !!! my only quibble I have with this place is the speed of the elevator but other than that, TOP NOTCH !!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: RosieBDorset_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our trip. We arrived in Vancouver by rail and transferred to the hotel by Sky Train which had a stop right next to the hotel. The room was very well appointed with everything you would expect of this class hotel. The included breakfast was excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Many hotels have free wifi but not many have free international phone calls! We were right in the heart of Downtown with many restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. We will be returning and would definately recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: achills
Reviews.Content: The beds were heavenly slept so good! The rooms were very clean. The room itself with 2 queen beds was small but the bathroom was very large. Hot breakfast was included. Very friendly staff and all of them were very helpful. The only thing missing was a hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mefirst1276
Reviews.Content: Near the center of it all! Underground mall, famous granville street and lots of restaurants. Had a great stay, nice rooms, perfect service! Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent start to winter season”
Reviews.Author: AAAwinter2010
Reviews.Content: We called and made the booking direct with the St Regis and got a better deal than on travel websites - the rate also included a great breakfast, which seems fairly uncommon in our travels in Canada so far. Staff we're friendly and helpful - whether it was finding the nearest cash machine, laundromat or just advice on getting around. Our room was great. Was simple, queen bed (very comfortable) and awesome shower. Great location - we found most of Downtown Vancouver accessible on foot. Would definitely stay there again when visiting Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Delightful - Thank You St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: CityElf
Reviews.Content: Am so glad I booked the St. Regis after reading all the TripAdvisor reviews. Our first trip to Vancouver was a 6 day mini-family reunion, and the location and guest comfort could not have been better. Quiet rooms and hotel, friendly and helpful front desk staff (loved their 100 Days pop up restaurant suggestion!), walked to Gastown, Vancouver Art Gallery, Yaletown - superb location for urban explorers. One block from a speedy bus line to Granville Island and Van Dusen Botanical Garden, 3 blocks from the motor coaches to Whistler. Very tasty menu at the St. Regis Bar and Grill downstairs, and the complimentary breakfast was quite nice. Thank you St. Regis for free in-room internet access and phone calls. My kind of hotel and would gladly return!

Reviews.Title: “We had a very enjoyable stay and the staff was excellent. The room was superb!”
Reviews.Author: Deb093
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time as we celebrated his 5oth birthday. The staff was more than accommodating and friendly. The room was magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGuest2010
Reviews.Content: Had an opportunity recently to stay at the St. Regis hotel in Vancouver. A beautifully appointed boutique hotel situated in the heart of downtown perfectly located for the business traveler. Staff well trained in the fine art of customer service. Clean guestrooms, very comfortable beds, beautiful linen with lovely bathroom amenities. The hotel’s best kept secret is the wonderful massage therapist Mishal. Life should not have regrets, make time for a massage.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great service”
Reviews.Author: LeroyGorski
Reviews.Content: This guys do a great job. Nice hotel, nice service, good location. We will most definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAJ1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the St Regis for two weeks in November 2010. Excellent hotel. The staff are really friendly and helpful. They seem genuinely interested in what you have been doing and where you have visited. They are always able to help if you have any questions and give lots of good suggestions of placed to go and things to see. The breakfast in included which was great. We also tried out the St Regis Bar and grill and the Gotham steak house and The Shore club resturants. All served delicious and food and we couldn't fault the service either. The rooms in the hotel are very clean and nicely decorated and the housekeepingf staff are excellent. We would definately stay here again and recommend others to as well. Adam and Laura ( Scotland)

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel-the best value”
Reviews.Author: KelownaCharlie
Reviews.Content: My wife was given Canuck's tickets (by her friends for her for her birthday.)We stayed at the St. Regis Hotel Vancouver..perfect in everyway. Perfect location in Vancouver for everything. We walked to the game. A five minute bus ride took us to Granville Island. A full breakfast was included (excellent.). ..Room was excellent, so was the service.Staying in Vancouver? stay at the St. Regis Hotel truly, truly excellent. Ann & Charlie Fleming Kelowna B.C.

Reviews.Title: “The St. Regis deserves its' accolades”
Reviews.Author: TheDelicateTraveler
Reviews.Content: This refurbished, small boutique hotel deserves the accolades it gets on this site - it's why I chose it for a weekend downtown. Don't be put off by the 2-star rating. The staff are very courteous and efficient, the room (we had an executive king) was clean, comfortable and up-to-date and the bathroom was beautifully re-done. In addition to free wi-fi, they also offer complimentary international calling (!) and a full breakfast as part of your rate. And I mean full, eggs, bacon, oatmeal, fresh fruit, the works. The location is very central to most things in downtown Vancouver, with a Starbucks beside the lobby and a drugstore across the street. There are two very good, upscale restaurants flanking the hotel - Gothams Steak House and The Shore Club. The hotel also has it's own bar / lounge room offering a nice, light menu (excellent flatbread pizza, wonderful little stuffed yorkshire puddings, some other interesting things as well). Service in the lounge is very friendly; it's not open late though, so if you're looking for a late night meal, you will have to go elsewhere. There is also an upscale fitness centre a block away, so the lack of a gym on site wasn't a deterrent. Woudl definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruby062
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 2 nights but were impressed by the service received. The rooms had tea/coffee making facilities, a very comfy bed, tv etc. We were also surprised to learn that they allowed free international calls. As we have an elderly relative, who was recently in hospital, this was greatly appreciated. The hotel also has an adjoining bar and restaurant, which again was a definite benefit. Thank you St. Regis, for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sleepyhead999
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is a wonderful hotel in the centre of Vancouver. The service was good, the room was decorated in a sharp, modern style, and breakfasts were freshly served and tasty. The only annoyance is the lift – there’s only one for the whole hotel, and with the lift the only way of accessing the breakfast room, you have to be prepared for a bit of a wait. But all in all, I’d definitely recommend the hotel for other visitors to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, quiet with all amenities and great location.”
Reviews.Author: HikerEldon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our two-night stay at the St. Regis in downtown Vancouver in early October 2010. The location was excellent, with 10 minute walks in different directions to the harbor, Gastown, Chinatown and downtown shopping and restaurants. Important to us was the ease of walking with our luggage one block to the Sky Train station that got us inexpensively to the airport in about 30 minutes. We took that one-block walk at 5:30 in the morning, and yet felt quite safe on the well-lighted street. Ask the staff at the desk to get the correct station and train line, if you're not sure. (I believe it's the Vancouver Center Station -- not the slightly closer Granville Station). The hotel was renovated in 2008 and offers just about every modern convenience you could ask for. We stayed in a standard double guestroom, and were quite pleased with all the in-room amenities. The free breakfast not only had a good assortment of buffet items, but you could also order additional hot breakfast items that were served to your table (eggs to order, bacon, ham, etc.). We used the free pc's in the business center to check our email, and we were impressed by the ability to make free international calls. The room price was a great value considering all the above. We got a AAA rate, but be sure to bring your card -- this was the first time in our years of traveling when the check-in attendant actually asked to see our AAA card. We had no car, so parking was not an issue for us. The hotel charges $25 per day for garage parking with in-out privileges; pull up in front of the hotel on arrival to go in and get a parking pass and directions. The staff was quite helpful, especially when we asked for a Chinatown restaurant recommendation. We ended up at a great dim-sum spot that was filled with locals. A Starbucks is attached to the hotel, and several fast-food and convenience stores are very close. The St. Regis has its own steakhouse and a bar & grill, but we did not use them in our short stay. All in all, we highly recommend the St. Regis Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff,great breakfast and modern functional room”
Reviews.Author: amcaharrson
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at this modern hotel. The staff could not have been more helpfuland have to be praised. The rooms were very clean and modern.Good position for sight seeing. Would highly recommend especially getting free international calls .

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel with wonderful reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Rembrandt101
Reviews.Content: Normally stay in cheaper hotels/hostels but loved the luxuries and common sense provisions for guests in this hotel. The addition of Canadian taxes made it more than I'd usually pay but it was worth it. It's the little things that count, and, being a designer I was interested to note the room and bathroom were beautifully appointed. Well done guys! An Australian newspaper would have topped off my experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: rj1177
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience from the time i checked in until I left. The staff was exceptional- very friendly and helpful at all times. The hotel and services were much better than i had ever expected. They offered free full breakfast daily for a good period of time in the morning, free wifi in the rooms as well as computers to use in the business center in the lobby, and even free worldwide calls!! The rooms were nice and clean with a large bathroom and even had bathrobes. I had a wonderful experience here and would stay anytime i return to Vancouver. I would definitly recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “STAYING ELSEWHERE WOULDN'T HAVE BEEN THE SAME”
Reviews.Author: Probian9910
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews spouse and self expected lots. It's now difficult to say whether St R came up to prior expectations but there was certainly no disappointment. A small hotel in centre of town, St R gave everything we needed over our 3-nights stay. In fact, so much so that we ate each night at the Bistro bar which is something else. Book a table if you go as younger business folk use the Bistro as their after-work collapse joint and business meeting venue from 4pm leaving few tables for others and it can be full by 6pm. We wondered about our decision to eat there on the first night, had become accustomed by the second and enjoyed it on the third despite everyone trying to talk above the general hub-bub. One of those perhaps rare eateries where staff know many of the diners and by our third evening we were welcomed as though we had been there for ever. Great. If a Bistro is not your style, the hotel has a quality restaurant next door with prices to match. A burger bar is immediately opposite so food would not be short. Our room was more than adequate. One thing we did find was that staff have a mental block if asked for fresh milk for room use. If what you need doesn't come in thimble sized long-life, forget it. There's a 7-Eleven, plus the burger bar, across the road for immediate needs - including milk. Breakfast was excellent and included in the room rate for us - with fresh milk for the cornies. Reception staff were ever-helpful and fell over themselves to assist. In your travels has it been noticed that when there is an error in the final bill it is rarely in the guests favour. Same here. Interestingly, our two errors involved tips in the Bistro which suggests, to me, that it is the system, not the night-auditor, which is at fault. Those ever-helpful receptionists resolved the problem promptly and efficiantly. Spouse and self would go back to St R without hesitation. Mainly, because it is more "personal": where a guest can be comfortable, eat and drink well without excessive cost and be served by staff who care, receive help where sought, be in the CBD and feel safe. We probably would not again ask for fresh milk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, lovely staff, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaireF3280
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the St Regis for 4 nights during a 4 week holiday and it was a fantastic place to stay. The staff are friendly and attentive (without being in your face), a decent breakfast was included and it is located right in the heart of Vancouver. I am a stickler for the little things in hotels and the St Regis got it right there - complementary bottles of water left beside our bed every day and decent sized bars of beautiful smelling soap (who really uses liquid soap anyway??). There was also a happening bar located right downstairs which served nice meals if you weren't inclined to walk far for dinner. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay... what a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: AimeeCorinne
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Vancouver for a convention and I had the pleasure of staying at the St. Regis for four nights. The hotel was a nice 10 minute walk to the convention center and was also a short walk to Robson Street, Yaletown, and Gas Town. I felt very safe around the hotel both early in the morning and in the evenings. While the room was somewhat small, it was very comfortable and clean. I was very impressed by all that was included in the price of the room: wi-fi, international calling, bottled water, and a wonderful, hot, made-to-order breakfast! I had many colleagues paying twice as much for fewer amenities in the hotels near the convention center. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vancouver for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, scrumptious breakfast and free wifi!”
Reviews.Author: traveldreams2
Reviews.Content: About a 10 min walk to the convention center and walking distance of everything downtown - gastown, robson st, waterfront, chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: amidnightraider
Reviews.Content: Staff polite and helpful. Room clean but not very large-next to stairwell. Only one small elevator. Convenient location right downtown. Did not use parking but we were dropped a block away by shuttle that we used. Driver felt area around hotel was too congested. Overall we felt that it was too expensive for the room we had. Best part of experience was the breakfast. I think we will try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely luxury hotel in central Vancouver - bit pricey but worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Lee_Gaskin
Reviews.Content: The staff at the St Regis were VERY helpful! Everyone from the front desk to the waitress could not do enough to help. The location was perfect for downtown Vancouver (near to the Metro and walking distance to all the main attractions). Our room was decorated to an excellent standard (we stayed in an Executive King room), and the bed was huge and very comfortable. The breakfast was the best we had for the whole 2 weeks we were away - highly recommended. The only slight criticism we would voice is the price - it is quite expensive, but you do get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “a boutique hotel of 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: fournierSanJuan
Reviews.Content: All the staff helped us in our tours and restaurants. They arranged everything,from the selection of the best tours and the prebook. I want to thanks Tammy , every morning, she was with a smile and courtesy in the breakfast. Fantastic location for shopping and restautrants. I want to thank Juan, Benjamin and Britanny for being so helpful in our first visit to Vancouver. Beautiful clean city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, classy hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: GlynnF
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this very well-appointed, classy little hotel in central Vancouver. Our room was one of the smaller configurations on our floor, but was still roomy enough for us and all our luggage, plus very tastefully decorated. Bathroom was very workable and well lit, and spotlessly clean. The room rate included hot and/or cold breakfast in the lower lobby, with well trained and friendly staff and HEAPS of food. Front office staff polite and helpful. Great all round value. Would definitely stay here again, loved it!

Reviews.Title: “St. Regis has won me over”
Reviews.Author: Sprite62
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis has the ambience, service, quality and value to make it my all-around favourite hotel in Vancouver. I live in Victoria and go to the mainland for business or to visit family several times a year. Our previous "haunt" was getting a bit shabby so we started looking for a new hang-out. We have found it. I love the decor in the lobby and the rooms. The staff are smart, helpful and fun. The breakfast is easy and adequate and the breakfast room is huge. And guess what they have added recently? Free local and long-distance calls within North America! Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, stylish, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: twr25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very pleasant, with a good breakfast included, free phone calls to anywhere in North America, and with sophisticated decor. Parking was convenient, but expensive (about $30), and the street noise was intrusive at times.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for the best price..”
Reviews.Author: Mashinka
Reviews.Content: Amazing place! We spent 2 nights in October and they're just the best! The hotel is located in the center of the city yet extremely quiet ( i brought the earplugs but didn't use them :)). They room they offered us a room on the second floor and we were very happy when we saw the room and the bathroom - if i'd really want to pick on something, i'd say that the room wasn't very big but that didn't bother us at all and we had more than enough space. Big windows on 2 walls of the room, big TV, safe in the room, complimentary water every day. There are a lot of complimentary services in this perfect place - complimentary calls all around the world ( have you ever heard about this ???), complimentary breakfast with eggs made to order etc. The bathroom only has the shower but it's a very very nice bathroom with Acca Cappa products and the floor temperature controls! These guys are really trying to be green - there is a master switch by the door that you can use to turn everything off when you leave - so you dont have to go around and turn everything down separately. People at the reception are the friendliest, most knowledgeable people - Ivan and Benjamen, thank you very much! They will answer any question you have. I can go on and on about how awesome thing place is but you just have to go and witness for yourself! It was my birthday trip and we stayed at 3 different hotels including The Loden in Vancouver but i definitely liked St. Regis the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: starryvm
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Vancouver and the St. Regis was a great choice! So many amenities - free internet, free 24 hr business center, free bottled water, free made to order breakfast (which was delicious!), and free international calling! The room was very clean, modern, and quiet. The location was great as everything was in walking distance. The highlight of the hotel was Benjamin! He was so warm, friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Give him a promotion! :) Overall, a very nice stay and an awesome value. I would definitely return to the St. Regis and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MrsvK9
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, Great rooms, Comfortable beds, Friendly staff, Great FREE Breakfast, Wonderful and incredibly cheap massage, fantastic pub and restaurant attached, amazing location, superb recommendations from reception..... I could just go on! My (new!) husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and I cannot recommend it enough! Everything about our stay was great. On arrival reception allowed us into our room immediately as it was ready - and what a room it was! We were upgraded as it was our honeymoon and had an amazing 1 bed suite - great coffee, TV's, toiletries - not to mention one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! We took advatage of the inhouse massage service - it was such a bargain and according to my husband, 'one of the best massages he has ever had'. The free breakfast is brilliant - a great choice of continental (cereals, fruit, toast, breads, yoghurts, juices, hot drinks, pastries...) and on top of that, a hot choice of ham, bacon, eggs as you like them and hash browns - great service too! The location is good - right in the middle of everything, shops just around the corner, train station practically next door, restaurants all around, only 10mins walk to Canada Place and Gastown.... perfect for us! We were recommended restaurants, tours and transport options by reception - never too much trouble, always concise and thoughtful - including the wonderful Salt tasting rooms - a must for any cheese and wine lover! On top of all of that... free bottles of water in the room, free internet, great pub attached (not noisy!) for great offers on international and local bears, sports on the TV's, a good menu and a great atmosphere. This was the last hotel we stayed in on our trip and it was the ideal end... I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “1st room was smelly, but they moved us then otherwise quite good!”
Reviews.Author: DAL504
Reviews.Content: We got to the St Regis on a soggy Saturday afternoon after driving up from Seattle and having lunch on Robson. The hotel is quite centrally located but a little sketchy at street level right around the hotel (walk a block toward Stanley Park and it is far better. The hotel has obviously gotten a pretty heafty makeover (I assume for the Olympics). The lobby was a bit cozy but no real waste of space. It being an old building, the elevator was rather tiny as well. We got up to our original room and there was this very pungent smell - and not a pleasant one - like rotten eggs or something had died in the room. I immediately went downstairs and they were able to re-accommodate us to a different room without the smell. The new room was quite small but for sleeping it was fine. It was on a lower floor so the street noise was there - and although I live in the city and have lived in similar spots for many years, I live on a quieter street now so had to readjust to the "white noise". The bathroom was very nicely redone as was the room itself. They also had cooked to order breakfast included which was very nice indeed! One minor complaint was that they didn't have their own workout room but did offer a higher rate with a voucher to go to a nearby gym. All in all a good stay for a very central location that was much more affordable than the big chains nearby!!!

Reviews.Title: “How do they do it? Stay & save?”
Reviews.Author: Mjana12
Reviews.Content: At check in I was told about free long distance in North America on top of all the other inclusions, internet (that works),breakfast for two, bottled water, business center. I have never stayed at a hotel that does not nickel and dime you for everything. Top notch rooms, very clean, friendly service. To add insult to injury for other hotels they told me at check out that on my next stay they will have free worldwide long distance, impressive when most hotel serve you with huge markups. I was at a hotel in Toronto last week that charged $7.75 for a 30 second Canadian call, I hope they see this review. This hotel as they say has “just the most perfect location” taking all into consideration I probably saved $60.00 a day with all the wonderful inclusion. I did have to pay for my one hour massage with Mishal for $60.00 an other great deal for the best one I have had. Wow I will definitely stay there again, I only paid $3.75 to get to the airport on the new Canada Line a block away from the hotel. A must when traveling to Vancouver!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW - What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Steven_Martin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me ( I normally stay at Marriott or Marriott style hotels but was amazed at how expensive the Marriott in Downtown Vancouver was) So... I wasn't expecting too much. How wrong I was! A superbly appointed boutique hotel - with super friendly and helpful staff. My room was clean, spacious and modern. The decor was without fault and the bed was so comfortable that, even with my jet lag, I manage to sleep :-) I WILL be staying there EVERY time I visit Vancouver. Thank you St. Regis

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to comfortably stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: tanVirginia
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired and the rooms were ready. After napping, the recommendation for lunch (3pm) was right on and that was just the beginning. The ending was a wonderful concierge who shouldered our bags and walked a couple of blocks to deliver us to the bus that would take us to Bellingham. When we said, "Wait, you can't carry all that" he said "oh, its ok, it reminds me of my hockey days"! Very helpful staff and a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jandover
Reviews.Content: Stayed night in order to join cruise ship the next day. Very comfortable bed in a good size room with luxury bathroom. Good position, close to Sky Train and other amenities. Good value breakfast included in the price. Staff very friendly and extremely helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, fantastic breakfast and excellent service. A keeper.”
Reviews.Author: WentworthLabs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the St. Regis hotel, downtown Vancouver and would definitely stay there again. The rates are quite reasonable and the rooms are beautifully decorated. Our stay included a fantastic breakfast. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: MWest11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the final 3 nights of our honeymoon. The hotel is superbly located in downtown Vancouver. It really is perfectly situated. The room was very clean and well equipped. The staff were friendly. The worst thing about this hotel is the parking arrangements. The problem for me was on arrival. It said on their website that you can stop outside the front to get a car park pass. However, all the signs on the street said you were not allowed to stop, so we stopped down a side alley instead. I ran round into the lobby to ask what we were supposed to do and apparently there is a by-law which says you can stop on any street for up to 3 minutes regardless of the signs. I suppose if you know these rules, then that is fine, but as tourists we did not. And even if we did, what if there was a queue? Could I get in and out in 3 minutes? It turns out the alley I stopped in I was even more likely to get a ticket for stopping in. All of this made our arrival very confusing and stressful. The owners of the hotel need to make the rules and directions clearer to the guests. Once we were in and sorted, our stay was lovely. Apart from the elephant that was walking about in the room upstairs (not literally, just someone was making a lot of noise), I can't complain about this place. The breakfast was average to good, but at least it was free. The free wireless was excellent and I liked the free bottles of water - a nice touch. The St. Regis turned out to be a great base for our Vancouver stay. The only reason I give it 4 out of 5 is the parking issue, and the fact it cost me nearly $300 per night (including parking fee of $25 per day). I just felt that I could probably have found somewhere as good for less money, but I wanted a guaranteed good place for the last 3 nights of our honeymoon. Overall, I'd definitely recommend the St Regis to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: RetroKitch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two teenagers stayed at the St. Regis following our Alaskan cruise. Location is very good - centrally located in downtown near the shops and restaurants, as well as a short cab ride from the port, . Although I think that it is geared more toward business travellers than toward leisure, we still had a pleasant stay.
