Arrived early in the morning, and our rooms weren't ready, so Brian suggested we take a short walk over to Vancouver Island. First of all, it was probably twice the amount of time; and I wish he had mentionned the boat that takes you to the island - it would have been a much more pleasant trip in the heat than walking over the bridge. The note, from Jeremy Roncoroni, general manager, was an unexpected (and welcome touch) The rooms, minimalist but attractive, are very comfortable - our son said that it was the most comfortable bed he has ever slept on, and my complaints are few and minor. I found the tub to have an extremely high side, making it difficult to get into, and I wished that there was an outside ventilation system. As we were downtown, there was a noise factor that did not lend to a restfull night's sleep. Although breakfast is included (a welcome respite, considering Canadian prices), the atmosphere was rather austere (rather bar like in nature), and the food instutional (juices in machines, toast your own bread, egg selections limited to scrambled or fried, no omelets, coffee machines). However, given the prices, it probably works out to $15/per per person, so it is certainly an added value. Coffee wasn't good, (by my standards,: I like it strong) but there is a Starbucks in the building and a Tim Horton's across the street. Britta, who was on in the evenings, was a great resource for dinners - Cactus Club Cafe was certainly a winner. Be sure to take some time to go to the aquarium! All in all, a very pleasant stay with few complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Value and comfort excellent”
Reviews.Author: Margaret186338
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the St Regis. The staff were unfailingly courteous and helpful, and cool under pressure. The location was central for shopping and restaurants. The room and public areas of the hotel were clean and the complimentary breakfast made the mornings very relaxed for us. The room facilities were great.

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: barbev2
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is an elegant and charming small hotel, well-located in Vancouver’s downtown, handy to both the airport SkyTrain and the cruise terminal. Our room wasn’t large but it was nicely furnished and extremely comfortable, with a quite luxurious bathroom. Our view of industrial rooftops wasn’t exactly picturesque, but at least the room wasn’t on a busy street frontage so was very quiet. Free wi-fi was good to have, and the room would have been almost perfect had there been a small refrigerator (something that Australians take for granted!). The breakfast provided was exceptionally good, served by friendly and cheerful staff in the large basement dining room. The staff on the reception desk were also friendly and cheerful, as well as efficient and helpful. Would not only recommend the St Regis but would encourage people to stay there and experience its charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great homebase for a visit of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: HAPATRAVELER80
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor I choose the St. Regis for my week long stay in Vancouver. As others have said the location, cleanliness and staff were great. Located on the corner of Seymour and Dunsmuir, the hotel is a short walk from the "Vancouver City Centre" station (on Georgia & Granville St) for the Canada Line train to and from the airport. From the hotel you are within walking distance of Canada Place for the cruise ships, Gastown, Yaletown and the rest of downtown. This will definitely be my hotel of choose for future visits to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “They just keep on blowing my skirt up!!!”
Reviews.Author: mimitu
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel now 3 times. I will be going back next week. Everything is great! I spent every everning before bed in the bar, the customer's are practically all gone and the staff comes out to have a beer. They are great! I have always said if you staff your bar with great people and good drinks, people will keep coming back. The included breakfast was excellent also! What blows up my skirt? Gorgeous clean hotel rooms, big flat screen tv in front of the bed, beautiful bathroom and great attitudes! As Forrest Gump would say "that's all I got to say about that..." Springer out!

Reviews.Title: “central hotel especially for cruise terminal.”
Reviews.Author: welshgirl1955
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean. Bedrooms were a good size and well furnished. Staff very friendly and helpful. Meals were excellent value. Location excellent for the cruise terminal but also good for visiting attractions e.g stanley park, Grouse Mountain, Granville Island

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Lonestar438
Reviews.Content: After researching many hotels in the Vancouver area, I chose the St. Regis for it's value, complimentary breakfast, location, and recommendations on Tripadvisor. My husband and I were not disappointed. Hotels in Vancouver are very expensive and the St. Regis delivered!!! Great location, excellent staff, good breakfast, and nice rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Would be perfect if it wasn;t for the...”
Reviews.Author: WelshwizardK10D
Reviews.Content: fact you are limited to 3 minutes parking outside. The administrators in Vancouver seem to have this suicidal attitude to visitors with some stupid regulations or bye-laws... which means if you arrive at the hotel by car and wishing to check-in, you are stuck if you are travelling alone... either you have to deposit your luggage on the pavement and hope the concierge can help look after it while you take your car to the local car park ($3,25 even for a short period) or hope that your companion can take everything - but the car driver still has to take the car to the car park.,... INSANE, secondly - the hotel has only one lift. And to go to the restaurant for breakfast you must go by lift. It is also not the most accomodating lift. So, when you want to go to breakfast or check out with your luggage you find yourselves waiting for what seems like an eternity while the lift fills, and arrived at your floor already full. RIDICULOUS Positives: Service staff at the desk excellent - spot on with their dinner recommendations Rooms - spacious, clean and comfortable Location - great for downtown, Gastown etc Getting around Vancouver, bus stops nearby

Reviews.Title: “The friendly & helpful manager and his staff made us feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: jackie187517
Reviews.Content: Our room was modern and clean and even though we were at the front of the hotel overlooking a busy road, there was no noise penetration and the comfortable beds contributed to a good nights sleep. The inclusive breakfast was a bonus, although the breakfast room was a little dark as it was in the basement. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & cozy... the best place to stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyCouple0910
Reviews.Content: We stayed in St. Regis from 31 Aug - 4 Sept before embarking for our Alaskan cruise. Our room is so clean and cozy and the bathroom/toilet is so elegantly designed. Shower water pressure is a bit low but not really an issue. The complimentary breakfast is so filling and more than enough to pass the day. We chose this hotel as it is just walking distance to Canada Place where we would embark for our cruise. No problem at all walking via Granville St. even with our 4 luggages. Highly recommended, value for money! Truly the best place to stay in Downtown Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great bathroom, bed, and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: We booked the St. Regis because it was pretty much all that was available within walking distance of Rogers Arena. The hotel is very old, but nicely renovated. Given its age, the rooms are small, but the bathroom was quite spacious and the shower was awesome! The breakfast was impressive as well....in addition to the typical hotel breakfast choices, you can also order a hot breaky of eggs, hashbrowns and sausage or bacon. The breakfast area is plenty roomy too. The downsides of this hotel were the lousy off site parking situation (for $25 plus tax too!) and the tiny, slow elevator. If you stay, you may want to opt for a room on the lower floors so you can take the stairs as much as possible. We probably won't stay again if we bring our vehicle......if we fly or bus to Van we may be inclined to stay at the St. Regis again. It is very close to a skytrain station and lots of shopping. The 15 minute walk to Rogers Arena was fine on the way there, but after the concert it seemed fairly long.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: phy9pas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the St. Regis for four nights in August. The location is very hands for downtown, Gastown and Chinatown. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. It's a city center hotel, so expect a little traffic noise, but the rooms are very well appointed. I think it has had a renovation recently so the decor inside is a lot nicer than it may look from the outside. Breakfast is included in the rate (although I don't think it advertised this when we booked through Expedia.) Good quality choice of cereals, breads and drinks with table service of fresh eggs, sausage, hash browns and bacon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find”
Reviews.Author: PDSC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at St, Regis for 4 nights prior to our cruise. Great location for getting around in the downtown area. From the moment we arrived at the hotel until the day we left , the service was outstanding. For the most part our interface was with Adrian (he seemed to be there all the time!) at the front desk. Whether we were asking for sightseeing tips or restaurant recommendations; he always took his time to help us. The rooms were nicely appointed and very comfortable. The full breakfast that was provided, was a great way to start the day. The staff there were very attentive and hospitable.

Reviews.Title: “We had an excellent experience at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: johnalany
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Vancouver to participate in the GranFondo Whistler bicycle extravaganza and the entire experience was magnificent. Staying at the St. Regis Hotel was key to the enjoyment factor. The staff was very welcoming to the cyclists and their families. The amenities were spectacular. I especially appreciated the services of Anna in the Dining Room and Ivan, Adrian, and Benjamin at the front desk. Dave in the maintenance department was also a big help and was very accommodating. I will definitely stay at this fine establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “great get together!!!”
Reviews.Author: jacquiePowellRiver
Reviews.Content: central location with comfortable access to all of downtown. lovely room, friendly and responsive staff,food was excellent, the service and attitude of staff was the best I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: AussieOldie2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed only two nights here andfound the hotel excellent for our needs. It is centrally located and the staff were extremely helpful with information about how best to get to the places we wished to visit. We didn't leave until late on our departure day and again staff were more than cooperative in providing not just a left-luggage facility but also a place to change into our travelling clothes and use of the business centre even after we'd checked out.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: healthy2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would like to thank you for the great experience we had at your hotel. We loved the junior suite from the king size bed to the beautiful charcoal decor. A special thank you to Adrian Boktcher at the front desk, to Janet Thomas, the Director of Sales and last but not least the beautiful person that gave me a massage.. We could not believe the breakfast that is included in your stay. We were not only offered a buffet of breads, fruit etc. but a choice of eggs done your way, hash browns and bacon, ham, or sausages. They made our stay feel like we were VIPs. Chris and Cindy from Kamloops

Reviews.Title: “Simply brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: CMarkC
Reviews.Content: We booked our 10 night stay at the St. Regis in March after reading all of the Tripadvisor reviews. I'm glad we did - what an excellent place to stay. The staff were excellent, the room was clean and well decorated, the bed comfortable and our holiday was made so much better by having a pleasant place to stay after a hard day of relaxing. The bar, attached to the hotel, serves good beer and food (as we found on our first night) if you cant be bothered walking far - although there are many eating establishments within about 5 minutes. The location of the hotel was excellent, convenient for waterfront, skytrain, downtown, gastown and shopping. In addition, the inclusive breakfast (huge, tasty and filling) and WiFi were the icing on the cake. A thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: mb619
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the St Regis for 3 nights at the beginning of our trip and then stayed 1 more night at the end of the trip. We were so pleased with the staff. We had the best sushi we ever ate on their recommendation They were very helpful and friendly. The room was nicely decorated, large bathroom, 2 robes and clean. We like having breakfast included so we can start the day without wasting time looking for coffee and something to eat. This had alot of choices. Also liked the location. We were able to walk just about anywhere we wanted to get to.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Calif-Dining-Diva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the St. Regis in August, largely based on the TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. Some reviews had mentioned small rooms, but we knew that coming off of a 7-night cruise, the room would be huge by comparison--it was. The linens and decor were first class, and the service was excellent. Located in downtown Vancouver, the St. Regis is within walking distance of great restaurants, shopping and the Vancouver Art Museum. A hop-on-hop-off trolley ticket for two days allowed us to get around easily, including a day in lovely Stanley Park. It is on a par with Golden Gate Park in San Francisco. This is a lovely city with friendly people, the the St. Regis fit right in. The staff were friendly, and always willing to go the extra mile, giving directions and making recommendations. Breakfast is included in the nightly rate. It includes eggs cooked to order, bacon and/or sausage, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, and a variety of breads--bagels, pastries, toast, muffins. Fresh juices, coffee, tea, and milk are included, of course. Last but not least, the place is spotlessly clean from top to bottom. When we travel to Vancouver again, we will definitely stay at the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJDSydney
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend this hotel to travellers. it is in a great location in the centre of vancouver. It is a very well presented and maintained hotel very close to the train to the airport and also to Canada place which is where the cruise ships leave from. They have free wireless internel and breakfast included plus 3 addtional computers availabe for use. The only down side is that the hotel is in the centre of the city so some rooms may a bit of road noise but it is not too bad. The staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful little gem with great service”
Reviews.Author: stlouistraveler007
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel thru Trip Advisor, and stayed here for 2 nights at the end of an Alaskan cruise. The hotel was just lovely, small overall but with large rooms, wide halls, sound proofing. Rooms were beautiful, well decorated, comfortable beds, nice electronics, beautiful walk in shower and big bathrooms. Common areas very nice, free internet with several terminals and printer for guest use, several newspapers and small library. Free full breakfast, very nice. Bar/ restaurant next door excellent. Best of all was the wonderful staff; everyone from bellman to desk staff to waitresses and manager were incredibly friendly and helpful, with finding restaurants and sight-seeing spots, storing luggage, retrieving our lost credit card which we left in the bar/ restaurant, etc. The staff could not have been more gracious and helpful. We loved Vancouver and would love to come back and stay at the St. Regis!

Reviews.Title: “nice small hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: RailroadCrossing
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a very nice small hotel. The rooms are well designed with every feature that a leisure or business traveler might need. The hotel is centrally located. But, it is truly the staff who made it remarkable. They were professional, friendly and available to help with any and every need. The breakfast is fine, nothing special in a basement room that feels a bit like a college dining hall. But, again the staff there were great and the food was fine - a continental spread + egg orders There is no gym - you can pay a fee to go to a neighborhood one. And there is free wireless as well as free North American phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: PalmDesertDesertrat
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel that offers great service. ALL the employees are helpful and polite. The rooms are very large and modern. A great bonus of free North America calling is terrific along with interent. Breakfast is served fresh and fast and is included with the room. The food in the pub was tasty; a little expensive however. We will return to this hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Just Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Lanab_10
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the St Regis was just lovely from start to finish - from the very helpful desk staff, to the super comfortable bed, great room and just devine massages from the in-house masseuse. I could not fault this hotel on anything, it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel at a reasonable price in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: holidaypro1963
Reviews.Content: I read previous reviews about this hotel and everything they say is true! I stayed 2 nights at the St Regis Hotel and was delivered by cab to the front door. I was greeted by Benjamin and he was warm and friendly and extremely helpful giving me heaps of advice about the hotel. All of the staff I spoke to in the hotel were top class, even the cleaning staff were friendly and smiling. They are a real asset to this hotel. I don't know where these guys are trained but there are many top class hotels around the place that could get some lessons from the St Regis! From the outside this hotel looks quite plain and even the lobby is very small but once you get to your room you will be pleasantly surprised. The rooms are a good size, very tastefully decorated with quality fitting and have a very crisp clean feel. In room wireless, air con which is very responsive, 32"LCD, a nice desk, nice lighting and and very nice spacious bathroom. I have stayed at 5 star hotels all around the world and this room would not be out of place in any of these hotels. I had a drink at the bar adjoining the hotel and the staff there were also very friendly and the service was great. The only slight negative I could point out is the lift. It is from the original hotel so it is very small and quite slow but there are only 5 floors so it doesn't have to go far. The longest I waited was about 3-4 minutes. Ben was efficient on check in he actually informed me the lift was a little slow so I was prepared for it anyway. For me this hotel rates 10 out 10 and I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends. VRH - New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “BRILLANT”
Reviews.Author: andreafsmith
Reviews.Content: I live in the Seattle area but recently took an overnight trip to Vancouver with a friend from Oklahoma. St Regis was just what we needed....And the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Got us into a great restaurant on Friday night...with no wait... Great location and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel with great location downtown”
Reviews.Author: dorric
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week in this charming boutique hotel and enjoyed it thoroughly. Our room was immaculate with excellent amenities. Free long-distance calls to US, bottled water each day and a delicious full breakfast were also included (loved those fresh-baked muffins). Nice pub attached. It is close to shopping, dining and sightseeing. We were able to walk everywhere. This was our first visit to Vancouver, and the entire staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. They gave us recommendations for great dining experiences and wonderful activities and provided full concierge service along with them. We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel hit the spot”
Reviews.Author: JG-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The St Regis for 5 nights following an Alaskan cruise. Hotel is lovely, rooms spotless and very comfortable. Bathroom was really nice with good quaility toiletries and towels. Nice touches in the room including coffee machine and free water The breakfast room was very nice with panelled wood decor and located on the lower ground floor . Breakfast was great with a choice of beveages and cereals etc on the buffet with freshley cooked food provided at your request from the kitchen. This was good value as there are not many hotels in the city which offer B&B Staff were excellent, very pleasant and helpful , right from the concierge to the waitress serving your table at breakfast. We also ate at the sports bar attached to the hotel a couple of times and the food and service was really good . The hotel is located close to the less desirable part of the city but you do not feel threatened and it was safe to walk around. Only slight point is that the hotel is located on a corner of very busy crossroads so if you are a light sleeper (like me), it can keep you awake, however, after a couple of nights you don't notice the noise so much. All in all we had a great stay and would certainly stay here again when visiting Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: csanfel
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is real find! Recently redone and it is excellent. Staff could not be any nicer or more helpful. They are all great. Full american breakfast. Free callling to US. location is in central city, convenient to everything. Good sports pub attatched. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller88
Reviews.Content: As I had an early flight on the day after arriving back in Vancouver, I needed a central hotel, I decided to try this hotel based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor. I am very pleased I did. My room on the 4th floor was delightful, I especially enjoyed the opulent shower. The room contained everything a traveller would require, and it is very close to the Sky Train & Canada Line, so it was very convienent for the journey to the airport early next morning. The staff were very friendly & helpful. I can not comment on the breakfast that was included in my tafiff, as my early start prevented me from having breakfast. This hotel was a good choice for what I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Irina111
Reviews.Content: We were completely satisfied with our stay at the St. Regis. The room was immaculately clean and very nicely decorated. The bed was so comfortable it felt like sleeping on a cloud. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful. A really great extra was free unlimited long distance phone calls anywhere in N. America. I've never had that in any hotel before. The included breakfast was very plentiful and included prepared-to-order eggs. Its a very good location too. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Especially Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lillyatl
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very comfortable. This is a great location, central to everything. However, on Saturday night, we could hear people yelling on the street. It is a little close to the edge of a less desirable area. The staff was excellent, especially Juan and Benjamin. They helped us make dinner reservations and their recommendations were very good. Air conditioning was a little off, as Vancouver was having a heat wave, but overall we were very comfortable in the hotel. Breakfast was a wonderful bonus as it is included and was substantial.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn267
Reviews.Content: Right from we checked in we found the staff very friendly - especially Brittany and the trainee ( the 1 who is having his 3rd child)! Nothing was too much trouble. Having breakfast included was a bonus and we were not expecting a cooked option. Rooms were lovely with a great sized bathroom. The only grumbling we have is that few Canadian hotels provide shower gel?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Renata005
Reviews.Content: Very nice well-located hotel. The staff is wonderful, very friendly. Definitely would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “second time still a charm”
Reviews.Author: blackbox1
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the hotel and once again the accomadations were very enjoyable made even better by the very friendlly staff (JUAN.) The beachs that are whithin a very short walk are fantastic and seem to be access through the shopping areas which seemed to please my girlfriend. The only negative was that of the city who has seemed to without much logic put an ill designed bike lane outside the hotel. In closing down a valuble traffic lane which inturn causes alot of traffic confusion and leeds to the inevitable horn/verbal noise. The city itself is an outdoor lovers dream with more than enough activities to occup your day, be sure to check with the informative guest services for the locals in and outs. Very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is simply perfect from whatever angle you consider!”
Reviews.Author: robin22059
Reviews.Content: After our circular tour of BC we chose the St Regis in downtown Vancouver to recuperate. It is the ideal luxury accommodation with which to treat oneself after suffering 19 awkward nights on an RV sofa bed i.e. dog basket. The beds are a supremely comfortable - the ideal remedy for a sore and tired body - and the service at this hotel is par excellence. This hotel is moderately expensive at almost 300 CAD for a family room and breakfast but the package feels well worth it. The general manager, Jeremy Roncoroni, of Italian decent, is a most client-oriented host and nothing is too much trouble. He will honestly and willingly advise you on the best places to visit , eat and drink and seems to have the map of Vancouver's transport system etched into his brain. The young night clerk, Brittany, is equally accommodating and the staff's attention to service details and guest support is second to none. If you are looking for a friendly, decent, comfortable hotel to stay in downtown Vancouver look no further and enjoy the pampering!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: stanspec
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms. Under $200 a night. Great location for subway, bus, and sea bus use. Exceptionall friendly employees that were very helpful. Great breakfast with typical food out but then the offer to cook to order eggs, meat and potatos. Very happy with visit.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: Honkycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in July. The hotel has a real quality boutique feel and the room was beautifully decorated and very clean.. the bathroom was spotless. One slight gripe was that I had requested a room on a high floor (to minimise street noise). We were put on the first floor and it WAS noisy. I brought this to their attention and to be fair, they were really nice about it and said we should be able to move. Noone approached us about it on the second day so we stayed in the same room and then couldn't be bothered moving for the last night. Also, when we actually looked at the hotel, it's not that tall, so maybe a higher floor wouldn't have made any difference... we'll never know. I also had one sleepless hight because someone in the room nextdoor was watching TV loudly until 3:30 in the morning. Again, to be fair, I went down to reception and they phoned the room and asked for it to be turned down. The room (103) was small. I looked in some of the neighboring rooms on the floor as they were being cleaned and they looked a fair bit bigger, so maybe it was just this room... it was kind of on a corner. The hotel has a great location close to bus stops etc and walking distance to shops and nice restaurants. Parking is quite expensive (about $33 a night) and we weren't told about it on arrival so it was a little surprise on checkout! The breakfast (included) is really good which is a big bonus. We also had a quick meal in the bar attached which was fine. It's a really nice bar, but I wanted to pay with a traveller's cheque which the manager refused to take. I mentioned this to the reception staff and they said he should have taken it and they would raise it with him, so clearly he just couldn't be bothered... not great. The main Manager who was on reception each morning was, by contrast, excellent and very helpful.. even giving us change for the bus, and the two girls who checked us in on the first night were also first class. Overall, a good experience and I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - the *most* impressive staff”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week at the St. Regis. The hotel is great. I will summarize with pros and cons: PROS: 1) The staff - I have never met such warm and willing people. They really are stellar and seek to make you feel like "family." 2) The rooms - are wonderful - very clean, very up to date. They have a "port" where you can play your music, movies, or games from a computer, ipod, etc. The bathrooms are dreamy - great showers. 3) Breakfast - made to order eggs, fruit, pastries, muffins - excellent! They replenished the supplies regularly - we loved this! 4) Location - right next to shopping, dining, and the always fun "Granville Street" (where the street is walking only - a great time). 5) Very upscale feeling...but in no way "snooty." 6) Free WIFI (even in rooms) worked well. 7) Great business center with open computers. CONS: 1) Parking is expensive and they charge by any fraction of the day....so if you get into town at 10 PM - you pay that days fee, even though you used only two hours (I parked at a lot less than a block away and had no problems - saved a little bit...but we had to "prepay" in parking lots...the Canadian way...that saved since we did day trips...we weren't paying for time we weren't parked). (I just asked my wife, and that is the only "con" we can come up with - we loved the place :))

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: torerikb
Reviews.Content: Close to everything you need in Vancouver, this hotel is highly recommended. The service and friendliness of the staff was excellent. Best breakfast I've got so far in North Amerika on all my travels, and it was complimentary. Free WIFI, a water-bottle and choclate everyday, great bathroom and medium sized but really nice room. Booking this hotel is absolutely risk-free and guaranteed a nice experience. And BTW, Vancouver itself is a really nice city.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising in every positive way!”
Reviews.Author: carrie416
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a family wedding, and stayed one night at the St. Regis after all the wedding craziness was over. I checked in quickly and efficiently. The concierge was exceptionally knowledgeable and friendly. Upon arriving in my room, I was extremely impressed with the quality of the furnishings and the comfort of the bed. I've stayed in all sorts of hotels (usually Westin for work, but have stayed at Opus, W, etc.) and this was BY FAR the most comfortable bed I have encountered! The washroom was spotless and the size of the room was perfect for a solo traveller. I booked a massage through the front desk with Mishal, their resident masseur. HE WAS FANTASTIC. It was the perfect massage for tired feet (from walking all over the city) and for sore back (from carrying all my luggage). And at $60 for the hour, it was a very reasonable rate compared to my hometown (Toronto ... usually $80/hour at a spa). I then ordered dinner through room service. The room service button didn't work on the phone so I ordered through the front desk. Room service called me back to confirm the order. The food arrived within the hour. Hot, fresh, delicious - the way it would have been if I had eaten at the restaurant. Checkout the next day was a breeze. The staff here are so friendly and so accommodating. I must have called the front desk 3 or 4 times, and I never got any "I'm too busy for you" attitude from the staff that I've experienced at other hotels. Given the fantastic location of the hotel and the incredible price I got (booked straight through the hotel website), I would say that this would rank as the second best hotel experience I've ever had - and I've had a lot! The value for money was just incredible. Thank you to all the staff at the St. Regis for making my stay relaxing and enjoyable :)

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous”
Reviews.Author: appleton1909
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly suprised checking into this hotel, considering what I'd paid. +ves: Very shmick for the price <5 minutes walk from shopping district Convenience stores nearby Next door to Skytrain station Complimentary bottled water and wireless internet access Friendly and helpful staff at reception Excellent complimentary variety of hot and cold breakfast items -ves: I could argue that it could always cheaper but the price I got was pretty good. Other than that, nothing significant. Additional: Over the length of my stay, I probably spent two hours conversing with one of the reception staff, discussing things such as the weather (yes I know its cliche), Canadian culture, taxation, bike lanes, things to see or have seen, how Vancouver copes with snow compared to the East, etc. The guy even printed off a map and showed me how I could do a short but scenic bushwalk along the Capilano River valley for free rather than just see the overpriced Suspension Bridge. Unfortunately, I can't remember the guy's name, but I do remember that he was in his twenties and had recently moved from Ottawa with his partner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly helpful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: JFR68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night prior to joining our ship for an Alaska tour. The room was overlooking the main street which was on the noisy side, but it was spotlessly clean with a good shower and a comfortable bed. The breakfast in the morning was very good. As we had a day to fill on our return we asked whether we could return and leave our luggage with them while we explored Vancouver; they were only too happy to oblige. From the general manager down everyone was so helpful and friendly, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel at reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: SinclairPhilip
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver. The rooms are impeccable, the service is excellent, the rooms are quiet and the location is very central. Sinclair Philip Sooke Harbour House

Reviews.Title: “A lovely gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: robinbt
Reviews.Content: Great location and wonderful staff. We stayed here for 5 nights and it was easy to get around from here - either walking or using public transportation. The young, friendly and super-helpful staff (front desk, restaurant, breakfast room) went out their way to make our visit enjoyable. We enjoyed the delicious breakfast, and well-designed rooms and bathrooms. Also, we appreciated the complimentary bottled water on those unexpectedly hot Vancouver days. The in-room thermostat allowed us to keep the room at a comfortable temperature at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer50168
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so impressed with the St. Regis Hotel in Vancouver that I decided to write my first-ever hotel review. The hotel is in a great location - safe, quiet, close to public transportation, restaurants, attractions, shopping and a bank. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms, and especially the bathrooms, are spacious. The complimentary breakfast , in a large lovely setting, was superb. The elevator is small, but that wasn't a problem for us. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dina4630
Reviews.Content: Grat little hotel...clean, rooms were a good size and well lit. Bathroom was spacious and was sensibly decorated/arranged. Floor in bathroom had radiant heat- wonderful. Staff was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Full breakfast daily included in rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: TwoOxontravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, particularly convenient if arriving from the airport as it is only one block from the Canada Line. It is als within easy walking distance of the harbour and Canada Place. The staff are very efficient and friendly. The room was compact but very well laid out, quiet and with a comfortable bed. The room appeared recently refurbished and was spotless. Breakfast is included in the room rate and was excellent with hot and cold choices. A good business centre was also available for guests, located off the lobby with two computers. The only downside we could see with this hotel was that although it is downtown and only a very short distance from the Pacific Centre (shopping mall), if you ventured east, the area quickly becomes very tacky. Having said that, we had no problems and did not feel at all unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Front Desk Staff & Modern Design & location & massage therapist”
Reviews.Author: dino21
Reviews.Content: Beat the heat of NYC by staying 4 days in Vancouver & the Staff at the St. Regis mad the trip a true delight. Adrian, Benjamin, Brittany, and all the others whose names I cannot remember were consistently courteous, helpful, and efficient. At the St Regis the staff at the front desk are fully equipped to fix room problems, book theatre tickets, suggest big screens for world cup viewing, volunteer advice for best bike rental, print out bus schedules for out of the city day trips, and give nuanced restaurant recommendations. Although they seem young they have pride and are engaged in their jobs and are true professionals. Rooms tidy, sleek, & double paned silent for a great night's sleep. Good lighting & sufficient drawer & closet space even if the total sq footage is tight. We don't need no stinkin' bathtub when the showers are so fabulous. Needed massage after long day around town and found Mishal to be the premier combo of Swedish/Balinese/Thai massage skills. should have carved out time for 2 more. Very reasonably priced too. The only thing that could have been better was selection of breakfast cereals( no whole grains) & pastries(a bit anemic). No worries though, we ate whole grain toast, yogurt, fruit, and one day opted for the always available egg & pork choice. The coffee surprisingly good for coming from a big urn. I guess this close to Seattle they're not allowed to offer poor coffee. In fact whole town has great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Cardiff123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on our 2 week visit to Canada. This place lives up to its reputation. We were welcomed in by the guys on reception, bags carried up to our room etc. We were slightly early, however they had our room ready. We booked a standard room, the room was everything we expected however there was a slight glitch in that the extractor from the bar and grill was outside that was a bit noisy. I could have put up with it, however my partner is a light sleeper. I made a request to be moved but all of the standard rooms were occupied. After some juggling around, to ensure we had a great stay, Evan (member of staff on reception) got us moved to a Junior Suite at no additional cost. This was located on the top floor. Room was fantastic and spotlessly clean. Large bathroom, large bed and seperate living area. Breakfast was great, location great, staff great. They were also helpful in recomending restaurants and helped us book travel tickets. Would definately visit again.... Thanks for a great 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and the location make the place”
Reviews.Author: ScottishPrincess
Reviews.Content: 65 bedrooms, good location- avoid walking east - seems to be a lot more people begging in the streets of Vancouver. However it is the staff that really make this place...they are young, upbeat, pleasant..the bar tender remembered us after the first afternoon- that is service. Free wifi, bottled water was a bonus. We watched the world cup final in the Cheers style bar - what a great atmosphere. The breakfast though it says continental is a hot cooked breakfast and really sets you up for the day. For the price you pay for this city centre location- definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and well decorated room”
Reviews.Author: mytripUK
Reviews.Content: We chose The St Regis after reading good reviews here and were pleased with our selection. Staff are very friendly and genuinely seem to enjoy working there. The refurbishment of the old building has been done very well and the room was well decorated (loved the walls) with great shower closet in the bathroom and a "real" hairdryer. Although the room was on a street side there was not too much noise to disturb sleep. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Do not judge a book by its cover”
Reviews.Author: geordiemagpie
Reviews.Content: We had just driven down Vancouver from whistler at the end of a 2 week fly drive taking in Calgary/Jasper /Bannf etc. Thanks to the sat nav we found the hotel without any problems,arriving on the Canada day the traffic outside the hotel was light otherwise their would have been problems offloading as this hotel is in the centre of Vancouver of a main street, From the outside it looked drab and rundown but once inside it was apperant it had recently been updated, the reception staff were good helping to offload the car quickly, we were given room 104 which was overlooking a road junction but the room was big light and airey, BIG MISTAKE from 10pm all you got was noise from the groundfloor bar, drunks outside and heavy goods traffic so no slee that night, breakfast was ok?? we managed to change rooms on the third night but only to the 2nd floor 205 the noise was just as bad the ansewer appears to be get a back room on 5th floor but how you get them god knows, when walking out at night watch out for druggies shooting up nearby and the locals asking for change give to one and the word gets round so do not

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fridayfan
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a smaller, older hotel that has been renovated quite recently. Its exterior is unprepossessing and the lobby small - not a place to see and be seen -but that's not what is important to us in a hotel anyway. The room was large (we're used to New York hotels), nicely appointed, spotlessly clean and quiet. The bathroom was wonderful - a walk-in shower with a built-in bench, heated floor and natural light. The mattress and bed linens were very comfortable. The hotel takes its complimentary breakfast seriously - the food was plentiful and good. There is even table service with eggs cooked to order. What really makes the hotel a standout though is its staff; to a one the desk staff was welcoming and helpful. We'd be more than happy to discover a hotel like this when and wherever we travel. Oh, and I forgot to mention the free WIFI...

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: henrodette
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel, beautifully decorated rooms. Great service, breakfast included. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: zombieshakespeare
Reviews.Content: Went with my fiance. We like to shop, so this location was perfect. The hotel staff are welcoming, and we were very happy with the service the entire time. The included breakfast was made to order, and included a good continental selection. We liked that the fruit salad tasted freshly cut. We had a suite style room and it was certainly adequate. The bathrooms were nice as well. Great value / luxury combination. Oh and wifi is included among the many amenities, plenty of nice touches.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Property”
Reviews.Author: CalSole
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the St Regis - top notch desk service - helped in all our tour needs. Clean room, great pub, and one block from the "sky train." Will for sure stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Vancouver...a hotel with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: akira1829
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the St. Regis. Room rate included great daily breakfast with eggs made to order. Complimentary bottled water everyday, free local calls and a personalized note upon check-in from the manager. The location and room were also wonderful. Close to public transit with clean and spacious rooms. For once a hotel which includes all services in your rate. I would recommend this hotel for your stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AlliFlex
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 days in Vancouver with a friend. We booked the St. Regis based on reviews we read on various travel websites. The hotel is a few blocks outside of the heart of downtown. We found the location to be perfect - very close to several skytrain stops and walking distance to the waterfront, shopping and downtown. We did not have much time to plan our excursions and the front desk staff was very helpful with recommendations for car and bike rentals, places to eat, etc. The hotal accomadations were just what we needed, very nicely done rooms (small though). Closet space was fine and a large bathroom (no bathtub). Breakfast was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: AgentSusan
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent I have stayed in many hotels around the world. This is by far now one of my favourites. Central location, amazing service, great rooms, super friendly and helpful staff. The full complimentary breakfast that is incuded is fantastic.The free internet lounge and library were an added bonus. It is a wonderful boutique hotel - after busy days I felt like I was "coming home" every night. The bed was so comfortable. I will definately stay here on my next visit to Vancouver for either business or pleasure, A wonderful stay and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: andyDenver
Reviews.Content: exactly right where you want to be, walk to anywhere, safe, very nice. Rooms comfortable, not large but not too small. Recently updated, finished out very nicely, somewhat modern. Nice flat screen tv, great desk workspace, plug-ins for internet cable, and you have enough plug-ins for every device to charge right on the desk, keeps the room nice and neat. Free breakfast in the morning was very good, eggs, sausage, bacon, muffins, fruits, juice. Decent enough lobby, extremely NICE and helpful staff, from front desk to breakfast to maids. It is very important to have a nice, safe and convenient place to stay, close to the subway "sky train" to the airport, close to wonderful restaraunts and awesome shopping when you travel. STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for a Hotel Stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ibcoup
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is brilliantly located , is good value , has great rooms and a really good atmosphere all round. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: gestephens
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent value. The service from the friendly staff was superb. The hotel is right in the centre of the shopping district, the room was spacious and clean with an excellent bathroom. The breakfast was also very good and we would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Best value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: Austraveller49
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best value hotels we have found through Tripadvisor. At AUD$130 per night per double including a full breakfast we could not have asked for more. The room quality and general service were excellent. Although not large the room was very comfortable with quality fittings, equipment and amenities. The only point for consideration would be low level traffic noise as we were on the first floor. If this is a concern then we would recommend that you request a higher floor. The small business centre off the foyer offered free Internet and a quiet reading area which we found very convenient while waiting for tours. The reception staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Location is excellent being a short walk to Gastown, the Cruise Terminals and city centre with plenty of restaurants, cafes, bistros convenience stores and more only a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and made to feel at home”
Reviews.Author: Boxer03
Reviews.Content: My son and I came into Vancouver the night before in order to be prepared for a discovery the next day. Arrived around 10:00 the night before and had to be at the appt by 8:30 next morning. So nice to wake up, have a lovely breakfast, the day was glorious sun and all and able to work to the appointment and I did a lot of walking around and enjoyed the energy I received from other people as I walked around the streets in the area. We had a wonderful feeling when we arrived and it continued through our stay. We will if the opportunity arises again we will know where to stay. Thank you for making us feel special and taking good care of us. Thank you Jason & Doreen

Reviews.Title: “best value in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: freight88
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel with extremely helpful staff. bathroom great. very close to the airport metro. best hotel we stayed in canada and that includes some expensive ones in the rockies.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Angel1945
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great the service was absolutely wonderful the staff very helpful the room was wonderful and the location excellent if you return which I hope we do one day it is the hotel that we would stay without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean,excellent friendly staff good position enjoyed my stay very much”
Reviews.Author: AirdrieCurler
Reviews.Content: Close to metro and train links, short distance to seabus. Used trolley bus two day ticket which let you see the areas you would like to visit on the first day then picked the places I wanted to spend more time at. Visited the aquarium in Stanley Park. Made use of tickets tonight found at the Tourist Information close to Canada Place for special rate tickets on the evening of the performance. Day pass for the metro, bus and seabus $9. No swimming pool but arrangements can be made to access one. Facility for massage therapist on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissK70
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous trip advisor reviews. We were certainly not disappointed. It is in a great location close to shops and tourist spots. The rooms are a good size for a city hotel. Breakfast was included in the price and it is definitley worth getting out of bed for - especially the muffins. We went to the bar each night and also ate there. Good food menu with sport shown on the large tv screens.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice all round”
Reviews.Author: ChesterLeStreet
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the St Regis and loved it. It may not be the most lavish; possibly not the grandest, but it does everything really well. Location is good – on the edge of Downtown. One or two blocks further East towards Chinatown is a bit grim, but it's right next to the Skytrain station (which is easy and cheap) and a minute from the Pacific centre shops with Gastown a gentle five minute stroll. We had a suite which had a separate lounge area and, although not huge, it was very comfortable. Only downside for us was that we had a shower but no bath and there was nowhere to hang towels or dressing gowns in the bathroom. Breakfast was free and served by remarkably cheerful staff. Usual continental buffet, plus eggs anyway you like and a 'meat item'. Great way to start the day. Internet access was free on two good computers and wi-fi was also provided. The bar next door was really buzzy in a 'Cheers' style with sport on several TVs. Wouldn't recommend the Gents lav. as it's frosted glass in the stall and makes every movement (pardon the pun) visible. Food was ok. Mainly burgers and pasta but all reasonable prices with nice young staff. The ST Regis isn't the most eye-catching building, but the combination of great staff, good location and competitive prices make it a best bet in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, rates, rooms and free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: actionadv
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in downtown Vancouver . Room rates are excellent and it includes a hot cooked breakfast. Room as great, clean, bathrooms amazing. The staff are absolutely amazing - we were in Vancouver to get married and had hoped to get married outside in Vanier Park but the weather did not cooperate - the St. Regis found us a spot to get married in (there were just 4 in the wedding party) and couldn't have been more helpful - and did not charge us for the use of the space! By the end of the 4 days we were there we knew all the staff and it was awesome. The manager even gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne. I cannot rate them high enough. Location is terrific - really close to all kinds of shopping and restaurants. We will definitely be staying there again. The McEwens Yellowknife, NT

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Indeed”
Reviews.Author: tr1pper
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for 3 nights just before the 2010 Winter Olympics as our normal hotel was overtaken by Vanoc. I could not have been happier. A very modern fresh and clean hotel indeed. The room was very comfortable with a fantastically comfy large bed and a brilliant bathroom. If I had to complain and I really don't, I would say the light switches are a bit confusing, and took some time to figure out with some help. If that was the largest of my worries then it goes to show you the quality of this Hotel. The staff are magic and could not have done enough for us, any question was answered, any problem was solved (even the lights switches). Breakfast was included in the room rate and was more than enough with a vast array of options to see the day started well. The hotel is small but they have done a very good job in sound proofing as when in our room we could hardly hear any street noise and never heard others in the hotel. They supply free wired internet access to all rooms which in today's modern way is a must, and very welcome. Large screen TV kept the wife happy while I surfed the net for the short time before drifting off to a wonderful slumber on a super comfy bed. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would also look at staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pampering when we needed it.”
Reviews.Author: hicactuary
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the St. Regis following a cruise which terminated in Vancouver. The outstanding service, comfort and location was just what we needed. Rooms were top class with very comfortable bed and very nice bathroom. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The location was great, close to everything you need. Had computers for free use with fastest internet ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: PHT-Ten
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the St, Regis, wished it could have been a longer stay. The room was elegant and tranquil, lovely decor. Staff were helpful and friendly, especially Juan who dealt with us at reception. A good central location for our requirements, would certainly stay there again when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart!”
Reviews.Author: Mellski
Reviews.Content: To be honest, this hotel is a cut above the type of place we'd usually stay when travelling round. It was very smart, shiny, clean, well facilitated, and comfortable (perhaps a little souless), and the staff were extremely helpful and courteous. The room was a bit small, but not to the extent that it mattered. Considering it's downtown, it's not too noisy, (but you can tell where you are). Breakfast was great, with a well stocked buffet, and the option of ordering a cooked breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy”
Reviews.Author: Fastrack101
Reviews.Content: Big, spacious rooms. Comfortable. Very friendly, accommodating staff. And a terrific location close to the Convention Center, Robson, Granville, and steps away from the train station. The only drawback? The toilet was already backed-up when I checked-in late at night, which maintenance wasn't available to fix until the next morning (they did so quickly then)... but lo and behold, it backed up again 2 days later. Otherwise, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience at the Regis.”
Reviews.Author: osarenzo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this great new hotel well almost new (the renovation), this was my second stay, this time they had added a new feature to the hotel, massages! I am not big on massages but the bio in the room of the therapist was very impressive, so I decided to give a try, WOW not only was it the most affordable massage ever $60.00 for one hour but it was also a phenomenal experience Mishal was just great and the room they have created was gorgeous even though it does not match the rest of the hotel, it’s very comforting, nicely appointed with a great sound system. The hotel still continues to be very friendly with clean rooms, I love that other than movies everything is included, breakfast, internet, local calls and bottled water. For me and my small business just as they say “just the most prefect hotel” I have been recommending this hotel to everyone that tells me they are going to YVR

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff hit the high notes”
Reviews.Author: bklyn554
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis Hotel is a great value for the money. Situated right in the heart of town, it is within easy walking distance to shops, restaurants and local attractions. The staff makes you feel like they take personal responsibility for you comfort during your stay. The Front desk personnel (Juan, Breanna, and all around funny man Benjamin) go out of their way to engage visitors and make sure you can get to where ever you are going. The staff in the cafeteria are also welcoming and make you feel right at home. The Hotel and rooms are very nicely decorated (loved the leather wall details) and comfortable and the bathroom transports you to a spa-like setting. Aside from that, Vancouver is a great vacation destination with lots to offer. I highly recommend that if you make this a destination you select the St. Regis as your home base. Darien Wilson New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location; breakfast needs more variety”
Reviews.Author: Mickirish
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is a small hotel located on top of the Granville stop of the Expo and Millenium Sky Train lines; it couldn't be more convenient. Our room (two queen beds occupied by two adults and a teen) was extremely small; it was difficult to locate a place to put our three suitcases while still being able to move about the room. However, the beds were comfortable, and the room was quiet even though we seemed to be in a side alley/pit with some heating and cooling machinery right outside. The free bottled water was a nice touch. My only quibble: I booked because of the "cooked to order" breakfast that I read about here on trip advisor. Once there, we learned that, to paraphrase Henry Ford, we could have anything cooked to order that we wanted, as long as it was eggs. The variety of the breakfast buffet could be greatly improved by the addition of a make-your-own-waffle machine for those who either cannot eat eggs or would like a change from eggs during a multi-day stay. The hotel does seem more geared toward the business traveler rather than families.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, one of my heartfelt favourites among the many hotels I've stayed.”
Reviews.Author: aap2010
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is very easy to get to from the airport and, once there, one is so warmly welcomed and the stage is set for a lovely stay. The staff, all the staff, are wonderful - very efficient and generous with their attention. The hotel is beautifully decorated, with soothing colors, clean lines, and great original art. The rooms are comfortable, the robes cozy. The included breakfast is very good, with eggs and accompaniments made to order, in addition to a nice array of pastries, cereal, etc., and (as elsewhere in the hotel) kind service. With all of that, the St. Regis is well-situated as well, steps away from the Canada Line for those coming from the airport. Well, it's just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further than the St Regis when staying in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DevonshireLad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St Regis for three days and my choice could not have been bettered, great value for money, staff unbelievably helpful, room good size and very comfortable and ideal location for sightseeing, shopping and all other touristy things.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: nassvalley
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vancouver frequently and have always stayed at larger hotels, this time I decided to try this hotel for a change and was quite pleased with the result. I had met my sister at their lounge prior to my stay, that is how I found the hotel. I liked that it is close to the Canada Line and close to downtown. I also liked the decor, however I found the mattress a little too uncomfortable. The breakfast was nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: ladyofglass
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and every day was a pleasure. This is a great price, great hotel, great staff and great location. The room are small more like European style, were clean and nicely decorated. I would recommend it, and did, to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine friendliness matched with professional attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Chubey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on a recent Seattle/Vancouver trip. The hotel is very central-rooms a bit dark in decor( but that's a personal taste thing). Great breakfast, friendly service, FABULOUS big bathroom with a great power shower. We had very noisy neighbours on our first night ( TV and loud chatter from 4-6 am??!) and were immediately offered another room. We decided to hope for the best; the manager informed us that they were moving out anyway later and the following morning looked at us hopefully as we left for the day when I was able to tell him we'd had a great night's sleep. He seemed genuinely relieved and delighted. The staff at this hotel did everything they could to make our stay brilliant-including lots of good recommendations for places to eat. First class.

Reviews.Title: “since this Hotel has been renovated it is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cowgrrrl
Reviews.Content: They did it right when they renovated. I was impressed at the quality of our room. From the outside you have no idea. This is a boutique hotel but has been turned into a very modern place. We had a big walkin marble shower. Close to everything downtown. Parking is a hike away but the skytrain terminal is right handy.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay and an amazing value.”
Reviews.Author: Brent_pdx
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my Fiance, her mother, and a family friend. We had two rooms, both of which were on the first floor. However, we were happy to find that the first floor at this hotel, is actually the 2nd floor, and so we were not on ground level. The rooms were very clean, modern, and well appointed. The hotel is excellently located in the center of the city. It is a short walk to Robson street and Granville street, both of which we enjoyed walking down. There are also convenient buses to Gas Town, Stanley Park, and Granville Island Market. The staff provided excellent service, and the complimentary breakfast was much more than I expected. The breakfast includes freshly cooked eggs (cooked to your liking), potatoes, and a choice of breakfast meat. There is also a self-serve area which provides cereal, cinnamon roles, drinks, yogurt, and fruit. All in all, a great experience at only about $130 Canadian per room (with AAA discount). I have attached photos to this review to help illustrate.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: nknieriem
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vancouver and we went with no spcefic plan in mind. We didnt know the city at all. The staff was so knowledgeable and made excellent reccomendations for resturants and activities. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast everymorning was great. The only bad thing I can say is that the hotel does not have a view of anything. Since we were only in the hotel to sleep it didnt really matter. All the staff was friendly and did a great job anticipating our needs and wants. We are allready planning our next trip and plan to stay with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: LawCon
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room based on other's reviews and pictures, but were always wondering what it would really be like. We were thoroughly pleased! Everything from the staff to our accommodations were excellent and the location was also great. It was nice to know we would have a great room to rest comfortably after our day of activities.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: probativev
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights right before the Olympics. I loved our room. The furnishing are all very new looking, and the style is Pottery Barn, which is a really great change of pace from the standard 4 star hotels. The Pottery Barn style furniture and furnishing gives a retro hotel ambience that I definitely enjoyed. Loved the bathroom. The wall paper and wall art were all very calming and tasteful. Bed was comfy. Quiet. The location was awesome and was close to all the great spots in downtown Vancouver. Very convenient. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: Oztraveller010
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel for a business trip. Facilities were great. Having free wifi and breakfast included was a real bonus. Location close to the Canada Line of the skytrain meant getting back to the airport was a breeze. The only complaint was the slightly noisy air conditioning outside our room but ultimately this did not affect our stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite hotel in Vancouver by far!”
Reviews.Author: natxoxo
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is the perfect hotel for a romantic weekend getaway in the city. I stayed here one night with my boyfriend in November, the price was definitely a bit of a splurge, but I was very pleased with everything. The complementary breakfast was AWESOME and the staff was all so sweet. We had a quiet movie night in after dinner at the hotel bar, but the location is quite convenient if you are looking for some nightlife. The rooms are spotless and cozy, with a contemporary design. The bathroom was all marble with heater floors, gorgeous shower! I will definitely stay here again, it was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a quality hotel that doesn't nickel and dime you”
Reviews.Author: Fried-Rice2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St. Regis for two nights March just after the Olympics and found it a great value in an otherwise expensive city. Our rate was $50-$60 cheaper than the Hyatt where we had been earlier in the stay for a conference, plus it included a cooked-to-order breakfast, free wi-fi, free local calls, and believe it or not, free bottles of water. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly and accommodating. The staff characterizes it as a boutique hotel, but with the extensive renovations, the rooms seem like smaller versions of the chic suites you'ld spend a lot more for nearer the city's business core. The hotel is well located just a couple blocks from the shopping at Robson Street and Gastown and a block or less from any of the Skytrain lines. It is at the eastern end of the downtown core so it doesn't have the skyscraper views and it doesn't front on the fancy Robson Street fashion shops but those are best seen from the street level anyway when you can get closer to the energy of this fun city. There were still signs of renovations in progress (e.g. painting) which may explain an allergic reaction my wife had in the early morning, but overall the St. Regis is a good quality hotel that gives you more than most of the fancier hotels at much lower rates. Pluses - free breakfast/wi-fi/water, location, price, value Minuses - smaller rooms (we had one of the smaller rooms. There are a range of rooms of varying sizes, but room size isn't a huge factor for us.)

Reviews.Title: “Benjamin and breakfast were great... otherwise, I don't get the hype.”
Reviews.Author: lspierce
Reviews.Content: Had a three day stay in March 2010. After staying in giant condos in Whistler and the Pacific Palisades Hotel earlier in our visit, the king executive room at the St. Regis seemed really small. No fridge was the worst part. We filled up the sink with ice to keep drinks cold. We talked to the hotel about possibly paying to upgrade to a suite but we couldn't afford it. I thought it would have been nice of them to upgrade us for free since they told us they had suites open that no one was using, but they didn't offer. It was a little cold after the other places we stayed bended over backwards to hook us up. The daytime desk guy was Benjamin who was awesome. He helped us unpack our car and bring everything upstairs. He also gave us great neighborhood recommendations. The older man working at night was a jerk. He acted very inconvenienced when I asked him to get my leftovers which Benjamin had put in the staff refrigerator during the day. He looked really upset to have to get up and help me. They had a really cool looking deck in the wall to plug in our laptop to play movies on the TV, but no one at the front desk could figure out how to make it work. FAIL. The free breakfast was really good and the waitress was very sweet and helpful. This was probably the best part of our stay - the breakfast and Benjamin.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: oRi_5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. It was recommended by our travel agent. We really enjoyed our stay here. It was the perfect start for our honeymoon. We spent 4 nights here before heading out on an Alaskan cruise. The hotel was recently totally renovated and it looks great! There is some history behind it - its been built for years - but I can't remember much about that. It is located on a corner, and the room we had was a corner room too so we had plenty of light and views from all angles. We had about 4 windows! The bed was lovely and comfortable as was the bathroom with a nice big shower and an extra special touch which i loved - underfloor heating!! Felt so nice under your toes!!! :) There wasn't a great selection of food - your usual cereal, toast, etc. You could also have a warm breakfast like bacon, eggs and sausages. The waiter would bring this to you nice and fresh. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. On our last day our toilet got blocked and they sent someone up to fix it right away - so they were very efficient too. Location was great and within walking distance of the main attractions. It was also great for us to get to the cruise terminal when we had to leave. If you don't mind walking about 5/10 mins dragging your suitcases then its great. We thought it made more sense then getting a taxi for a few metres. Overall we had a great stay and would recommend it to anyone - especially a nice romantic getaway that doesn't cost a bomb!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: christopher51
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days for Olympics. Everything was great at St. Regis, and staff was beyond helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Effortless service, great central location”
Reviews.Author: TurinTuner
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Although the hotel is centrally located, at the heart of the city, my room was exceptionally quiet, well appointed, with a reasonable if not massive bathroom. Sleep quality excellent owing to silence, well judged room temperature and comfortable bed. Breakfast a little bland by European standards, but there was plenty of it. The staff were very welcoming and efficient. Hotel was well maintained and exceptionally clean.

Reviews.Title: “They're all about service”
Reviews.Author: Valleygal21
Reviews.Content: On the way to the hotel, several of the main roads were closed. By the time we got there, my husband was a little stressed. He dropped me off at the curb and was unsure as to whether or not he could stay put or where the parking was. Craig jumped to our rescue. He went outside and personally guided my husband to the parking. We love Craig! He was also very personable and helpful at breakfast the next morning. We completed the St. Regis comment form and mentioned our experience with Craig. We also mentioned that we loved the room--the windows are pretty much soundproof (we couldn't hear any street noise), the bathroom was beautiful, the finishes were nice, and the master power switch is a great "green" touch. We also mentioned that we loved the sheets. A day or two later, General Manager Jeremy Roncoroni emailed to say that, while the company that provides the sheets does not sell to the public, he would be happy to make the purchase on my behalf. He found out how much king size sheets were (because they use queen at the hotel), took my VISA info, made the purchase, and had them delivered to my door in time for Christmas. The sheets are lovely! We love Jeremy, too! Talk about service!

Reviews.Title: “A nice comfortable, high value hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeoMedic
Reviews.Content: In the run-up to the 2010 Olympics, I had an opportunity to visit Vancouver for one night. I chose the St. Regis based on reviews, price, and location. Located about a block and a half away from the City Center SkyTrain stop ($8.50 from the airport, $3.75 to the airport) in a Central Business District fringe-type environment, the St. Regis is a renovated 6(?) story building very close to other downtown hotels and the main mall. I found it to be a very clean and fresh smelling place, even in the smallish lobby. Rooms are accessed by small elevator or a wide, clean, and well lit stairwell. I found the room to be on the smaller side of medium being about 12"x15" and the adjoining bathroom was on the larger side of medium. The hallways and rooms are done in a grey modern tone. The rooms are equipped with a 32" flatscreen tv. As others have noted, the mattress has a thin synthetic protective cover on it. If I didn't dig for it, I wouldn't have noticed it. I find the first night in any hotel to be a rough night. Here, I found the bed to be just below what I'd call very good. The firm mattress is buffered by a relatively thin pillow-top. The pillows were great. There has been reviews that mention how noisy the rooms are. I differ on that completely. This is a hotel in an urban center. There will be noise is downtown areas. My room was on the second floor on the Dunsmiur St side (hotel front). I heard very little and my sleep, light as it was, did not get disturbed by street old building noise. In comparison to other Vancouver stays (such as the Marriott... 300 feet from the seaplane terminal) it was soothingly quiet. On the service front, it was excellent. The front desk staff were warm and I felt that they were taking care of me. There was a hand written note welcoming me to my room and it was a nice touch. The hotel is very mindful of security. The access to the rooms is immediately adjacent to the front desk *and* you need a room key to activate the elevator at all times. No nickle and diming. The water in the room was complimentary, as was internet (and good internet speed at that). The toiletries are of good quality and there were two nice bathrobes ready for use. The room came with breakfast, that is served in a large dining area at the bottom floor of the hotel. The room is large, open, well lit and clean. The service was quite good with cheerful, fast, hot food delivery... substantial quantity too. If I were to change something it would be the quality of the juice served. The orange juice was reconstituted watery second grade supermarket box juice... really... not worth it. Unless you have to have the the spacious lobby, the extra large elevators to a high floor, or want to pay 60% more + internet charges, you should choose the St. Regis. You are very close to everything that matters and the service is first rate. "Boutique" hotels can be a gamble at times. The odds are well in your favour at this one. I'll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent find”
Reviews.Author: kismet33
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best boutique hotel I've stayed in. Quality rooms, comfortable beds (hard to get out of bed), very clean, our breakfast was included (a really good breakfast!), free internet, and the service was second to none. I definitely recommend this hotel. Close to everything, walking distance. Again the service is excellent. Great staff, friendly and helpful with great recommendations of places to eat. We stayed in a 2 double bed room, very roomy, large bathroom. Very comfortable and clean. Very comfortable beds! Do consider this place, you won't be disappointed. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: apaquet
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, good breakfast. But the beds were extremely uncomfortable. My back was killing after the first night, were there for three. My wife had same issue. And we're only 34 years old..... lol. Anyway, nice hotel, great staff, all of them very very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms with plastic covers over the mattress. Good location. Great bar/restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: austmob
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely noisy fronting two very busy streets. To be moved to a slightly quieter room will cost you extra. The beds are extremely uncomfortable with plastic covers overthe mattress. The location is good and the breakfast great. Staff were very friendly but overall would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask them anything. They will help.”
Reviews.Author: Sprite62
