Reviews.Content: I chose the St. Regis after reading Trip Advisor recommendations and was really pleased with this hotel. My husband and I were in Vancouver last weekend to visit our daughters. We were to meet at our hotel then go for dinner. We were coming from three different directions and none of us had been there before. Each of us received helpful, friendly service. The facade of the building is lovely and the lobby is welcoming. It could have used a larger seating area but this is a heritage hotel and everything is on a 19th c. scale. The artwork, finishings and colour schemes are top-notch and our room was quiet, clean, well-appointed and comfortable. I sure hope Mr. Johnson (the intended occupant of our room) got his own chocolates. They were delicious. Apparenlty, Mr. Johnson is a regular who warrants a box of chocolates and a hand-written, welcome note! When I arrived in our room, I noticed the note and took it down to the front desk. But I didn't notice that the note was on top of a box of chocolates. When I finally saw them, I coveted them. The breakfast is every bit as good as the other reviews indicate. Not to be pushy but please remember to take some money to tip your breakfast server. I observed people leaving without doing so. All-in-all, a great place for a weekend away. Nearby choices for dining are plentiful and range from Tim Horton's to Gotham Steakhouse. Thanks for all your help, Benjamin,

Reviews.Title: “We will be telling all our friends to stay here”
Reviews.Author: AlisonfromAlberta
Reviews.Content: Incredibly helpful staff , but not "in your face" Room was quiet, restful decor, bathroom was spotlessly clean. Handy location for Sky Train and bus service. Lots of choices at the buffet breakfast. Can't think of staying anywhere else when we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walking to everywhere you are likely to want to go to”
Reviews.Author: SophsterBath_England
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. The staff are ultra friendly and helpful and the rooms are quiet (even those overlooking the street). Very comfortable rooms. Nice big bath, big enough for 2! Opposite a pharmacy that is open until 10pm and there is a good sports bar downstairs. We also ate at Gotham, which serves the best steak in Vancouver. Holt Renfrew is also really close. It's right next door to the Sky Train or a 2 minute walk to the other station which takes you directly to the airport. We went to Steamers in Gastown, and made the mistake of taking the Sky Train (we didn't realise how close it was). The area felt very safe at night, and we would walk to Gastown most nights without feeling uneasy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place - wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: chinchap
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Rooms were spacious, spotless and very quiet. Free use of intenet - or if you didn't have own computer . free use of the business centre downstairs. Complimentary mineral water was a nice touch. Very central location - walk to everything. Bus to Stanley Park was only 2 blocks away. Burger and soup/salad bars across the road as well as a convenience store. The hotel is next to a pub, but there was no noise from it. Room service [which is very reasonably priced] is actually supplied by the pub's kitchen and was delicious.. Breakfast in the morning was really lovely and a great way to start the day. . St Regis is excellent value for money. We also stayed at The Hyatt after our trip to Whsitler and did not enjoy it as much and it cost more!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant little place”
Reviews.Author: Bigstar14
Reviews.Content: After 10 days skiing in Whistler, we wanted to spend a couple of days in Vancouver before returning to the UK. We found the St Regis via this very site and to be fair, we weren't let down. I thought it was worth more than the price we paid: the location was pretty central; the staff were very welcoming; the room was small but was perfect for our needs (2 night stay); breakfast was great. Only complaints came from the wife: the pillows felt like they had a dead dog in them and she was a touch wary of all the drug deals outside the 7/11. However the panhandlers are harmless and we only noticed the 7/11 activity as we had to leave the hotel at 4:30 in the morning! Would happily stay here again. Great value for money and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Ikura
Reviews.Content: Plus: Just two blocks from the airport metro line stop. Tasteful decor. Full breakfast included. Nice bar with hot appetizers available. Minus: Very small room. One staff member was a little abrupt.

Reviews.Title: “All the Best”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMH
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful hospitality and well appointed Rooms! Convenient to Canada Line, Expo Line, transit, restaurants and shopping. The staff are most helpful and friendly. Rooms are modern, clean and nicely decorated. Although small in scale, this Hotel is big on Heart! Bring your appetite to the delicious breakfast. You can order eggs (any style), bacon/ham/sausage and potatoes!

Reviews.Title: “If you appreciate real and personable service, the St. Regis makes an ideal home-away-from-home in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: PrettyGreen
Reviews.Content: We chose the St. Regis for the location, great reviews, and price. The location is convenient to all forms of public transportation and comfortable walking distance to many points of interest. While our room was modest in size, the bathroom was roomy and both were very attractively furnished and decorated in a modern style. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and just one more reason to stay at the St. Regis. However, for us, the real delight was the staff we encountered in every role -- from front desk, to wait staff in the breakfast lounge, to maid service. One has the impression that employees are treated as well as guests because everyone is friendly and helpful. Craig, at the front desk, was especially helpful to us in planning our excursions and finding restaurants. In fact, he was more knowledgeable and personable than many a concierge in much larger and better known hotels where we've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BarredOwl
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights over the x-mas holidays. The room was clean and soothing with welcoming touches, only bettered by the excellent service. Every interaction with the hotel staff was helpful and positive. It seemed like every person who worked there could be the hotel manager. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “St Regis...Amazing hotel, fantastic staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: SundayGrundle
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. Definately the best hotel to stay in Downtown Vancouver. Great rooms, very spacious especially the suites. Staff are amazing especially the breakfast staff. Location is very central on the corner of Robson and Dunsmuir, 1 street parallel to Granville (main shopping street). Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a king”
Reviews.Author: cristoph2010
Reviews.Content: The moment I stepped into St. Regis I was treated like a king. Craig was there to greet me. He was extremely courteous, friendly and knowledgeable about the city. I have also noticed how he communicates with other guests at the front desk and in the restaurant. He is a true gem for St. Regis. I'm definitely going to visit Vancouver again but unfortunately I like to try different boutique hotels every time I visit somewhere. However, I really recommend St. Regis without any reservation at all. It is in a safe area and very close to the Granville and Vancouver city center stations. The other staff are also amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome in every way”
Reviews.Author: gishimoto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here December 28th and was extremely impressed with the hotel. The staff were genuinely nice and accommodating. They took my luggage up to my room while I parked my car, the complimentary breakfast was awesome (the fresh cinnamon rolls and the eggs, sausage, and ham were delicious), the location is right next to the Pacific Centre and next door to the SkyTrain (allowing you to check out Vancouver's public transportation system) and the rooms were brand new. You get free wifi if you bring a laptop or can use the computers in the lobby. For the price of the room I think the value is unbeatable. My only complaint is that parking was 25 dollars and in a garage next door to the hotel. Other than that I think this is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, would definitely stay again !”
Reviews.Author: swiattraveler
Reviews.Content: Went to Vancouver for a weekend with visiting in-laws and chose to stay at the St. Regis. The service by the staff was very good, especially Craig who was everywhere (front desk, restaurant, etc) all hours. As well as performing expected services, he was a wealth of information about the city and it's history and also providing recommendations. The room was modern with a flatscreen LCD (maybe 32"?) and clean, though it's to note that our room only had a shower, no bathtub. There was some street noise audible in our 4th floor room (moreso on Saturday night than on Friday night), nothing that woke us, but if you were up you could hear it (along with other expected city noises such as a fire engine / police car). There is an included breakfast that includes a regular continental breakfast, as well as hot food made to order (eggs, bacon, sausage, ham and potatoes). The food was good (not great), but very convenient since you didn't have to leave the hotel and it was served from 7:00 - 11:00 a.m. Parking was at the building next door underground and secure, and you had unlimited access to your vehicle if you wanted to drive around the city. The price for parking wasn't cheap (nor overly expensive for any large city), in line with what I would expect, but some people may consider it expensive. The location is very central to explore most of the city and we regularly walked to Gastown, The Lookout, and through most of the city during the day and out for dinner at night. We would stay there again without a second thought (and it was better than our previous hotel stay in Vancouver).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: mhawkins5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem. Our experience truly could not have been any better. The room was perfect and the staff was so friendly and helpful (even a handwritten welcome note). The included full breakfast was excellent. And the rates were so low! I don't know how they do it, but I hope they can keep it up because I will definitely look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is Vancouver's little secret - it has a 5 Star heart.”
Reviews.Author: Arctic_Oriented
Reviews.Content: The bed was so comfortable - the bathtub was fantastic, the lighting, the room decor was classy and modern, the hotel decor was overall pleasing to the eye. If you like beautiful interior decor - modern, classy, with an edge - this hotel fits that image. The staff were open, ready to please and offer any of their time to assist you in any way. The price was incredibly affordable. We are definitely coming back to this hotel when we're in Vancouver again. This hotel has a 5 star heart.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: shirzaw
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated just a few minutes from shopping malls (Pacific centre). My husband and I could not fault the hotel in anyway, one of the best we've stayed in -room is very clean, well decorated, modern and comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was great too!. Love this place & will definitely stay there if I visit Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to bring your car !”
Reviews.Author: LovesVancouver
Reviews.Content: After long drive from Auburn, was looking forward luxury hotel service, and yet when we finally arrived at St. Regis, couldn't find any sign where to park or what to do with our car. There was no valet service or no sign for parking. Corner of Seymour & Dunsmuir were very busy street and after driving around both corner from Seymore to Dunsmuir still couldn't find any signs. Called hotel and was told to park in front of the hotel and just turn on emergency light and there's parking structure next to hotel that we need to pick up key from front desk. I did see that alley but has sign you can't go in. It took us 15mins just go around the block to come back to front of the hotel because it was one way street. My husband was in the car with emergency light and I ran in and ask front desk for key so he can park the car. Night clerk at front desk told me, I needed to check in in order for them to give us key to park our car, meantime, my husband is in the car with emergency light, everyone behind him are honking. I demand a key first because she was having me wait to service other guest that arrived after me and was given key that end up not working, my poor husband had to wait for another customer to arrive before he can enter the parking building that is next to St. Regis. By the time she finished check me in, she has given me receipt for 3 nights when I only book for one night, good thing I had confirmation with me for 1 night, ( I HAD BOOKED DIRECTLY WITH St. Regis, didn't use any 3rd party service). It took about good 25 mins by the time we arrive to our room, when I tried to use my key to enter the room, key wasn't working and I was kept trying. Few minutes later, someone open the door !!!! OMG, she has given us wrong room. Went back to front desk and asked to give us another room because someone else was already in it. She tried to give us room next door but another clerk told her that room was just been occupied by another guest. When she gave us another room on different floor, I had asked her to make sure and she said this time she knew she won't make the same mistake. When we finally got to our 2nd room, room was exactly what I had expected, this was reason why I wanted to try St. Regis. We visit downtown Vancouver about every 2months for personal and business. I love to try new hotels price arrange from $100 to $200. And we have company Christmas Party later this month so I already booked 2 rooms for staff and just wanted to make sure my choice was good choice. So when we wanted to come to Vancouver on Thanksgiving weekend for one night, I wanted to try, just to make sure. Good thing I did, because all the bad experience, by the time we were in the room, no matter how good the room was, it didn't matter. They spoil everything for us. One very strange thing was, I found very nice hand written St. Regis card with manager's signature address to us next to guestbook, how is that possible ? So 2nd room was correct room after all. I did find two long hair on bathroom floor and had to walk in rain to return parking key. With all this, they still charge $25 for parking ! Should have stay other hotel that offers valet parking. I did complain to management via e-mail but didn't see any reply. End up cancelling reservation for Christmas party.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Islandgirl958
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. Right on the bus routes, 30 seconds from Skytrain, one minute to Pacific Centre mall and a short walk to almost anywhere you'd like to go. Room was luxurious, clean and comffortable. Bathroom was great with 2 sinks and giant counter and great shower. Only complaint was master switch overrides bathroom light. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent. Would definately stay there again. Found a good deal on the hotel website with various discounts offered.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nesburrito
Reviews.Content: This hotel was my refuge during a rather stressful family gathering. The hotel staff were in general very friendly, joking around (when appropriate) and with good knowledge of the area. The breakfast was reasonably good, too. There is an associated (private) health club which I recommend - it's a high-end club complete with classes etc. The hotel wanted to charge me more for a 'day pass' to the club than did other hotels nearby, and fortunately the staff at the health club were helpful and forthcoming about this - saving me quite a bit of money! If you're planning to use the club do be sure to ask there before shelling out for the St. Regis discount (it still is a discount, mind, but if you get a friendly staff member at the club you can do better). Overall it was a very good value, for a very comfortable, welcoming stay, in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, trendy, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DragonBeanie
Reviews.Content: Recommended by the travel agent, we stayed here for 3 nights. I loved it! Great location near the new Skytrain (LRT), shopping, waterfront and seawall. We were on one of the lower floors, so traffic was a bit loud at times, but didn't really bug us. Staff were very friendly and helpful and they let us check in 4 hours early. Small room, but very comfortable and stylish. I think the hotel was just renovated in January 2009? Loved the deep bathtub, spacious bathroom with granite countertop, bed that felt like a cloud, widescreen TV. The only annoying thing about the room was the master light switch by the door, meaning if you had to go to the washroom in the middle of the night, you'd have to turn this switch on before being able to turn the washroom lights on. Complimentary breakfast was delicious, with custom eggs, bacon/sausage, and the usual cereal, pastries, fruit, etc. This was one of my best hotel stays and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean/quiet/nice”
Reviews.Author: Christelle37 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central, next to it there are few restaurants, The receptionnists are very helpfull, The room very clean, modern and confortable, For the car park you need to pay an extra but not a lot and it is 30 seconds from the hotel, I will definitely recommand this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: osoyoostravels
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of other hotels in downtown Vancouver, and this by far is the coziest, well designed and reasonable hotel of them all. I've paid 3x the price for a room in other Vancouver hotels and got a fraction of what you get at St. Regis Vancouver. A great complimentary breakfast, a wonderful bed, very clean and cozy room, and a fantastic bathroom with heated marble floors! This hotel is stupendous in Vancouver. The staff are great and super friendly. I won't stay anywhere else but here in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “everything you want”
Reviews.Author: trennyManchester Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in an excellent position for the city shopping and short walk fro the waterfront. The hotel was newly renovated rooms were luxurious very comfortable beds, flat screen tv and a good size. the bathroom was very clean and had underfloor heating so nice and warm, excellent shower. The breakfast included in price was very good with cooked breakfast. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The price was very good, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: TravelbuddyEngland Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel with everything. Centrally located, one block from the Canada Line underground giving direct access to the airport in 22 minutes. The room was spotlessly clean and beautifully presented, the staff extreamly helpful, and breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, Great location”
Reviews.Author: JairEhrhardt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip for 2 nights. The room on the 5th floor looked very new and was very comfortable. The wireless internet (complimentary) worked great and I also appreciated the complementary bottles of water in the room. The typical north-American breakfast was good with a choice of eggs etc. It's located right around the corner of Granville street and many restaurants, bars etc. In conclusion a great hotel with a good eye for detail.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel - A real gem in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MoeGreen
Reviews.Content: I have traveled and stayed in some of the top properties and was this hotel was up there with the best. It had been recently remodeled (probably for the 2010 Olympics) so it was spotless with a lot of great amenities. The design was great and had a very boutique feel without being too trendy. Great bathroom with great tub, marble, spread faucets, you get the idea. Staff was great and the cooked to order breakfast included with my rate was fantastic. As far as location, it is very central (meaning a block or two) to the great downtown shopping & restaurants (I highly recommend Chambar fro dinner). The sky train is literally next door to the hotel and I also used their parking facility with 24/7 access which was great albeit a little expensive. I would not even consider staying at another hotel in Vancouver based on this stay.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect home away from home for a first time traveller!”
Reviews.Author: Snowbunny0910
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped into the St Regis I felt welcomed and happy. The team at this hotel are brilliant, helpful, polite.. they meet every expectation you could have and then they'll suprise you by getting the elevator for you when your hands are full saving you from digging around for your keycard! For my first three days living in a new country this hotel made my time an absolute joy. The rooms speak for themselves - the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! The complimentry water was a godsend after a long day walking around Vancouver and the breakfast was awesome! The only thing more that I wanted was a fridge but honestly if you're only staying a few nights you can deal without one... and the free wifi and heated tiles make up for anything you feel is missing. Also, the location is great - one block away from city central, next door to the Granville station, you can walk to the Canucks home stadium in one direction or you can go the other and walk to Stanley Park.. perfect hotel, perfect location, perfect staff! I loved this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: CoachAlberta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St. Regis for 5 days and was able to experience the consistency of excellent and friendly service over time with a variety of staff. The rooms are newly decorated with clean lines and restful colours. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. A great breakfast was offered daily as part of the room price. Free internet as well. The location is great - within walking distance of the Canada line to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “By far, the very best!”
Reviews.Author: Tegster
Reviews.Content: I don't have to repeat what everyone else has said, it's all true! I will add that the guest missing the "ipod dock", it was there all the time. If you don't have the audio cord the front desk will loan you one, and it plays thru the TV, using the input button on the side of the TV, which yes would have been easier to figure out if it had been in the room brochure binder. Ours was a fast graduation trip, and we needed to check in early to get ready. No problem. Then, I wasn't flying until late the next night, so they held our luggage for us, let us into it a couple of times (to change out coats/shopping) and nicely sent us on our way with a "come back soon". With a daughter in school in Vancouver, I have been there 5- 6 times in the past year. Always staying at a different hotel. The deco, the service, the umbrella's (which was a huge bonus because everyone seemed to be sold out close by) the breakfast, everything was amazing. By far ... the VERY BEST. Congrats to the staff and mgmt of the St. Regis in Vancouver for running a Great Establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Love at First Sight”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyNPrinceTravels
Reviews.Content: Reflecting on a conversation I had with friends about whether one believes in love at first sight or not, this hotel was love at first sight for me. After a LONG flight from the East Coast and a 25-30 minute cab ride, my sister and I arrived at the St. Regis around 2am. IVAN (graveyard shift) checked us in promptly and professionally, and made us feel very welcome. We had room 105 at first, which I felt was not suitable since we needed two beds. Booked through a third party, so the preference was not conveyed properly. Not the hotel's fault, and after a quick phone call downstairs Ivan was waiting and ready to take us to room 112, which was satisfactory and our HAFH for 5 exciting days and 5 amazing nights. Vancouver is a super cool city, and the people made it even better. Those Canadians really are nice, Eh? The room was spacious with two double beds, one flat screen TV with decent amount of US programming, relatively large marble bathroom with double sinks (major extra points here) and medium sized walk in shower. Electronic safe was easy to use, and AC worked well. The only thing I really craved was an iPod dock to play music whilst getting ready or lounging. Breakfast ends around 10am so we were down there around 9am every morning. I never saw the waitstaff turn anyone away if they came right at ten, so maybe on weekends they extend the time until a little later. The waitress is nice but didn't catch her name, and CRAIG is the other waiter who also works at the front desk. Whatever your question, Craig is the guy to ask. Very knowledgeable and detailed in his instructions. I was able to have my choice of coffee, OJ, small bowl of cereal, toast, muffin, cooked eggs, bacon and potatoes. They have more options, just ask and they will most likely have it. We didn't have anything planned, and was going to wing it this trip so we went to the front desk to ask for directions to Robson Street. BENJAMIN (morning shift) pointed us in the right direction, as he did every morning thereafter. Just like the staff before him, he was courteous and helpful. Benji and Juan helped me find a Vietnamese restaurant for lunch one day, and it didn't matter that it took 15 minutes but the fact that they kept patiently searching is something a world traveller like me totally appreciates. Thanks guys! Robson street is lively, with tons of stores, restaurants and cafes. We came here everyday, which is totally unnecessary but we just loved hanging out with zero direction. Very fun at night, too. We took a cab to Yaletown Brewery for lunch, and it was a comfortable, darkly lit space with a view into their brewing room. Food was tasty, and the Wheat Ale was refreshing. You can walk, just mind that it's about 15 minutes. Dinner at Glowbal was a tad too noisy and food too salty for a future return trip. The next morning my friend came to stay with us, which made her the third person in the room. Still pretty comfortable with 3, but may opt for a suite or connecting rooms next time. We also had a sushi dinner at Blue Water Cafe one night and it was pretty good, but not the best I've had. There's a mall right around the corner with a Sephora, in case you forgot anything you can pretty much find it in there. I brought an umbrella since it was going to rain nearly everyday, but the front desk has some available for your use. Two computers in the side room and a mini library with books. Low key pub next door with a friendly Russian bartender and reasonably priced drinks. They had drink specials everyday for around 5 bucks. Also showed the Machida UFC fight on Saturday night, fyi for my fellow fight fans. ADRIAN (afternoon shift) helped secure reservations at Cin Cin. I can't even tell you how great the customer service is at this hotel! You could be wandering aimlessly by the front with a blank look on your face and someone will inquire if you needed anything, without being intrusive. Gym passes to nearby Steve Nash Sports Club are 15 bucks a day. This is the first time I did not go to the gym, so I cannot tell you more than that it seemed top notch from pictures I saw online. Ate at Cin Cin the last night, and while service was lukewarm and even borderline unacceptable, food was good to great depending on what you ordered. Wine was excellent, never even heard of Okanagan wine which was surprisingly nice. We frequented the Loose Moose (divey but fun bar) two times, liked the unpretentious and lively atmosphere. Two tiny nitpicks, one the cleaning...the woman is very sweet, the level of cleanliness is high, but maybe they need to hire one extra maid? Our rooms were always cleaned last or next to last around 3-4pm, which was slightly annoying. Also, one of the girls at the front desk was indifferent, so maybe at another hotel it would have been standard but at the Regis it definitely stood out. There's one elevator which could be slow at times, but there is a stairwell and hotel is only five stories high. Exchange place one block away that had good rates. Craig can tell you where it is. Noise level was low, never even unpacked the earplugs! Location was convenient, we either walked or took a taxi everywhere. As many other people already mentioned, the train station is 1 block away. Juan checked us out on the last day, and there weren't any sketchy charges or anything so we were off with smiles. Overall, I loved this place, you will probably love it too, and we'll be back in January '10!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: VWebb
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms here and was pleased with them both. The queen room was a bit snug but was beautifully furnished, great bathrooms and the windows allowed for a great street view without the street noise. The two-doubles room was quite large and the bathroom was spectacular - though not a great view. The free breakfast is above average and the staff was very, very helpful. The location is very central but the parking situation is a bit crazy. Basically you have to double park on the street, unload your bags and then have a staff person direct you around back to the parking garage - there is no valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travlingal51
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good about this hotel. We were in town to take a cruise and the hotel is located within walking distance to the cruise terminal. Everyone we encountered at The St Regis was way beyond helpful and friendly. Craig, who greeted us when we arrived and we also saw at breakfast the next morning was especially friendly and helpful. He was very knowledgeable about the area and could tell you off the top of his head which bus to take to get wherever you wanted to go. He knew all about the area and the "must sees", since we had a short time in the city. This is a charming small hotel, more like an Inn really. We have a very large bathroom that had a walk in shower with a built-in bench. There was also a lighted, magnified mirror in the bathroom that I really appreciated. There were 2 bottles of water in the room that were complimentary. Usually with a hotel of this caliber, they charge big fees for every little thing, but not here. The wi-fi was free and there was also a cooked to order breakfast included. The location was also with a few blocks of the Canada Line station that you can take right from the airport. It cost $2.50 instead of a high cab fare. I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb choice”
Reviews.Author: gordon140
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel and I agree with all who previously provided rave reviews. I will only try to add some information. I usually stick to public transportation in a city as large as Vancouver, but we needed our rental car quite often. This hotel's parking garage is next to the hotel and access was quite easy and at at reasonable daily charge (unlimited in and out privileges). The quality and selection of the included Full Breakfast was excellent. Many hotels have nice rooms, but were not quite designed for people living out of suit cases. Our room was exceptionally well designed for ease of use by the traveling customer. If you want a room with a bath tub, it might be difficult to obtain at this hotel. In room internet is provided at no extra charge. The log on id was 12 characters and the password was 13 characters. If your computer goes into standby mode, you have to do the log in process again. I think that there was a lot more finger exercise than is needed.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: steve_dani_H
Reviews.Content: We had to sign on to tripadvisor to let everyone know this is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. We were continuously blown away by every aspect, the friendliness, cleanliness (I can't get over how thorough the cleaning staff were), and great facilities. This was the best hotel experience we have ever had. The staff continuously went above and beyond, no request was too much, and we could never stump them with our questions. Their restaurant and tourist recommendations and knowledge were spot on. The room was wonderful, comfy bed, great shower and all the extras you need when travelling (such as really dark curtains and no outside sound). The included breakfast was always fresh and tasty. Thank you St Regis for making our Vancouver experience so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Serene elegance; reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: constanttraveller50
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at the St. Regis based on the glowing reviews here and were delighted that we did. From the friendly greeting at the front door, to the elegant and understated decor of the room, to the luxury of the bathroom, the hotel had the quality of a place twice the price. Only downside was the street noise outside when the bars closed.

Reviews.Title: “MASSAGE AT THE ST. REGIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: JBVAN
Reviews.Content: It was my privilege to be the second guest to make use of the new massage services within the St. Regis Hotel in Vancouver, BC. Upon the completion of my massage, the hotel manager was anxiously awaiting my feedback. I could only say "fantastic" as I was far too relaxed for more words! The music was not to my taste, however, Mr. Roncoroni assured me that was being dealt with and he even suggested they would set up the system whereby each guest could bring in their own IPod or MP3 player. Their therapist, Mishal, was exceptional and I felt like a new person when I left the room! The fact that this service is also available to non hotel guests is fantastic And, at $60.00 per hour ....unbelievable!!! What a wonderful hotel, a great location and delightfully helpful staff! Thank you, St. Regis!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: joebeans
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff made our stay absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “What all hotels should aspire to be”
Reviews.Author: sunfun72
Reviews.Content: I don't think I can say anything different than what has already been said here - this is a great hotel. When I called to make the reservation, they asked if we were coming for any special occasion, and I mentioned that we were celebrating our first wedding anniversary. When we got to our room, there was a little box of chocolates and a hand written note from the manager welcoming us and wishing us a happy anniversary. Not a big thing, but it's the little touches that sets this hotel apart. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, welcoming and more than helpful. The rooms are well appointed, clean and tastefully decorated. There is nothing I can think of to fault this hotel on. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “All the 5 reviews are true, excellent stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DandDTravel
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis is ideally situated for sight seeing in Vancouver, business in the center city, great access to Sky Train and bus transit and easy access to Stanley Park and the waterfront district. The hotel is very nicely renovated and appointed with clean lines and many tasteful touches. The rooms have a modern European feel, small but spacious enough, good closet space and very nice bathroom/shower. Free internet access, a lobby media room and fantastic full breakfast in the downstairs dining area. The St. Regis pub is popular with locals and toursists alike (VERY popular on hockey nights). The thing that really sets the St. Regis apart is the staff - young, friendly and above all helpful. They know Vancouver, and are able to assist and recommend to the travelers' taste. Next time we're in Vancouver, we will be back to St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could give it more than 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: VI_JB_51
Reviews.Content: This fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of downtown Vancouver deserves all the great reviews it has been receiving. The service is fantastic, the rooms are modern and have everything you could want and the location can't be beat - within easy walking distance to the convention centre, right next door to a Skytrain station and the Pacific Centre shopping area. And if you are in town for a hockey game or concert, the hotel is just a couple of blocks away. The St. Regis was built in 1913 as a hotel and after it's recent 11 million dollar renovation, it doesn't disappoint. Expect free internet, chocolates on the pillow and bottled water on your night table. You will also find premium ammenities in the bathroom with a giant bathtub, magnifying makeup mirror, hairdryer, ironing board and iron, inroom safe and more. Wow! The hotel features a wine & liquor store, fine dining restaurant (steakhouse Gothams) and bar & grill with big screen TV's throughout and very reasonably priced food. Secure underground parking is shared with the condo next door and costs about $20 per day. But the best is yet to come. Included in your room rate is a made to order breakfast with juice, coffee, toast, muffins, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit salad AND eggs with bacon/sausage/ham and potatoes. This is without a doubt the best deal in town and we have already made reservations for our next two trips to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A Must For any Traveler!”
Reviews.Author: pciriddle
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, staff, and food. The staff is friendly, courteous and well versed in the vast aray of options in the area. The adjoining St. Regis Grill has wonderful food and friendly staff. The hotel is immaculate and is beautifully decorated. The central location is an easy walk to downtown attractions. A must stay for any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “The Service and Venue are Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: BoulderTravelguy27
Reviews.Content: I travel around the world and have rarely come across such wonderful service. We changed our dates several times for business purpose and Jeremy, the GM, was always very accommodating and helpful in making our date work. Jerry, the Chef, made every effort to make sure we were taken care of with everything. the front desk staff was very helpful. To top it off the Venue and Hotel were beautiful and clean.

Reviews.Title: “as friendly as a small town B&B”
Reviews.Author: GoodEaterstoo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from reviews from this site, and were really pleased. The staff was really friendly and it was fun to see how they had bonded with all the guests, especially Craig. Breakfast super abundant. We loved our cozy bed and big screen for lazing into some good movie-watching and enjoyed being able to walk around from here. We'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and convenitent location”
Reviews.Author: PWood87059
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for three days at the end of an Alaska cruise. The St. Regis is a clean, cozy hotel. The free internet service was invaluable when I needed to tweak my return airline and pick up service plans. The fee breakfast was fantastic!!! The staff were friendly and helpful throughout our staff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no problems”
Reviews.Author: digitl
Reviews.Content: An amazingly good hotel! Well placed in Vancouver for the cruise terminal, restaurants and city transport. Our room was modern, clean and extremely well appointed with a beautiful bathroom. Breakfast was more than adequate with the continental style supplemented by bacon and eggs freshly cooked to each individual's requirements. The staff were, without exception, some of the most helpful and accommodating my wife and I have come across in any of the many hotels we have stayed in. Nothing was too much trouble for them. I wouldn't hesitate to book the St Regis again, nor to recommend it to anyone thinking of staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in a long journey!”
Reviews.Author: ShamrockGuy
Reviews.Content: We can reccomend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in downtown Vancouver. The rooms in an old building have been superbly refurbished in a chic style. The staff was remarkable - helpful, polite, ingratiating, etc. The bathroom was out of a 5-star resort. Do yourself a favor - - - stay here. We will on our next trip to this wondrous city. One small downside - - - parking is expensive and you can get cheaper garaging nearby, if you don't mind exploring a bit.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: curlymassachusetts
Reviews.Content: My husband And I stayed 3 nights following an Alaska cruise. What a great place! Newly renovated room. Wonderful bathroom. Loved the granite shower with a seat. Delicious breakfast was included. Outstanding and extremely helpful staff. They made you feel at home. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: OhioTraveler251
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the St. Regis the night before our cruise. It was everything I expected and more. We were upgraded to a Junior King suite which was lovely. The staff was very helpful with dinner suggestions and reservations. Breakfast was very good (and was included in the price of the room). The most impressive part of our stay was this: After we were on our ship waiting to sail, I realized I had left my Ipod in the room. When I called to ask if it was there, Adrian offered to bring to to the ship when he got off of work. How nice is that! As it turned out, we were able to leave the ship and run the three or so blocks back to the hotel ... and we did not miss our sailaway from Vancouver! I would absolutely return to the St. Regis for another stay and have recommended this wondeful hotel to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: SydneyPhiljane
Reviews.Content: Despite a lot of construction work in neighbouring streets this hotel was great. Nice and central, with a resonable breakfast included and with a bank of 2 free internet computers which was handy. No fridge in room and no bath but very comfortable. Staff were great and we stayed on level 5 and paid $698 CAD for a Wed, Thurs, Fri stay. When you go to Stanley park you must go to the resteraunt next to the Lawn bowls called Fish something. We dropped off our luggage before we got rid of our hire car. No car required if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised; Beds were super comfortable”
Reviews.Author: novicevacationer7
Reviews.Content: Wow.. traveling with a few pairs of friends, I was a little afraid to suggest this boutique hotel (we typically stay at the big chains like Marriott, Hilton, etc). But the reviews were good, it was ranked #2 on TripAdvisor, and we found some pretty good deals on Expedia and Hotels.com (compared to the other boutique hotel we were looking at). All I can say is we were all really happy with the suggestion I made. The outside of the hotel looked a little scary to me (others might consider it "historic"), the inside of the lobby is small but clean (typical for boutique hotels) but the rooms are fantastic. Super comfortable beds, plenty of space, large sink areas, great shower space, a heated floor in the bathroom! Nice big flat screen TV, chocolates on the bed, complimentary water bottles, complimentary internet access and complimentary breakfast (made-to-order eggs, etc). Seriously, what more can you ask for? Maybe friendly staff? You got it! The front desk was kind enough to give us a bunch of money-saving tips (shop at London drugs vs. the other stores, etc) and were super friendly. Location is great.. next to Pacific Center mall with lots of convenient shopping (from lower-end to higher-end stores). The only downside.. the whole area doesn't have that many nice restaurants. Lots of pizza by the slice locations, but only a few restaurants for us to enjoy within a 1-2 block radius. If you don't mind a 10-15 min walk though, there are a few good places a little farther out.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: GirlTraveler70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St. Regis after a cruise. From the first moment I stepped into the lobby, I was amazed at how NICE everyone was. The room was not ready until after lunch so the hotel stored my luggage until such time. The front desk provided PERFECT directions to the sea bus station and which bus to take to get to the Capilano Suspension Bridge. Later someone else gave directions and the bus number to get to Granville Island and then how to locate the train station to the airport. Breakfast the next morning was complimentary and not what I expected. I wrongly assumed it was a continental breakfast; however, the kitchen was open with cooked to order eggs, bacon, potatoes. Homemade muffins! I could see the chef making the muffins from my vantage point. The hotel was also very quiet and had a nice shower. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, I didn't know service like this still existed!”
Reviews.Author: despradley
Reviews.Content: I don't usually do this sort of thing, but the experience of visiting Vancouver and staying at the St. Regis this weekend has impressed me so much, I can't imagine not acknowledging the service and hospitality shown by the staff. All of the staff we came in contact with were extremely polite and service driven. I was born and raised in south Georgia, so hospitality is part of my roots, however, I know that the service one receives in today's society is considerably diminished in general. I am proud to advise you that hospitality is alive and well at St. Regis. As often the case, there is always one individual that stands out in the crowd, and the St. Regis has one such employee. Mr. Craig Lundgrea has to be the most courteous, polite, giving, and personable person I have encountered in my 30 years of travel. I'm not sure what Craig's job description or title is, but he seems to be everywhere and does everything, and he seems to be here ALL THE TIME! He has made us feel as if we are the only patrons here. Of course, I am sure all the other guests would say the same. His friendly and outgoing personality draws you in and he does everything in his power to make your stay a pleasant and memorable experience. "It's not my job" will never cross his lips, he personally handles any and every request. Thank you for an extremely memorable stay, and thank you for having top shelf associates such as Craig. For any reading this review and making plans to visit Vancouver, do yourself a favor and make reservations at St. Regis, you won't regret it! P.S. Tell Craig we said "hello".

Reviews.Title: “A clean, comfortable and friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: bighat83
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel we were welcomed by friendly staff and shown to our room which was large and comfortable. The hotel had recently been refurbished to a high standard and is in a very central location in downtown Vancouver making for easy access to many attractions. Breakfasts, which were included, were excellent and could set you up for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RetiredDallas
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in the heart of downtown. 3 blocks to ship terminal/Seabus. 4 blocks to Gastown. 1 block to Skytrain (ride to airport for $3.75 in 24 min.) Very nice room with soft, comfortable bed. Large, well equipped bathroom. Adjoining restaurants, pub & Starbucks were all very good. Included cooked-to-order breakfast was very good as was the buffet. The staff made you feel like family. Kudos to Craig, Breanne and Benjamin for their help. Sightseeing busses picked us up around the corner. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MythosPathos
Reviews.Content: We only stayed a night. Our room was very clean and tidy. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Almost the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: echambliss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the St. Regis for 5 days as part of our first trip to Vancouver. All in all, the experience was excellent. Upsides: The room itself (including the bathroom) was clean, spacious and modern. The staff were incredibly helpful, very capable of providing directions sights and recommendations. One member of the staff even dug into his own pockets to help us make change for bus fare. Other great perks were the location (just one block from the metro), free local phone calls (amazing in this day and age), and free wifi. Downsides: The breakfast which was just o.k., mainly because some of the wait staff are not good communicators. (Example, my wife asked for TWO fried eggs, "over-easy." The waitress asked what that was and we (assuming that perhaps fried egg terminology was different in Canada than the US) explained that it means to flip the fried egg over halfway through cooking so both sides of the white are cooked and the yolk is cooked slightly. Her response, "oh, that's called a fried egg." She returned a few minutes later with one fried egg, over hard. Go team!) Breakfasts aside, the stay was just about perfect. The only other thing that could have been improved is that the low-flow showerhead was very weak -- the kind that requires you to rise off one inch of your body at a time. Overall: But in the grand scheme of things, the St. Regis is one of the best hotels of this class that we've ever stayed in. Would definitely go back and would definitely recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: NYRivergal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Regis for 3 nights on our first trip to Vancouver. We selected the St. Regis for it's proximity to the docks as we were boarding a cruise to Alaska on the fourth day. Our rooms were immaculate each day. The room and bath were modern and luxurious. The hotel itself was charming keeping the old style look with modern upgrades. The full breakfast (included) every morning was cooked individually and delicious. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating. The central location made walking to restaurants and attractions quick and easy. Our stay there made our visit to Vancouver memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Warrentobe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and loved it. I think we had a queen deluxe - it was gorgeous and totally spotless. The decor was soopa modern, an immaculate bathroom and yes - we just loved it. I didn’t love the breakfast, there could have been more choice of fruits and juices but it was complimentary but my partner loved it as he had a fry up every morning. The staff were beyond friendly and really helpful. Two large flat screen tvs - one in living room, one in bedroom - didn't wach but nice to have! Also had complimentary internet. I’ve uploaded some photos we took so you can see how nice it is for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: ramatavivit
Reviews.Content: The best location you can get, kind and polite staff, comfortable , sparkling clean We will be back! Highly recommend ! Michal Yedidia, Tel-Aviv

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated, continental, delightful!”
Reviews.Author: jake17
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the end of our vacation, not knowing Vancouver, but trusting in what others had said about this hotel - and were we ever glad!! It was just perfect! The location is fabulous - easy to find - close to everything and the parking garage next door is convenient and reasonably priced. We walked to Stanley Park and took a bus back . The hotel has been renovated recently - everything is brand new and it has a very high tech, hip feel. We thought it felt very European. Our room was small, but certainly met our needs; we loved the flat screen t.v. and there's free computer hook-up in the room and all local phone calls are also free. The bathroom was great with a very, very deep soaking tub and a rain shower style shower head. This is really a terrific hotel; the price was excellent and to top it off, a full breakfast is included. Oh - and the staff were all great - warm, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It is all about You!”
Reviews.Author: DRBTexas
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the front door of the St. Regis Hotel, we felt at home. Breanne and Craig greeted us with a friendly and warm smile that let us know their focus was on their guests hence it is all about you. The guest rooms are well-appointed, comfortable, and recently remodeled. They serve as a perfect spot to recharge for your visit in the high energy and fun of Vancouver. Each morning you are greeted in the lower level dining room with many nutritious breakfast treats and a cooked to order breakfast (included in the room rate). The lobby business center is spacious and completely equipped as your office on the go. You also have free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. If you want a great value for your dollar , a perfect downtown hotel location, and a staff that is second to none, then the St. Regis Hotel is the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel good location super breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Clttravelor
Reviews.Content: Nicely updated hotel. Good city location a bit hard to drop off your luggage but that is the only thing you could find wrong with this hotel. You order a complete breakfast that is very good. They have a business center and parking available next door for $ 24.00/day. They are very helpful and have done a super job updating the hotel,very trendy.

Reviews.Title: “They go above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: nadaworry
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night but would not hesitate to stay longer. It was great value and the employees are extremely personable going above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. The rooms were very well appointed and updated. The beds were the most comfortable of any place we have stayed. It is within walking distance of Gastown and a short taxi ride to the Cruise terminal. We were on the 4th floor at the back and our friends were on the 1st at the front. They did say it was a little noisy there with traffic but we didn't hear a thing from our room. Give them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Charm!”
Reviews.Author: blackbox1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a unique hotel in the heart of the city the St.Regis is a pleasent suprise. Being a newly renovated heratige building there is a fantastic mix of the old turn of the century charm with a very modern update. Must have been a challenging project but the results are definettally worth it.. Yes there is the quirks of an old building (i.e. small single elevator) but the combination of a helpful staff ,building design and location all add up to a hotel I would confidentally recommend . NOTE: Remember it is RIGHT DOWN TOWN so expect traffic and all that goes with it .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic end to a cruise”
Reviews.Author: FengshuiSanDiego
Reviews.Content: After our cruise to Alaska we stopped off in Vancouver for a few days. This hotel was a great find. it has been renovated and beautifully decorated. The location is close to all. There is internet access in the lobby and very elegant. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: OlgaandJan
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, although the room was a little small, but location makes it good. Very close to all the shops, nice areas etc. We parked our rental car in the parking lot on the street next to the hotel. Window was smashed, but we had nothing in the car left. Staff of the hotel helped us to get in touch with Avis, who were just three blocks away. Breakfast was very good in the basement of the bar of the hotel Staff very nice, so we advise to stay in this nice clean hotel with modern well equiped bathroom. My wife really enjoyed the shower whcih you can take of the hook. This happens not often in hotels in North America.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Nice”
Reviews.Author: MissBinks
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is well located and the staff very helpful although there seemed to be very few of them with a lot of multi-tasking which led to a very slow check in and the poor harassed guy working solo on the desk committing the cardinal sin of taking a phone call whilst a queue grew longer and longer. He needed help! The room (just a queen bed room) was pretty small but nicely decorated and spotlessly clean. The street noise was very bad indeed and we had stayed just around the corner at The Metropolitan at the start of our stay so know that even downtown hotels can deal with the inevitable street sound. We slept very badly due to sirens, revellers and general traffic noise. The breakfast was quite good with a range of things to choose from the buffet and a cooked choice as well although again, understaffing caused delays and a sense of servers being really hard pressed and struggling. I guess that one of the key reasons that this hotel is number one on this site is because it is quite cheap, has a good range of in-room facilities and includes breakfast but I wouldn't want to go again just because it was so noisy. The staff was young and helpful and the room was very clean but overall not a particularly memorable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tonialax
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel from July 30-31st and we really enjoyed it. The room was beautiful and it was great being able to control the temperature (with a thermostat) ourselves. The staff was very friendly and helpful which always makes a hotel stay better. We ate at the hotel restaurant (St.Regis Bar) both nights and the food was excellent. We had four different entrees between the two nights and we loved them all. The restaurant has almost the same exact menu as room service so you can basically see the menu before you go there. The prices in the restaurant are a couple of dollars cheaper than room service, and don't come with an $8.00 delivery charge, so you are better of going there. Breakfast was also very good. The cooked potatoes were very salty in my opinion, but they were still delicious. Having the free internet in the lobby was extremely helpful considering we had a rental car but no directions to where we wanted to go. In the informational book inside the room it says that you can print from the computer for a small fee, but I was not charged anything. Or, if you have a laptop you can connect it to the wall in your room and view your computer screen (and DVDs) on the large flat screen tv in the room which I thought was really neat! There were only two things we didn't like, but they were minor and not enough to change my opinion of the hotel. First, we had a room facing the street and it was quite busy and noisy. I did not mind the noise at night and lost no sleep because of it, but my husband did not sleep very well. He heard every bar fight and ambulance that went by (which seems to happen more often than you would think). Also, the first time parking can be quite stressful since the parking garage is in the tiny back alley behind the hotel. If you just remember that even though the hotel is on the busy 3 lane one-way street, there is 3 minute parking available directly in front of the hotel doors on Dunsmuir St. From there the staff can help you get out your bags and show you to the garage. We initially passed up the hotel and got caught in a series of one way streets where you couldn't make left hand turns, and ran into a closed Granville street, all of which threw us way off course. When you have hundreds of people walking around, and cars being rerouted due to construction, it can get very crazy very quickly!! On the plus side, the parking garage is very nice, clean, and safe since you need a magnetic card to get through any door or even operate the elevator. I would gladly stay here again now that I know to get a room facing the alley and how to park!!

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: ScotsWanderer101
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel with excellent staff and food. The room was spacious and well lit with the hotel being in a fantastic location. We decided to get room service on a couple of nights and the food was delicious and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: IL0veAmerica
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of July when Vancouver were experiencing their hottest summer since 1965! Staff were exceptionally helpful and the room we had on the 5th floor was spotlessly clean with a safe (rare in other hotels), water and a chocolate left on our bed every night. The bathroom was fantastic, walk in shower and huge. The only disappointment was the view - air conditioning units and the back other buildings. But no matter, we were hardly there. We had breakfast every morning in the basement room, there was plenty to choose on the buffet with bacon and eggs cooked to order if you wanted them. Stanley Park was fabulous, and we went to Grouse Mountain and the Capilano Suspension Bridge as well as the trolley tour. Try the Cactus Club and Earls for dinner. The only thing about the city we didn't like was the construction work going on everywhere (not sure if its for the Olympics or not), some pavements were very rough and rocky and there were various pedestrian detours. We loved hiring bikes round Stanley Park and the general ambiance of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: designYUL
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way to Asia but wished we could have stayed longer. What a pleasant surprise this small hotel was! Great location and beautifully renovated. While our room was rather small, it had a super-comfortable bed and a lovely bathroom. The entire hotel displayed a marked attention to design even in the smallest details. With free internet, bottled water and breakfast, it was indeed a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: worldrunner
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St. Regis for 2 nights in late July. The location is downtown, which is a little crazy with preparations for the upcoming Olympics, but it's also very convenient. The rooms are a bit small by some standards but they are efficiently arranged and wonderfully decorated. The staff couldn't be better from front desk to bellmen. The breakfast includes eggs and bacon cooked to order plus cereals, fruit, muffins, toast, etc. Parking is in the building next door and is expensive at $25/day but , overall, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Travelman-Tx
Reviews.Content: The St Regis is a great hotel with a super staff at the front desk ! Rooms are designy, spacious, with huge superluxe bathroom. Front desk gave us twice a good advise on where to have dinner. Safe parking at 18$/day just around the corner. So, a really great place with beautifull rooms, friendly and professional staff on a great location. One big problem however : breakfast is complimentary, but served in the lower lobby ( a cellar with no windows), a place with dark brown furniture on a non matching dark brown floor, with old "stuff" visible in one corner of the room, a friendly but not professional waiter and waittress, a really poor buffet and with only bacon and eggs on the à la carte menu. (We got the eggs twice not served as we asked them.) Maybe this is the reason why it is complimentary ??? Anyway, I think they should work on this because it is really not upto the level of the hotel, and it would be a shame if they lost clients because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell anyone!!”
Reviews.Author: topgran
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best for location, courteousness of staff, breakfast and the ambience of the rooms. We stayed 4 nights then after a trip to the Rockies, a further 4 night and it was like coming home. The beds were so comfortable and both rooms we had were exceptional. I would like to mention everyone of the staff but I would miss someone out and would not wish to do so. Absolutely recommended to my friends and they would be stupid not to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Elegence in a Modern Souless City of Glass Condos”
Reviews.Author: ManOfC0nstantS0rr0w
Reviews.Content: They have been through an obvious well thought out expensive renovation that was done with taste. The Suite was very nice-well appointed-big bath- Very minor downside of curious light switch system and small elevator. The Staff makes it number one. Ultra friendly whether it be the old guys in the morning or the fresh neat youngsters in the evening- all just a delight. They literally went out of the way to help. Bar has a good Mojito- did not eat lunch or dinner nor room service there so no comment to make-two high class steak houses on each side of hotel block. Various hot spots are easy walk of a few blocks in any direction for whatever you desire. Breakfast was hot buffett with cooked eggs and bacon to order with the help of a plucky Irish lass who was on the staff. The Staff, the Staff the Staff- They were the best-Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the right person”
Reviews.Author: MDfamily1
Reviews.Content: This is a newly refurbished boutique hotel. It is very clean and sleek, but the rooms are tiny (although the bathrooms are large...which is a little odd). The breakfast is also pretty decent (served on the lower level with cold food available as well as eggs etc. made to order). My main gripe: not a good choice for families with small kids. Parking is ONLY available next door at a cost of $25 extra per day (which in my opinion, given the room size, makes this hotel a pretty overpriced choice) - so struggling in with one's kids an luggage is quite a hassle. Second gripe - not that convenient to anything we visited (Stanley park etc.) - or maybe it was close but the traffic was bad. Anyway, if you're a couple looking for a sleek contemporary hotel in the middle of downtown - go for it. If you're a family with kids and are trying to avoid overspending - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I only wish I could stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: joobie819
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this moderately priced hotel, situated withing a few blocks of the waterfront. Unfortunately we did not get enough time to enjoy all the amenities but the time spend was impressive. The room we booked at the last minute was small but elegantly decorated. Very comfy beds and modern facilities for internet connectivity and entertainment. The sheets, towels, and draperies all seemed top notch. After a great evening and peaceful night, we checked out early to get to our flight. They summoned a cab, which arrived within minutes and we were on our way.... All was well, or so we thought. About two blocks from the hotel a man came running up beside the cab yelling to stop and waving our brand new, expensive, Nikon camera!!! I recognized him as being from the front desk. I think we left the camera in the room which means that someone from housekeeping had to have found it, quickly realized the problem and rushed it down to catch us. What a great impression that made to top off the already good feeling I had about St. REgis and Vancouver.....

Reviews.Title: “Sightseeing from England and break from the grandchildren!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeapoppet
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location - perfect for exploring Vancouver. It is right in the middle of down town, although it was remarkably quiet. The accomodation was excellent, the hotel is smart, recently updated. The rooms were modern and stylish in design and the bed was very, very comfortable. We had a most friendly and efficient welcome and the staff continued to be very helpful throughout our stay. The only thing we would change is the whipped butter with breakfast which we didn't like, but perhaps that's a cultural taste thing! We would certainly recommend it and would return.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a very reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: snibor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had the pleasure of staying at the St Regis Hotel in downtown Vancouver. We spent two nights there, from June 17 through June 18 and can’t say enough about how impressed we were. We had spent a night at the Fairmont Waterfront Hotel a couple of weeks earlier and although their rate was triple the rate at St Regis, we actually enjoyed our stay at the St Regis much more. Not only were the actual accommodations excellent, but the amenities and the service were superb. The complimentary made-to-order breakfasts with freshly made pastries were fantastic as were the friendly staff in the kitchen. But what really made the stay memorable was the outstanding treatment received from the hotel staff. The time and personal attention they each provided deserve special recognition. They each went above and beyond all expectations in providing helpful information and then following up with making all necessary arrangements for sightseeing to make our stay in Vancouver such a terrific experience. The personal attention they each gave us made the hustle and bustle of a concierge at the Fairmont pale in comparison. The hotel is conveniently located in downtown and is easy walking distance to restaurants, nightlife, and the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding breakfast”
Reviews.Author: elka54
Reviews.Content: In a very expensive city, it was a real plus to have such an outstanding breakfast included in the price of the hotel room. The rooms were were very classy and comfortable. I loved the large glass enclosed showers. The location was excellent allowing us to walk all around the downtown area. We even walked to Stanley Park where we rented bikes to ride around the sea wall walk. The staff was very friendly and helpful and when we mentioned we were off to visit the Capilano Suspension Bridge, they gave us discount coupons and arranged for a free shuttle to pick us up. We had never stayed at any St. Regis Hotels, but we will now.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Vancouver!! What a find.”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethSanDiego
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel!!!! It is very newly renovated, a small boutique hotels with up to date amenities. Front desk staff couldn't have been more professional and friendly. The FULL breakfast was a great addition, Craig in the breakfast room was great. All in all a wonderful experience. Extremely close to public transporation.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing spectacular for the money, management not friendly”
Reviews.Author: BMECTE
Reviews.Content: Usually I'm in agreement with tripadvisor recommendations, but not this time. It's not that the hotel was too bad, but I don't understand how it could climb so high in the charts. In fact, the hotel class is marked two stars, which it is, so the question is if you're willing to pay $200+ per night in two star hotel? We had a "suite" which is actually the same size room devided into two small areas to accomodate our family of 3. The room was small but clean, with the contemporary design. They charge about $20 for additional person and $25 for parking. They serve breakfast downstairs which is average. I would put three stars for this hotel if not one circumstance. We have booked two nights in this hotel but decided to leave after one night. I checked with the stuff if it would be possible to cancel the second night stay soon after we arrived. He told me that there was no problem if we check out before 12PM the next day. The next day during the check out they didn't give me the receipt, saying that the full amount for 2 nights has been already charged by expedia, and that I had to call them to resolve the matter. After that, I had to call Expedia's representative who was cooperative, but explained, that they need to confirm the cancellation with the hotel management. After they communicated to the management, the management refused, so after wasting a couple of hours, I had to move back into the room in order not to loose money paid for the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel, excellent service, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: juliet60
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this fab little hotel. We were made very welcome, the staff were excellent, very helpful. The room was bright and airy and provided everything we wanted. The breakfast was spot on, especially the eggs cooked to order with the minimum of fuss. A lovely find in the heart of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you have a stay”
Reviews.Author: Shaun52
Reviews.Content: After planning a break in Canada we thought we would add a few days on in Vancouver. This was the best hotel we stayed in. The rooms are modern and stylish, with all the facilities needed, we had 2 televisions, so we could watch both in the lounge and bedroom if we wanted. Check in was speedy and service brilliant, with a city map provided. As for the breakfast included in your stay, wonderful. All of staff were striving to provide outstanding service at all times, and could always recommend something to explore in the city, I would strongly recommend hiring bikes and getting out there to explore Stanley park and the sea wall. We would not hesitate in booking this hotel on our return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRose10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight before leaving on an Alaskan cruise. The hotel had recently undergone an $11m renovation. It was beautifully and tastefully done. It was a bonus to find out it was the number 2 hotel in the city, but not at number 1&2 prices! The rooms were very comfortable and the bathroom was exceptionally appointed. The staff could not do enough for you. The pride they took in their establishment was evident by their customer service. The complimentary full breakfast was good and more than you would expect for complimentary. We lunched at the restaurant adjacent to the property (same owners, I believe) and that was also excellent. The location was what made us choose this hotel and we were not disappointed . Being there for such a short time we needed a good location and it was very convenient for Gas Town, Harbor Center and even a morning power walk to Stanley Park. If you are considering a stay in Vancouver this is definitely the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Yogi704
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the St Regis fo three nights and two nights pre and post our Alaska cruise, the bedrooms were excellent, comfortable, clean and attractive. The staff were all friendly and helpful, the location of the hotel is ideal for tourists. The only small complaint we had was traffic noise in our room at the front of the hotel. We would be pleased to stay at this hotel again if when we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “The St. Regis tops them all with value and service”
Reviews.Author: Thusknight
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor I chose the St. Regis-this is one place you get a lot for your money. The rooms were upscale with lots of amentities and the service by every staff member was exceptional. The location is great especially for cruise goers.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experiences in a hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: SusanKLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the St. Regis for one night prior to going on a cruise -- seriously one of the most enjoyable stays in a hotel I've had! The most comfortable bed and pillows, wonderful staff, free internet and breakfast, and the location was incredibly convenient! We spent the evening after arrival in Gastown, walking distance, and before boarding the ship decided we had plenty of time to catch a bus (only a few blocks away) to Stanley Park where we walked around for quite a while. I'm almost afraid to tell people about this place for fear I won't be able to get in next time LOL -- thank you so much, St. Regis!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated for shopping and sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Barbara048
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful newly refurbished hotel, with extremely friendly and helpful staff. Our room was very modern and chic, with extra touches like bottled water and chocolates on our pillow, and bathrobes. We were very surprised and pleased by the proximity of Robson St and Granville St shopping areas, and the hotel shares a block with the Hudson Bay Company store. Gastown and Canada Place were so close by, we could not have chosen a better area to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Homestyle friendliness with an up to date atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: conventionIndiana
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a convention where part of our business opted to stay here and part stayed in a MUCH higher priced hotel, and over and over again we commented on how glad we were that we stayed here. The staff made you feel like they had known you for years.They were friendly, helpful, always taking the time to say hello and asking how your day was and what they could do to help. The rooms were modern,very clean and had the nice touch of free bottled water and chocolates on the pillows. The free Hot breakfast was more than you would expect from an upscale hotel. It was close to the subway,shopping and only a 10 minute maximum walk to the convention center. I would highly recommended this hotel for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “A first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: wotacroc
Reviews.Content: We selected the St Regis primarily for its close proximity to Canada Place, as we were going on a cruise the following morning. From the moment we entered the hotel, we were greeted by very professional and friendly staff at the lobby. Special mention should be made of staff members Breanne and Tony, who went out of their way to ensure we knew where to go for sightseeing. The rooms were top class and a full breakfast was included in the accommodation price. We liked the St Regis that much that we returned for a further two days after our cruise. If you want accommodation near the hub of downtown Vancouver, then I would highly recommend the St Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel, parking tricky”
Reviews.Author: SVTraveler1
Reviews.Content: new room looks great, nice bathroom, comfortable bed. could see why it's so popular for business travelers. fair rate, good value! only blocks to downtown. breakfast was very good, Craig (staff) was very helpful in recommending great places to eat and see. on parking - there isn't a valet and parking is down the "st regis alley" off of Dunsmuir. It's very tricky and not well marked. We went around the block a couple of times before the wife went in and got the directions. once in, the garage is very nice and safe.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a very nice hotel, great location, service incredible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joshuaws26
