Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a cruise. We stayed May 28. From the time we came to the hotel, (we were about 4 hours before check in) we were greeted and treated wonderfully. The beds are AWESOME!!!! The hotel was about a 10 minute walk from the cruiseship port. We were kindly greeted immediately, and the 2 gentlemen at the reception desk stored our luggage for us and gave us great ideas for what to do in the city. We came back around 2 o'clock and checked in, our luggage had already been moved to our room. The staff was great. The room was very clean, great decor and design. It was a little on the small side but that didn't make a difference to us. We talked to staff about what to do that night, they recommended a great pizza place just around the corner. They also let us know which areas to avoid for our safety. The next morning we were going to have breakfast thinking it would be your typical continental breakfast, boy were we wrong. They did have a continental breakfast (which was great) but they also have bacon and eggs to order for FREE!!! The restaurant where the FREE breakfast was was a lot bigger than expected and very nice. There was a gentleman and a woman who made sure everything was ok and greeted every customer, letting us know if we wanted bacon and eggs just to let him know. Overall this was a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Best Boutique Hotel in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: travelingterry53
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vancouver on Saturday, May 16th, after a repositional cruise from Los Angeles. We took the Sky train station near the cruise terminal, 3 stops later we emerged at the Granville Station, which is about 1/2 block away from the St. Regis. We were pleasantly surprised at our 1 bdrm suite on the 5th floor, just off the lift. It had a living room, with business table, a nice big window that kept out the street traffic noise and a flat screen T.V. The bedroom wasn't overly large, but contain a comfortable Queen bed with dresser and flat screen T.V., and another large modern window with screen & shades. The bathroom was wonderful, with Travetine tile, furniture like vanity, a tall tiled shower with tiled seat. It had volumes of Hot water, my wife liked that a lot. It had a nice resturant on site, which we ate at that evening. The morning breakfast was delicious and plenty of fruits & pastries. It had free internet down in the lobby. The elevator is a bit small but prompt. This will be our hotel in Vancouver whenever we come to visit. Would be super for the 2010 Olympics.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJCCleveland_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St Regis for 2 nights, before and after a cruise. The hotel is fantastic, the staff are excellent and the rooms are so comfortable. It's great to have free internet use downstairs in the lobby, very handy for on line check ins.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for Business Travel!”
Reviews.Author: TraveleretteToronto
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the St. Regis a number of times over the past few months and it's always been a fantastic experience. The staff are incredible, very helpful and friendly. The rooms are newly renovated, super clean and comfortable. Room service is delicious and the free breakfast in the morning is outstanding. I can't say enough great things about this hotel, it is perfect in every way. It is particularly good for business travel. Being a solo woman traveler it can be difficult carrying heavy bags with my work supplies. The front desk staff have helped me carry my bags on numerous occasions in and out of cabs, without me having to ask. They have the best internet service I have ever experienced, and I've stayed in a lot of hotels. They have a mini business center in each room with has a number of outlets and plug in internet (they also have wireless) in a convenient set-up. The plug in internet is really helpful because it is super fast, way faster than any wireless available at other hotels. Great location for business travel, I could walk to basically all of my appointments. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “More than happy...”
Reviews.Author: mfwspr
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a saturday evening and were promptly met by the bellman at the curb outside the hotel. He took our bags and check in was seamless. The hot and cold breakfast was very tasty and kind to our budget (free!). They make their own muffins each day and they are delicious. The hotel offers a great location as a starting point for exploring the city. It is within walking distance of many nearby attractions and less than 1 minute from the subway. We would stay there again happily.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Boutique Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: GoingEverywhere
Reviews.Content: You will love the St. Regis Hotel. This small boutique hotel is centrally located in Downtown Vancouver and is an incredible value for the price. The newly remodeled rooms look great, and the beds are fantastic. I had a better night's sleep than I've had in quite some time. PRICE: We booked a "Smart Double" from the hotel's website for just $109CAD. For that, you get about the best location imaginable and a lot of extras. This hotel doesn't nickel and dime you either; there was a generous supply of free bottled water in the room, free internet, chocolates on the bed, even a free cooked to order bacon and eggs breakfast. ROOM: Our room was a bit on the small side but had a big bathroom with two sinks and good lighting. There was a large shower but no bathtub. The shower itself worked well and there seems to be no plumbing problems in this historic building. Our room was nicely decorated with the most comfortable beds! And the room also had a plasma TV. I don't believe they actually subscribed to any HD channels to go with it, but we had full cable TV -- about 50+ channels. INTERNET: The room is wired for all this stuff, and internet access is free; but the computer stayed at home on this trip. To check email or use the web, you can use the business center off the lobby and save yourself the trouble of lugging around the laptop. BREAKFAST: They serve breakfast until 10AM on weekdays, and even later on the weekends! So many places cut off breakfast early, so this was a pleasant surprise. In addition to made-to-order bacon and eggs, you can also grab toast and pastries from the continental breakfast bar. We had good table service. Our waiter brought us coffee and even my toast when it was done toasting. PARKING: The hotel charges $25/day for self-parking in the garage of the building next door. It wasn't totally clear to us how to get in and out of the garage on foot until we left, but otherwise, the parking was reasonable and included in and out privileges until check-out time. We wanted to stay in our parking spot after check-out (to see more of the city) and the hotel staff happily obliged. LOCATION: The St. Regis is close to everything! We walked to Granville Island and to the West End. It's a bit of a walk to go as far as Denman Street, but walking down Robson is a great way to spend a few hours. Canada Place and Pacific Centre are literally within a few blocks. Gastown is just a few blocks in the other direction. You could walk to Chinatown -- several blocks east of the hotel -- but I'd recommend against it. The neighborhood between the hotel and Chinatown is a bit dicey, with addicts and prostitutes congregating. It's probably more annoying than anything, but not Vancouver's best side in any event. SKYTRAIN: The hotel is literally next door to the Granville Station, and that may be an option for getting around, along with Translink buses. I checked the prices and they sell day passes for something like $9CAD. You can buy them across the street at Shopper's Drug Mart. Buses, SkyTrain and SeaBus (to North Vancouver) are all included on this pass. I would emphatically recommend this hotel. The staff is helpful and pleasant, the location is awesome, the amenities are mostly included in the price, and the value for money is as good as it gets. What a great base for exploring Vancouver. PS -- I didn't mention the restaurants, but the hotel has its own bar and grill. They also have relationships with a couple of others, including the fancy Gotham Steakhouse next door. We didn't try any of the restaurants this time... maybe next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great before, Awesome now!”
Reviews.Author: NJB67
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the St. Regis for 10 years and waited patiently for the renovation to be finished last year. It was worth the wait. The rooms are fantastic - very modern, hi-tech and luxurious (and maybe a bit bigger than before?). Thankfully Juan is still there at the front desk -- he is the best Front Desk Man in Vancouver, bar none. And Dave the maintenance man is still there too, he's like everyones favourite uncle! All the new staff are completely fantastic as well; the GM, the breakfast room guy, Janet, etc. I love the downtown location, perfect for GM Place & BC Place, the business district and gastown. Next door to Pacific Centre Mall, too, if you're into malls. I never drive in Vancouver, way too much of a pain. If I had to though, the parking here is a bit awkward especially if you had young kids, bad weather etc. Would be great if the Airporter Shuttle could see their way to stop here, too (closest stop 2 blocks away). Was a bit reluctant to write this review as I preferred when the hotel was a bit more of an "unknown", it felt like I had a secret pass to the best hotel (AND price) in Vancouver; now it seems everyone will know. Fair is fair though, I read this site when I'm going to other cities, so welcome to Vancouver and enjoy the St. Regis Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: nibarius
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the hotel for two periods of 3 days with a two day trip to Seattle in between (room 503 and 319). Very nice rooms and good location of the hotel, just next to a sky train station and a few blocks away from Robson street with many shops and restaurants. What to like: + great and clean rooms. + friendly staff, especially Benjamin at the front desk (seems to work most evenings) who had great suggestions for restaurants. If you're going out for dinner and don't know where to go but know what kind of food you want ask him for advice, we did it three nights in a row and were delighted with the food every time. + Complementary water bottles on the room every day, great for days of shopping or sightseeing. + Good hot breakfast. + Wireleess internet worked great. Maybe not very high speed but much better than on most hotels. What's not that good: - A bit noisy rooms at night (traffic and loud people on the weekend). Did not disturb me but if you need complete quiet when you sleep you might have a bit of trouble. I don't know how this is compared to other hotels downtown, might be hard to get it completely quiet downtown. - Showers: No bathtub in room 503 but instead shower with many settings on the showerhead (normal, rain, champagne, jet, massage). Room 309 had a great bathtub but the showerhead was mounted on the wall with no settings and spread the water a bit too wide so the water pressure was a bit low. All in all, a great hotel and I will most likely stay there again if I visit Vancouver in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: I_MLeicester
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks like its been recently refurbished, nice decor, entertainment system, bed etc. Bathroom real nice and good complimentary toiletries, no bath but the shower more than made up for it. Real good breakfast included in the room rate but Tim Hortons is over the road if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED, LOVED, LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: GRACE_1001
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel, mainly because of what I had heard of the washroom. We prefer handheld showers in our hotels. The hotel definitely impressed us. We couldn't stop raving about the service and the quality for the value. The full hot breakfast was great as well, very filling, we weren't hungry until late afternoon. The bed was comfortable and cozy, the heated tile was a nice addition, and the toiletries were wonderful. The relaxing and quietness of the hotel's hallways and calming colors was a nice leisurely getaway. The only slip up is the parking, which is not very convenient as it is not in the building and the standard $25. Also the construction below woke me up at 4am, but thats okay, I still liked the hotel alot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: HTE2W8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent choice. The rooms speak for themselves with the pictures. The location is fantastic, next to Pacific Centre and centrally located downtown and next to Granville Street metro stop. The front desk staff were welcoming, they are able to do this because it is a small boutique hotel, so not a lot of people in and out. The wireless internet was free and fast. If you don't have wireless be sure to bring along a RJ45 cable, I always carry a short one just in case. They also offer a complimentary full breakfast, didn't take advantage because of my timing. The view from my room was of a roof, so not great, however the building is 5 floors so I don't think any room is going to have a great view especially in the centre of downtown Vancouver. You can purchase a temp membership to the Steve Nash gym next door, I would have liked to use this but the gym wasn't open late enough on weekends for me to use it. Parking is in the condo building next door on P1 so not directly linked to the hotel, though it would only take 5 minutes from leaving the hotel to your car door. The hotel also had a nice touch of leaving a welcome card and the business card of the general manager in an envelope on the bed when you first enter, it was hand written as well, so a nice gesture. They also replaced the pillow chocolate mint and complimentary water bottles daily. The hotel also has an environmental policy in place which I appreciate. All in all I would definitely stay there again and recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dottykid
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the St Regis. The front desk staff were helpful, informative and went out of their way to make sure every aspect of the stay was hassle free. The rooms have just been redone and are comfortable, simple and well fitted, with an exquisite bathroom. No bath, but a huge shower and so more space than usual. Safe in each room which easily fits a laptop. Flat screen TV, free wireless internet , and a complimentary business centre with printing facilities. Excellent breakfast, mixture of continental and cooked. The hotel is very close to Robson St and the Waterfront, and a nice 15min walk to Stanley Park and Granville Island market. I wouldnt stay anywhere else in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at St. Regis”
Reviews.Author: RaleighMAD
Reviews.Content: We thought it was a great deal to stay at St. Regis for $140, however we found out this St. Regis is not a part of the "real" St. Regis. I knew it was too good to be true. In the end though, it was a wonderful stay with very nice rooms, good breakfast and friendly service. We would definitely stay there again. Parking is a little inconvenient, since it is a block away, and they charge you $25 for it. Overall we really like it, the renovation is very well done.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the majority of it, especially the breakfast, but room was freezing!”
Reviews.Author: jenneetriht
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, amazing breakfast. Have to say that the custom breakfast (any type of eggs, bacon/ham/sausage, potatoes) was the best part. Only complaint that my room was freezing no matter how high I turned the thermostat.

Reviews.Title: “Luxery and friendlyness for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Martin020029
Reviews.Content: We visited the St. Regis this month, stayed 6 nights. We really enjoyed our stay. Nice room, beautifully decorated with a nice bathroom and very good shower. Very nice breakfast. Wireless internet access that worked perfectly. The friendliness of all of the St. Regis staff struck us most. They took the time to give us advice on where to go and what to do. Everyone we ever spoke to the hotel was extra nice and polite. We really recommend this hotel, it's fantastic, great value and perfectly located.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of downtown”
Reviews.Author: swisstraveller70
Reviews.Content: We visited the St. Regis last month and really enjoyed our stay. Our room was beautifully decorated and the bathroom is gorgeous with a huge shower. What was exceptional though, was the friendliness of all of the St. Regis staff. The hotel manager left a hand-written, personal note in our room and always took the time to give us advice on where to go and what to do. Everyone we ever spoke to the hotel was extra nice and polite. We really recommend this hotel, it's absolutely fantastic, great value and perfectly located. Thank you to all of the St. Regis staff for making our stay so amazing. Book directly online for better deals, if you book through a hotel search site, they take 25% of what you pay the hotel. Something we did, and didn't know.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekened getaway with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: michelle_mxoxo
Reviews.Content: a great central location.. not to far from the things you always need. the staff were very helpful with all of our needs and i found the smaller hotel a more personal feel rather than a big hotel chain. Very clean! and great renovations !! good attention to detail. A must see and stay .. would defineatly recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family

Reviews.Title: “a good location and a nice hotel in a fun city !”
Reviews.Author: thomasannen
Reviews.Content: we booked this room while at the four seasons in whistler. the st. regis mentioned it was an historic hotel that had been recently renovated. we booked one day and then hoped that if was good to go ahead and book another night. the hotel was very nice and the new rooms and lobby were beautiful. very expensive remodel with flat screen tv's and state of the art elecrical hook ups for gaming, portable music players, and you could hook up your cameras and watch on big screen tv. they also had wifi and a hookup for direct internet at desk in room.bathrooms were really nice. you should ask to see your room as they were little different depending on location. security was great and we were right downtown where we could go into the shopping mall within a half block. the robson street shopping district was just a few blocks and was fun for all of us. the employees at the desk were very pleasant and helpful and knew the area quite well. breakfast was fresh, good and over the top in service and included in the room rate. they wait on you and will prepare you a nice basic breakfast along with the usual continental selection. there was also 2 really good places within the block to eat and a bar that also served food next door. across the street was a drug store and tim hortons. they have underground private parking that was very safe and easy to get in and out. we did book another night later in the week. when we called the desk with any needs, service was quick. all in all this turned out to be quite a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, convenient--we will go again”
Reviews.Author: acornsoup
Reviews.Content: The location is almost perfect--about three blocks from Robson, a great shopping location in Downtown Vancouver. Right next to Hudson Bay, Canada's oldest department store. The only problem is that you need to park on the street in order to pick up the parking key, and the parking isn't clearly marked, which in Downtown Vancouver leads to complicated driving. The staff was friendly and accomodating, especially the breakfast staff. The eggs and potatoes at breakfast were excellent! We had a small room, but it was very clean with a good size bathroom which was well-lit with a nice shower and lots of counter space. There were even chocolates on the pillows... Overall, the rate was excellent for a hotel with a great location, staff, and food.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location with personable service”
Reviews.Author: Bri_ManEdmonton
Reviews.Content: The St. Regis was a very nice hotel and I would stay there again no problem. There were eateries, drug stores, and other nice amenities close by as well as all the normal downtown Vancouver decore. The breakfast hall was very nice with great staff who ensured that you had enough to eat before you started your day. Good job St. Regis !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the St Regis”
Reviews.Author: Adelaidian_2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the St Regis Hotel in Vancouver for 8 nights. We had a wonderful time. The whole hotel has been completely renovated and is beautiful. A beautiful room with a lovely bathroom awaited us, with chocolates as a nice added touch. From the moment we walked through the door we were blown away by the way the staff treated us. They were extremely helpful and friendly at all times. Nothing was too much trouble and they were very knowledgeable about transport, the cost of buses etc and almost anything else we needed to know. Add to that the fact that the hotel is in easy walking distance to all the best shopping (Pacific Center Mall is less than a block away) and lots of good eating places and we could not have stayed at a better place, particularly for the price. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Downtown area of Vancouver for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations make this place a steal”
Reviews.Author: JoeHawaii
Reviews.Content: Seemed this place was still in the midst of renovations, but I absolutely loved it. The tasteful renovations, service of staff and central locality make this place a diamond in the rough and such a steal for the room rates offered. I stayed for 3 days and it was perfect for what I wanted to do, simply chill out after a week in the snow in whistler. Shopping was simply a block or two away and if u wanted to check out metro town it was a sky train away which is located only metres from the front door of the hotel. I cannot fault this hotel and what it offers, everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: DaisyWicklow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the St. Regis in downtown Vancouver in September 2007. This hotel is conveniently located to the waterfront, gastown, stanley park etc without the added expense of a waterfront hotel. The room was very spacious, and the en suite was quite big. There is a pub, which does good food right beside the hotel. There is a carpark on the same block with easy access. The staff were very friendly, the only draw back was the one lift but I believe this hotel is now undergoing extensive renovations for the forthcoming winter olympics and I presume a second lift will be installed.

Reviews.Title: “good centre town option”
Reviews.Author: pkpj
Reviews.Content: Good centre of town option.Not very expensive with good size rooms bathroom etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: proudy74
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights staying at the St Regis and I was really impressed with the value for money we got. It's central location is ideal for getting to all of the main attractions in downtown Vancouver, either on foot, bus or light rail. Our booking included breakfast which many hotels don't now include as part of the fee, and the breakfast itself was fabulous. There was a wide variety of things to choose from - cereals, mountains of fruit, yoghurt, bread, muffins. The only annoying thing here was that you could only use the lift to access the breakfast room which meant sizeable queues at times just to go back to your room! The room itself was comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good deal and somewhere to base themselves for the duration of their stay in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Room”
Reviews.Author: Vicol
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for 2 nights and we arrived mid afternoon and registered. When we went to our room the room began to vibrate and we looked out the back window to see if we were on a train line. We weren't but we soon realised that our room was next to the lift and was the noisiest that we had ever encountered. We immediately notified reception of our concern and requested a move thinking it would not be a problem as we knew the hotel wasn't full. We were wrong. It appears that is not there policy and we requested to speak to the manager whose name was "Suni". He point blank refused even though we indicated that we didn't believe anybody could sleep under those conditions but to no avail. The lift was going all night and needless to say we were correct in predicting the lack of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - apart from room 400!”
Reviews.Author: Revelstone
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate for this hotel and stayed 4 nights. We were put into room 400 at first and it was TINY!! (See photo). The TV cabinet was in front of the window with a chair in front of it so that you couldn't open the drawers. If you moved the chair out of the way, you couldn't get into the bathroom! We could barely walk round the bed and couldn't put our suitcases anywhere that didn't block the door. Not a very good start. We complained and were told that they were full that night but they could move us the next day. We moved into a much bigger room with a fridge, large bathroom and two double beds. It was lovely, and we then started to really enjoy our stay. The hotel is in an excellent location with a great bar next door and a starbucks the other side. The free breakfast was more than adequate and a bonus for a city centre hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel but make sure you're not in room 400!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Bearsearch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in the middle of August. Great central location without being too noisy. The hotel was great value (booked through the internet for about £57 a night B&B) - other hotels seemed to be considerably more expensive and weren't any better located. The rooms were fine. Breakfast was a bit busy around the 9:00 deadline, but not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good, reasonably priced hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 2young_travellers
Reviews.Content: We spent two night here in July 2007. The hotel is in a lovely heritage building very close to Robson Street and all the other central parts of the city. The rooms were quite small but the decor was modern and the air conditioning worked! The hotel is real value for money in a city where you can pay a lot of money for a hotel room. Breakfast is served in the basement area and is a help-yourself affair. My husband was disappointed that there was no hot food but I really enjoyed the continental food on offer (toast, yoghurt, fresh fruit and muffins). Staff were very helpful. We walked from the hotel to the bike hire shop close to Stanley Park and spent most of the day riding around the park and the city's sea wall. This was a highlight for us as you get to see most of the city and see all the health-conscious Vancouver residents as they roller-blade past you. Would stay at this hotel again if we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly happy and satisfied, but parking expensive”
Reviews.Author: dealfinder
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Our group had to book a lot of rooms last minute because our previous reservations fell through. This hotel is not ostentatious, it is actually difficult to find their front entrance, but the staff is very friendly, the rooms are comfortable, particularly for the rates they charge, and it's a good downtown location. They know what amenities are needed and how to keep costs down. All the rooms are labeled "suites". There are down comforters, and large pillows. We had a double room which included 2 full size beds (some other hotels in Vancouver have double rooms with twin size beds), a couch, bureau, TV, and desk. Shampoo and soap are in dispensers attached in the tub. Our room was decently sized, but I think all the room layouts are different. The rooms have window AC units, which is difficult to use, because you have to keep the curtains open to get any airflow, and there was an office building across the street, so you have to weigh the options between a cool room and privacy. We had brought a little mini fan which helped to circulate the air. You need a key card to access the elevators and the stairwells are locked most of the day, so the building is pretty secure. Breakfast is included in the morning in a lower level eating area. It is the same everyday: assortment of breads and muffins, fresh fruit, yogurt, granola, coffee, hot chocolate, and tea. If you want something hot, there is a Tim Hortons across the street and Starbucks attached to the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance to Gastown, Pacific Centre Mall, and the convention center/cruise dock. The only negative thing about this hotel is there is no onsite parking. They recommend you park your car at Pacific Centre Mall, which is the most expensive place (though secure) at $22/day (if you park on Sunday it is only $4, but you have to move your car by 5am the next day). I found many lots within walking distance that were considerably cheaper around Gastown, where I could park my car for $12/day (near Cordova and Cambie).

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - From Texas”
Reviews.Author: Helo1
Reviews.Content: The St Regis Hotel was perfect for our 5 day vacation in Vancouver. The location is excellent, less than 10 minute walk from shopping, the museum, and several outstanding restaurants. The hotel is extremely clean and we felt very secure the entire time. All rooms are no-smoking, beds were very comfortable - bathrooms are a bit small but very nicely up-dated. (We'd recommend the 4th or 5th floor if you are a light sleeper.) Front desk staff was cordial, but not overly knowledgable or helpful (with the exception of Prisca - she was excellent). Free continental breakfast was not elaborate but was a nice touch. No parking at the hotel, but paying $10-15 per night to park one block away in a very secure garage was not overly inconvenient. The hotel is flanked by a Starbucks, a Convenient store, and Jesters pub putting all of life's necessaties 60 seconds away! We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the action!

Reviews.Title: “Super St Regis”
Reviews.Author: westerton
Reviews.Content: Just recently arrived back from a great trip to Vancouver where we stayed at the St Regis Hotel. Managed to book this for £48 per room per night on the Internet which also included a complimentary breakfast. The breakfast consisted of toast, fresh fruit, cereal and yoghurt. It was a self service affair - to be honest it wasn't the best breakfast I have ever had, the breakfast room was OK, a bit dull but clean and tidy and the food was of an average standard but for the price we paid we were more than happy with it. The hotel staff were very pleasant and the our room was a good size, plenty of storage space, very big bed and a good sized bathroom. Also the maids were in every day to change towels and tidy up and the air conditioning unit worked great. The location is also great, there is a good pub (Jesters) next door and a Starbucks - also very close to the Skytrain (a few steps from the front door) and we were within walking distance of lots of restaurants and attractions. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Completely average”
Reviews.Author: Gustovo
Reviews.Content: Accepted AAA for a discount which was a plus. Rooms were small but clean. Housekeeping let themselves into our room without knocking 2 hours prior to check out which was rather alarming. I have stayed here before and it is very close to Chinatown and Gastown if you are interested in visiting those areas. Comparable pricing to other hotels in the area; customer service is not their main concern.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: flutterbye99
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for downtown Vancouver. However the breakfast, though good, was way too early finishing at 9! And was not impressed by having to pay for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rons1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over Easter Weekend and it was a very nice hotel, staff was very friendly and helpful. Only made it to the free breakfast once, but it was nice with a good selection of foods. The area was decent and not run down, walking anywhere seemed safe. It also was close to where ever you wanted to be. We placed our reservations through a third party (connected to them from here on trip advisor just the name escapes me... began with an S). Only thing detracting for us; they were moving in new furniture over the weekend and it was a bit hard to use the elevator at times but I do envy those that came after the new furniture was installed, it looked very nice. I definately will try to stay there again when we go again. It was well worth the rate we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: AusAzimuth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem. It's the first 2* hotel I have stayed in - I've always stayed in 5* hotels but this time I was travelling with a friend who was on a tight budget. I was so surprised. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and had everything we needed. Although our room was on the main road I slept well and the small amount of noise didn't bother me. The hotel is in a very convenient location with lots of shops and restaurants close by. The staff were very helpful. If I ever visit Vancouver again the St Regis will definitely be my first choice for accommodation.

HotelInfo.Name: St. Regis Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 602 Dunsmuir Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6B 1Y6, Canada
